buginformation.summary: [preferences][templates] NPE in EditTemplateDialog
Create Class QuickFix doesn't create import [quick fix]
buginformation.description:
I2003-03-07
Using the "Create class" QuickFix, I created a class in a _different_ package. An import statement wasn't generated, resulting in an compile error.
Expected behavior: Eclipse should import the newly created class in case it is created in a different package.

buginformation.summary: __attribute__ is not supported (GCC)
Misleading syntax error diagnosis
buginformation.description:
Build 20030625 + JDT/Core HEAD 0703
If creating a file Enclosing.java with contents from bug 39506 , containing more than one file contents, the diagnose parser will signal a curious misplaced construct...

buginformation.summary: can't debug into class if file/class name identifier has _$$_
[misc] Javadoc view: Should always update to latest element
buginformation.description:
M2 testing
If the cursor is placed at an element that does not contain documentation, the view does not update and the documentation of the previous element is kept.
I think this is very confusing: If you don't follow the updating of the view, you don't realize that the doc does not correspond to the current element. You start reading and find out that this makes no sense. See also bug 40301 , that the current element should be rendered prominently on the first line.
An Idea might to be a 'lock' button on the view tool bar: If it is pressed, the view does then not follow the selection.

buginformation.summary: Compare with -> Each other is not enabled
buginformation.description:
Eclipse 3.0 M1 and Eclipse 3.0 I200306100800
Tried Suse 8.2 and Windows XP
1) Select two java files in the Packages View 2) From the context menu select Compare With. Note that the option "Each Other" is not enabled.
I use this Compare With Each Other feature all the time to check the consistency between platform implementations and to check the consistency between simlar components (such as TextTransfer versus RTFTransfer). Without it I can not use Eclipse 3.0 - going back to 2.1.

buginformation.summary: Subclasses of TextEditor can no longer create custom SourceViewers
buginformation.description: In 2.1M5, org.eclipse.ui.editors.text.TextEditor initializes a private field called fSourceViewerDecorationSupport inside of createSourceViewer. We're substituting a custom subclass of SourceViewer by overriding that method in our subclass of TextEditor. Unfortunately, this gives us a NPE when createPartControl is called later since TextEditor references that field in numerous places.

buginformation.summary: Read Only files: 2 dialogs from 'override methods' [code manipulation]
buginformation.description:
rc1
1. set a file to read-only 2. open the file in the editor, select an import statement 3. invoke 'override/implement methods' from the context menu 4. error dialog shows up, 'file is read only', press ok 5. second dialog comes up, invalid selection, select type...

buginformation.summary: [Navigator] Close project doesn't remove plus icon
buginformation.description:
RC2
1. Open Resources Perspective. 2. Select a Project and close it. Notice that the plus icon remains. Try to click on the + icon and it goes away.
Note, at one point I did get the icon to go away for the first project in the Navigator as a result of the Close action. I'm not sure what I did to get that to work, but it only worked for the first project.

buginformation.summary: Wrong build file generated when $os$ variables are specified
buginformation.description:
The build file generated for a plugin or a fragment which uses $os$, $ws$, etc. in its library name is bogus.
Indeed the variables are not expanded and so instead results in the creation of folders called $os.
The solution consists in replacing carefully the appearance of those values into the build.xml.
Here is an example of a bogus target:
<target name="$os$/win32.jar" depends="init" unless="$os$/win32.jar" description="Create jar: $os$/win32.jar."> <property name="destdir" value="${temp.folder}/$os$/win32.jar.bin"/> <delete dir="${temp.folder}/$os$/win32.jar.bin"/> <mkdir dir="${temp.folder}/$os$/win32.jar.bin"/> ... </target>

buginformation.summary: Quick diff results vary after reloading
buginformation.description:
Eclipse 3.0M2
Writing a quick diff provider that uses a remote file as reference, it looks like the quick diff view is providing different results after reopening the file. Example:
Reference: 01: /** 02: * First Line 03: * Second Line 04: */
If you delete the "second line" (03) then insert a line in front of "first line" (02), you get the following result:
01: /** 02: * 03: * First Line 04: */
02 and 03 will now be highlighted as "Changed lines". If you close the file and reopen it, line 02 will be displayed as "Added line" and at the bottom of 03 will be a "Delete line" indicator showing 02 and 03 as deleted content.

buginformation.summary: Opening a second instance of Eclipse will corrupt .metadata, causing many problems
buginformation.description:
If you open a second instance of Eclipse, the next time you run Eclipse many thing will be broken. Removing .metadata will eliminate the problems (although you, of course, need to reimport your projects then).
Some problems seen: - Attempting to Search gives the error "No Search Extensions plugged into workbench or all search pages disabled." - Attempting to go to the Update Manager results in "Unable to instantiate view: org.eclipse.update.ui.UpdatesView" - Attempting to go to a project's property pages gives "No property pages for <project name>" - On and on and on...
To Reproduce: 1. Open Eclipse 2. Open a second instance of Eclipse 3. Close the second instance of Eclipse 4. Close the first instance of Eclipse 5. Open Eclipse again and it will be erroneous

buginformation.summary: "Content assist" action definition ID should be in the platform
buginformation.description:
The "Content Assist" action is defined in JDT UI's plugin.xml. This action is presented to the user as being generic - the name doesn't imply that it's specific to Java and the scope is Global - but other editors can't make use of this ID when JDT UI isn't around.
This action ID should either be moved into the Platform so that other editors can tie into the key binding or the action should be renamed so that the user knows it won't affect all editors.

buginformation.summary: Status bar space for "read only" in german too short
buginformation.description: The statusbar of eclipse shows the "read only" in the lower right. Translated in german it is "Schreibgesch眉tzt", which consists of more letters than "read only", so you see only "Schrei...h眉tzt".

buginformation.summary: ajde apis are unnecessariy coupled to swing
buginformation.description: The AJDE APIs are coupled to javax.swing by org.aspectj.ajde.EditorManager. The EditorManager needs to be refactored, have swing specific parts moved to org.aspectj.ajde.ui.swing and org.aspectj.ajbrowser.

buginformation.summary: refactor change method signature [refactoring]
buginformation.description: refactor change method signature does not recognise modifiers like static, synchronised etc

buginformation.summary: Provide build.xml target to export binary plugin.
buginformation.description:
It's been noted that most Eclipse teams still maintain exportplugin.xml build files for building their plugins locally instead of using PDE's generated build.xml file.
The only real problem that the build.xml file has is that it dumps the output into the input directory. The nice thing about the exportplugin.xml files is that they build the plugins and output the binary plug-in in a plugin-export directory that is at the same level as the workspace, not inside it.
I would gladly change to using PDEs build.xml files if there was a way to get the same behavior. Either by default or by passing in a property to specify where the binary plug-in should be output.

buginformation.summary: keybindings not working in StyledText when in plugin (but working externally)
buginformation.description:
I have an SWT view that uses a StyledText control and binds ctrl-c to copy, ctrl-v to paste, etc. It works find outside of eclipse, but when I run it in a plugin, it gets the keypress for the control key, but no subsequent keypresses, so control-c comes in as just a press of the control key. I have tried binding SWT.HardKeyDown, but that doesn't register either.
I tried running the external app using the libraries in the eclipse distribution, and it worked fine. I also tried running the plugin in my regular eclipse (instead of as a run-time workbench) and that didn't fix the behavior.
might this be related to bug #40798 ?
I'm using gentoo with gtk+2.2.2 and eclipse build 200307230800
If anyone wants to test with my plugin, email me and I'll send it (it's a meg and bugzilla seems to have trouble with my web browser's file uploading -- using MozillaFirebird, BTW).

buginformation.summary: Open Declaration opens class declaration for local variables
buginformation.description:
When the cursor is positioned on a local variable representing an object, and "Open Declaration" is selected, e.g. from the pop-up menu, Eclipse opens the file where the variable's class is declared. Instead, Eclipse should just jump to the position of the local variable's declaration.
When the local variable has a primitive type, nothing whatsoever happens.

buginformation.summary: [EditorMgmt] Eclipse crashes when maximizing java editor when trying to load file
buginformation.description:
Eclipse crashes when trying to maximize a Java editor. At the time, the editor was open on a file that had not yet loaded. There was significant background load on Eclipse. I haven't been able to reproduce this with some quick tests, but it's hard to generate the same level of load.
STEPS: ----- 1.) Open a Java file in a Java editor. 2.) Move that Java file from one project to another -- preferrably breaking as many things as possible (e.g., 500+ compile-time errors). 3.) A stub opens in the editor view for the newly-moved file. 4.) Immediately double-click on the title bar for the moved file to cause it to maximize.
OBSERVED RESULTS: ---------------- The window maximizes, but is empty. It appears as though the contents are still being loaded by Eclipse. The virtual machine then crashes with a small dialog box. Unfortunately, I wasn't running from a terminal, so I have no additional output.

buginformation.summary: ResizeTracker needs a disabled cursor and default cursor for intial state
buginformation.description:
When using the ResizeTracker, it doesn't have a disabled cursor set at ctor time (whereas the DragEditPartsTracker does). When the current command is not executable, the cursor remains the same (the default cursor) thus not providing the correct feedback to the user.
Also... when you first select the resize handle, the tracker is in the initial state (command = null) and at this point the default cursor should be returned instead of the disabled cursor which is the default behavior inherited from AbstractTool (see AbstractTool.calculateCursor().

buginformation.summary: [Live Sync View] crash in Eclipse causes remote tree to be wrong.
buginformation.description: M2 Eclipse crashed and when it restarted there were several conflicts and incoming changes that were invalid changes. In one cases, the remote was 1.14 and the local 1.15 and the sync view showed as an incoming change. after closing/re-opening the view the sync states shown were valid.

buginformation.summary: Option to export and import break points at the Breakpoints view
buginformation.description: Please add an option to export and import break points from the break points view. So, it will be possible to share the same advanced breakpoint settings (i.e hit count, enable condition and probably other settings) between developers.

buginformation.summary: Background color problem
buginformation.description: When changing the background color on the Java > Editor > Syntax page from "System Default" to "Custom", and then selecting a solid black, many of the Eclipse edit control backgrounds that display code, such as the "Externalize Strings" wizard's "Context" edit control and the Templates edit controls, don't make use of that black background. This makes the contents of those backgrounds difficult to read.

buginformation.summary: Installing patch via New Updates search doesn't respect missing optionals
buginformation.description:
Problem: Errors are reported when trying to apply a fix in a valid situation. Installing from a bookmark works, but installing via New Updates search does not.
Scenario: FtrA includes optional FtrB. If FtrA gets a fix applied then installing that fix may fail if optional FtrB is not installed.
Steps to reproduce: Install only FtrA and not the optional FtrB. Use Help > SoftwareUpdates > NewUpdates to search for fixes. It reports that a patch for FtrA is available. Attempt to install it. You get an error message saying that the ftrB plugin is not found.
What's going on: During an install from a bookmarked site the user is shown the "optional features" panel. Since FtrB isn't installed, that choice is not selected by default. However, when installing via "New Updates", this panel is bypassed, and it seems that the default selections in that case includes FtrB.
I have a working demo of this available if needed.

buginformation.summary: Getting fragments for a bundle is not implemented
buginformation.description: Gettting fragments was is implemented on BundleContext... and is not available on Bundle.

buginformation.summary: Preference pages don't use dialog font specified
buginformation.description:
Eclipse 3.0 I20030806
The preference pages of the team support do not consistently use the configured dialog font. Instead, parts are displayed with the default font.

I20030806 Panther (10.3, 7B28)
see attached screenshot

buginformation.summary: AntConsoleColorProvider should be marked as readOnly
buginformation.description: The AntConsoleColorProvider is not marked as readOnly.

buginformation.summary: [formatting] provide a basic text/sgml formatter
buginformation.description:
Have a basic text formatter that converts leading n-spaces to tabs, and maybe leading tabs to n-space.
Current plugins like eclipsetidy may be ok for SGML like, but there is no plain text n-space-to-tab formatters.
If it can do a quick parse of SGML like files and arrange the indentation too, that would be great. Not a full XML editor. Just the formatter. Thanks.

buginformation.summary: Request for ProjectSelectionDialog to be made public API
buginformation.description: We're looking for a project selection dialog exactly like ProjectSelectionDialog used in the classpath launch configuration tab, but it's internal API. Is there any chance this could be made public API for 3.0 ?

buginformation.summary: after failed move IFile left in a bogus state
buginformation.description:
20030813 after a move operation failed ("copy successful but failed deleting resource") i'm left with an IFile that returns 'false' to 'exists()' but its 'location.toFile().exists()' returns 'true'
this state results in a ResourceException when i try to create another file with the same name
because of that, CreateCompilationUnitOperation.executeOperation() assumes that the file does not exist and does not ask to 'force' when creating the file.
major - our test suites suffer from this

buginformation.summary: Assert Keyword
buginformation.description:
THe JDT willnot recognize 'assert' as a keyword, and will not compile it period. I would really apreciate it if you would add this keyword.
Thank you.

buginformation.summary: eclipse hangs during startup refresh of workspace
buginformation.description:
I noticed recently that eclipse seems to hang during startup. My CPU meter seems to be running at hundred percent, but nothing is happening.
I noticed that this seems to be happening only when I create certain class files in my project output path (using the jdk version as used by the eclipse workbench), outside of eclipse and then try to refresh my workspace - by either restarting eclipse, or right clicking on my project root directory and hitting refresh.
The result is that I get the Progress Information dialog which is stuck, with nothing happening.
This is really counter productive, it would be nice if there is a way to prevent this from happening.

buginformation.summary: PDE JUnit: Would like to be able to enable debug tracing
buginformation.description: The Run-time workbench launcher supports the enabling of debug tracing. Could the PDE Junit launcher support this as well. There have been several times in the past when I wanted to enable tracing to better understand a test failure.

buginformation.description:

buginformation.summary: breakpoints no longer visible in overview ruler
buginformation.description:
20030813+0818export breakpoints are no longer visible in the overview ruler of the editor
major for me

buginformation.summary: Runtime Arguments improperly passed
buginformation.description: When running a JAVA configuration, if you specify a "Program Argument" within quotations, the quotations can be dropped when the arguments are passed to the JRE. For instance- if you specify an argument "*", the main() loop of the target class should receive the a String with the a single asterix as its only character. Instead, the asterix is interpretted as a UNIX *, and the args[] array will contain every single filename within the home directory. Conversly, this behavior probably should exist if you simply specified an asterix as a program argument (without the quotes).

buginformation.summary: Inconsistent wizard plugin wizard choice possible
buginformation.description: When creating a new plug-in project with the default plug-in structure, it is possible to check the option "Add support for resource bundles" and uncheck the option "Add default instance access". This creates a plugin class with a compiler error because the resource access code relies on the default instance access method.

buginformation.summary: NPE from breakpoint location verifier job
buginformation.description:
No "current" display if not in UI thread.
Thread [Worker-3] (Suspended (exception NullPointerException)) BreakpointLocationVerifierJob.run(IProgressMonitor) line: 98 Worker.run() line: 61

buginformation.summary: TaskLinkManager needs to be cleaned up earlier
buginformation.description:
Currently the TaskLinkManager cleans up for a process when the launch is removed.
It should really clean up when the build finishes otherwise there can be a fair bit of "old" state left around taking up memory.

buginformation.summary: Exporting a deployable plugin does not hounour 1.4 compilation directive in compiler preferences
buginformation.description: I have developed a plugin that contains 1.4 'assert' statements. I have set the compiler preferences to 1.4. If I export a JAR file containing this code, everything works fine. If I export the plugin using 'Deployable plug-ins and fragments' I get an un specified compiler error while it builds the ZIP file. The only way to find out what the error is, is to install the plugin and then try to run it. After that the workspace/.metadata/.log file contains an entry that indicates an unresolved compilation error at the line that contains 'assert' statement.

buginformation.summary: [Preferences] Workbench/Fonts alignment
buginformation.description: The upper border of the "Preview" should be aligned with the upper border of the "Fonts" list box.

buginformation.summary: JDT package explorer doesn't trigger decoration for java files
buginformation.description:
This is with build 200308261317 and earlier
I have a plugin which provides a custom lightweight decorator.
In plain old navigator view, if I expand a directory with a bunch of files, the decorations appear as they are calculated if the resources don't already have decoration.
However, in the package explorer, if I expand a package to display source files, my decorator does not get triggered (breakpoint in decorate() never gets hit) to update the resources that don't currently have decorations. Actually - it is only java files that don't get decorated, other things like gifs/html/etc do get decorated. Also, for directories that are not packages, the package explorer does do the right thing and updates the decorators.

buginformation.summary: [DCR ] Support for non-Java source mapping
buginformation.description:
I'd like to see extensions to the JDT API in order to provide support for non- Java source that is translated into Java source (notably JSPs).
What I'm looking for is the JDT equivalent of com.sun.jdi.Location.lineNumber (String stratum) and sourceName(String stratum).
Alternatively, the concept of mapped source could be generalized and put in the org.eclipse.debug classes.

buginformation.summary: JDTUI tests don't finish
buginformation.description:
I20030827
The JDT/UI tests don't finish under Linux GTK. The main threads waits in org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ImplicitJobs$ThreadJob.joinRun.

buginformation.summary: Refactor/Move... on the Class Name should move class to another package [refactoring]
buginformation.description: Refactor/Move... on the Class Name should move class to another package.

buginformation.summary: "Preview>" should be "Preview..."
buginformation.description: I believe the style for buttons and menu items that brings up a new dialog is to append "..." to the text of the button or menu item -- and not ">"

buginformation.summary: problem with various dialog boxes: some data fails to appear + errors reported
buginformation.description:
When I try to open varuious dialog boxes (such as create new project, or change the settings under Window->preferences) entries in the dialogs fail to appear and a window pops up stating errors have been written to an error log (which I can't find!!).
STDOUT has the following data:
Unhandled exception caught in event loop. Reason: Failed to execute runnable (java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/debug/internal/ui/preferences/Combo FieldEditor)
*** Stack trace of contained exception *** Reason: org/eclipse/debug/internal/ui/preferences/ComboFieldEditor Unhandled exception caught in event loop. Reason: Failed to execute runnable (java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/debug/internal/ui/preferences/Combo FieldEditor)

buginformation.summary: Error building feature; Cannot find plug-in versions
buginformation.description: I have a situation where I am utilizing a third-party plugin (specifically, a WSAD plugin) which I'll call plugin "A". I wrote a plugin called "B" which uses one of the extensions from "A". Plugin "A" requires ["org.eclipse.ui" version="2.1.0" match="equivalent"]. However, I have eclipse 2.1.1 installed in which "org.eclipse.ui" is at version "2.1.1" and version "2.1.0" does not exist. Plugin "A" works correctly in my eclipse environment and even my plugin "B" works using its extension when running the Runtime Environment. The problem is when I try to build the feature. It spits up a message saying "Cannot find plug-in: org.eclipse.ui_2.1.0". Shouldn't this be able to find "org.eclipse.ui_2.1.1" since match="equivalent" was defined?

buginformation.summary: DebugEvaluationTests don't run if target is 1.2
buginformation.description:
When target is 1.2, the debug evaluation tests fail with a VerifyError. java.lang.VerifyError: (class: CodeSnippet_3, method: run signature: ()V) Incompatible type for getting or setting field at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method) at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:140) at org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.eval.target.CodeSnippetRunner.processClasses(CodeSnippetRunner.java:285) at org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.eval.target.CodeSnippetRunner$3.run(CodeSnippetRunner.java:385)
This is due to the update of the declaring class. It doesn't check the delegateThis is any and wrongly update the declaring class for field.

buginformation.summary: problems with projects having recursive links on linux
buginformation.description:
Overview Description: Eclipse has various problems with projects having recursive links on linux (e.g. "ln -s . core" created in the base directory of the project); sometimes resulting in system crashes caused by java.lang.OutOfMemoryErrors
Steps to Reproduce: 1) create a project with the following structure: projectdir/src/Test.java with projectdir as the base directory of the project and Test.java as a simple java file without having a package delaration 2) in projectdir create a recursive link, e.g. using cd projectdir ln -s . core 3) import the project to eclipse with the following steps: - File --> New --> Project - Select "Java Project" - Choose projectdir as the Project contents, enter a project name and press the "Finish" button
Actual Results: * 41 errors (The declared package doesn't match the expected package ...)! * try Search --> File Search with - Containing Text: Test - File name patterns: * which results in 41 search results * trying the same things in bigger projects multiplies the problems: a project having only about 100 source files tries to find search results in about 45.000 files; opening, closing, and deleting these projects sometimes results in system crashes caused by java.lang.OutOfMemoryErrors
Expected Results: * recursive links should be ignored or handled somehow
Build Date & Platform: SuSE Linux 8.1, Eclipse 3.0 M3 GTK (28 Aug 2003) System configuration: Athlon 2GHz, 512MB RAM,

buginformation.summary: [launching] Managing invalid launch configs
buginformation.description:
When the launch config index is initialized, we toss invalid configs from the index (but leave them in the file system). Examples are: (1) Configs with missing launch config types (due to missing plug-in) (2) Shared Configs which are out of sync with the local file system (remain tossed until refreshed)
Exceptions are logged to note the problems. However, the user is never notified of the problems. Should we, and how do we notify the user of these problems? (the problems are noticed by the debug core (non-ui) plug-in).

buginformation.summary: Eclipse 3.0 M3 - can't start Eclipse from the command line
buginformation.description:
OS 10.2 Eclipse 2.1 could be started from a shell using something like /<....>/Eclipse.app/Contents/MacOS/eclipse
In Eclipse 3.0 M3, Eclipse started this way is not properly initialized and can't be used (no event etc.).
Is there any way to workaround this?

buginformation.summary: Accessibility:Cannot move scroll bars with keyboard
buginformation.description:
Testing HATS (WSSD plugin).. WSSD V5.1: Cant move the editors scrollbars with the keyboard. We had to implement default scrolling increments, when clicking on the scroll buttons, that should not default to 1px.
We had to implement behavior to make the composite scroll to show controls therein as they were tabbed to
We think that this keyboard support for scrolling should be built into the framework.

buginformation.summary: Ctrl-Backspace performs wrong function
buginformation.description:
I'm using 3.0 M3 with JDK 1.4.2 on Windows XP.
The Ctrl-Backspace key sequence is bound to "Delete Previous Word" but when typed it actually performs "Delete Next Word" (which is correctly bound to Ctrl- Delete). There appears to be no way to get the "Delete Previous Word" action to actually do the right thing.
This is a regression from 3.0 M2, which worked fine.

Happens in M3 and M2.

buginformation.summary: No autobuild when referenced (input) jar file changes
buginformation.description:
I have two AspectJ projects. One that uses "Output Jar" and one that uses "Input Jars (aspects)" to reference the jar file of the first project. When making changes to the first project (which will also change the jar file), recompilation of the second project is not triggered.
expected behaviour: the second project wil be recompiled if any of the input jars changes.

buginformation.summary: new sync view resources layout switch
buginformation.description: Now there's the possibility to have three different looks in the new sync view, tree, compressed tree, table. There's the need that the "Toggle layout..." switch becomes a drop down menu that allows to choose between the three looks in a single step, instead of having to go into view preferences to change between tree/compressed tree mode. Or perhaps you could also add the three looks switch to the view context menu.

buginformation.summary: Errors in plugin.xml cause compilation errors
buginformation.description:
Hi there,
I don't know exactly if this is a bug or more a RFE. If you write a plugin and edit the plugin.xml so that it doesn't correspont to the XML schema, you'll get hundreds of compilation errors in your java files. There's a single error message that your schema isn't valid, but normally because of the huge amount of errors, you can't see it. It would be nice if the schema check occurs first and if the schema is invalid, you get an error message and the following compilation step doesn't find place, so that you see that there's a schema error and have to fix it.

buginformation.summary: When compiled from eclipse, unhandled exceptions in try - finally block are not detected.
setting keyword substitution mode doesn't work if CVS modul was checked out into a sub-folder of a project
buginformation.description:
Hi,
i've got a project and checked out 2 CVS moduls into subfolders of this project. So the project-folder itself isn't shared although Eclipse seems to use some dummy configuration. By the way: that is awful. That seems like a workaround to me and should be changed.
Here are the error message i got:
Problems encountered setting keyword substitution Expected RCS file /cvsroot/mvnforum/myvietnam/src/net/myvietnam/mvncore/exception/ExportException.java to be a child of remote root for this command /cvsroot/mvnforum/CVSROOT/Emptydir Expected RCS file /cvsroot/mvnforum/myvietnam/src/net/myvietnam/mvncore/exception/ImportException.java to be a child of remote root for this command /cvsroot/mvnforum/CVSROOT/Emptydir

buginformation.summary: CLASSPATH of Project wrong (NoSuchAlgorithmException)
buginformation.description:
I had a hard time getting an application running under Eclipse that works okay when running out of Eclipse with a batch file. With the help of somebody in the JDC Forum (that had a similar problem with Eclipse and solved it) I also was able to workaround it. Here's the problem:
using JCA by creating a secret key via a Algorithm didn't work (NoSuchAlgorithmException) when the application runs in Eclipse. The post of venkateshmj in http://forum.java.sun.com/thread.jsp ? forum=9&thread=430078&start=0&range=30#2024814 described the problem and its solution:
"The basic thing is, eclipse will not find the provider jar file which is in '% java_home%\jre\lib\ext'. So if you are using jboss-ide, open the jboss debug and configure the classpath. Disable 'use default class path'. Add sunjce_provider.jar and jce.jar to the 'User classes'. Remove sunjce_provider.jar from the 'Bootstrap Classes', retain jce.jar in 'BootStrap Classes'. "
As I don't use JBoss but a simple Java application, i had the same problem and the same workaround worked for me:
In "Bootstrap classes" of the application un configuration, I removed the default "JRE_LIB" entry and added (in replacement) rt.jar, jsse.jar, jce.jar to the "Bootstrap classes". with this change, the NoSuchAlgorithmException vanished and it worked.

buginformation.summary: Eclipse: JVM Terminated. Exit Code=1.

Thanks!

buginformation.summary: [RFP44] 4.2.5 Filter packages form base classloader
buginformation.description:
Otherwise known as "handling the endorsed libs"
Currently class load requests are first delegated to the parent class loader of the bundle (typically the Application ClassLoader or Bootstrap ClassLoader; we will call it the base classloader here). This is standard classloader practice. However, sometimes it may be desireable to 鈥渉ide鈥 packages provided by the base classloader so that a bundle may instead provide them.
For example, you are running the OSGi environment on J2SE. The J2SE installation provides a version of Xerces and the org.w3c.dom and org.xml.sax packages. However, these packages are an older version that the one needed by bundles running in the framework, e.g. the latest version of Xerces. So we want to install a bundle which exports a newer version of these packages. The framework must be configured to 鈥渉ide鈥 the old version of these packages from all bundles, so that the new versions of the packages can be instead used.

buginformation.summary: Palette desc saying 'no items for this editor' doesnt wrap on linux
buginformation.description:
Palette on the RHS which is configured for jsp files, I open a jsp and the palette has items in it, I open a xml file for which the palette has no items , the description saying 'Palette is not available for this editor' doesnt wrap when the palette view is narrow, so you cannot see the entire description. It wraps in windows 2000 so you can see the entire description.
Redhat 8.0 Linux, gtk <Note by matsu (Matsumoto, Hirotaka), I think this is etools palette or gef palette.

buginformation.summary: Table answers its Header as a child
buginformation.description: default

buginformation.summary: Multiple aspects difficult to manage
buginformation.description:
As soon as the Aspect Visualizer gets enough aspects so that most of them are colored gray it gets very difficult to see which aspect is which. Here are two features that I would like to see:
* If you right-click on a file in the graphical (not textual) view you should have an option to "Show only aspects present in this file." For example, when I wanted to see which aspects were affecting my file Foo.java I had to hide/show every aspect on the list to see if there was a change.
* There should be a feature to "recolor" the currently shown aspects. For example, if five of the aspects are gray, but they are the only ones shown it would be better to see a smart recoloring instead of having to do so manually myself.
These limiting factors affect the scalability of the Aspect Visualizer tool: it's less useful the more aspects you have.

buginformation.summary: No refresh when deleting edited unit
buginformation.description:
Build 20030930 in working copy owner mode
If the file being edited is deleted from the package explorer, then the view doesn't update. If the file isn't updated, then it correctly disappears.
The difference is that an edited file is in primary working mode for which no delta is broadcasted (virtual file system notion). However, the editor closes itself and discard the working copy which should then notify a removal delta.

buginformation.summary: Large Strings (8036 bytes) don't display correctly in console window with XP ClearType turned on
buginformation.description: If microsoft ClearType is turned on in XP sp1, large strings in java don't display correctly in the console or main editing windows. By large, I mean like 8096 bytes. Works fine if ClearType fonts are turn off (which is the default)and large strings sent to the console window will appear correctly. Turn cleartype back off and behavior will be seen again. Here is the procedure to turn cleartype on and off in xp sp1. It's very simple and makes fonts look great and easier on the eyes. " http://www.microsoft.com/typography/cleartype/tuner/1.htm?fname =% 20&fsize" Other than this minor annoyance, smaller more reasonable strings work fine...just hugh strings fail.

When the property sheet view is set to show categories the "Misc" category is not always expanded correctly.
1. Select an object that only has properties in the "Misc." category (so that the viewer will not show the "Misc" category explicitly). 2. Change selection to an object with properties in the "Misc" category and some other category (so that the viewer will show "Misc" and other categories explicitly).

buginformation.summary: Group widget doesn't pass focus when pressing mnemonic
buginformation.description:
Javadoc for org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Group#setText(String) says: "When the user presses a key sequence that matches the mnemonic, focus is assgned to the first child of the group.".
Unfortunately, that doesn't work.
Group.checkStyle (int style) begins with { style |= SWT.NO_FOCUS; ..., which prevents boolean mnemonicHit (char key) { return setFocus (); } from setting focus to the first child of the group.

buginformation.summary: Disabling of "definition" not making sense in Search dialog
buginformation.description:
In the search dialog, in the "limit to" group box, the "definitions" check box is only enabled when the "Function" or the "Method" check boxes in the "Search For" are checked. But if the "Any Element" is checked, the "definitions" group box is disable. The UI is confusing for the user.
Steps: 1) Go to the C/C++ Search dialog 2) Uncheck everything in the "Search For" group box The "definitions" check box is disabled in the "Limit To" group box. 3) Put a check in the "Function" check box. The "definitions" check box is enabled 4) Put a check in the "Any Element" check box. The "definitions" check box is enabled since the disabled "Function" check box still has a check in it. 5) Uncheck "Any Element" and then uncheck "Function" definitions become disabled. 6) Check "Any Element". definitions is still disabled.
The UI is ambiguous to the user.

buginformation.summary: Logic example has convoluted code in LogicSubPart
buginformation.description:
First, I hope this is the right place for logic example improvement submissions.
It seems that someone was having fun in LogicSubPart. its cute, but it could be confusing to people that do not understand the simplicity of what is happening.
LogicSubPart uses an extremely complicated way of returning a new Vector for getTargetConnections(). Its adding the elements 1 by 1 to a new Vector then returning that. While getSourceConnections simply uses vector.clone(), obviously much faster, cleaner, simpler, etc..
However the larger issue is that lots of lists are tossed around in the GEF architecture, but never are they cloned before hand. Only time they are cloned is by the receiver of the methods data, when that receiver knows it might modify the contents.
so perhaps GEF should specify that returned lists are not to be modified, then nobody has to wonder if they should return clones such as this one example does. OR they all should return clones.(or unmodifiable collections)

buginformation.summary: CVS Annotation could use diff-colours and tooltips
buginformation.description:
I think the current CVS annotation functionality is a bit cumbersome since it is from the list of lines to the code, and not from the code to the author.
I therefore suggest that the current approach for quick diffs (namely to use different colours in the left sidebar) could be extended to show a colour for each "cvs annotation block" (two which alternates would be fine), with a tool tip saying the name of the changer, and - if clicked - synchronized with the current list of changes in the CVS Annotation view.

buginformation.summary: CVS don't retry when the connection fails
buginformation.description:
(this "bug" matches at least all versions of 2 and 3)
This is how to regenerate the bug: - work correctly with a Java project mapped to CVS (do "update", "commit" etc.) - do something to make the plugin not to find the CVS server (e.g. open a remote VPN connection or take the network cable off) - make the CVS server available again (e.g. close the VPN connection or reconnect the network cable) - do "cvs update" -> the software hangs and finally a dialog appears with "no connection to server".
It would be nice if one could do a reconnect with a button or something; now the only work-around is to close the Eclipse and start it again.

buginformation.summary: Breakpoint not shown in ruler
buginformation.description:
2.1.1
Reported by Helen Shi (@ CASCON)
- set a breakpoint in a java class - it initially shows up - shutdown and restart - breakpoint is not shown in ruler - run program - breakpoint is still hit, and still shows in Breakpoints view

buginformation.summary: Sync up feature and site editors with Update spec
buginformation.description: This is a blanket defect to ensure that both feature and site editors support the full 2.1 Update spec.

buginformation.summary: Cannot move method
buginformation.description:
20030206
1. open GotoMarkerAction, try to move 'gotoPackagesView' 2. Dialog says 'Method cannot be moved.' 3. Note that gotoPackagesView could be static, it needs not instance accesses 4. It would be very good if the dialog also gives a reason why the move failed.

buginformation.summary: Wrong JDK source lookup if Compile-JDK <> Debug-JDK
buginformation.description:
Dear experts,
I work in a server developement environment where compilation of sources is done with JDK 1.3.1 (my company policy), but the resulting JAR's are currently executed on a server running JDK 1.4.2 and need to be debugged there.
My Eclipse setup is: Window --> Preferences --> installed JREs --> JDK 1.3.1 (to compile with 1.3.1).
I have a debug configuration that has the following setup: In "Source" tab: "Use defualt source look up path" deselected (otherwise, JRE System library for 1.3.1 would be in) and manually added JRE System library JDK 1.4.2 using "Advanced --> Add container" and moved this item to the top of the source list.
But when debugging and stepping through SUN code (e.g. class java.lang.Thread), I see the 1.3.1 source and the code pointer moves through non-code parts of the source, e.g. comments, space lines, ...
If I switch the preferences to using 1.4.2 as default JDK, I get the correct code when debugging, but as said I shall compile using 1.3.1 in order to avoid using language elements not present in 1.4.2.
Juergen Kremp

buginformation.summary: Hierarchy view should show package names of types
buginformation.description:
build I20030917
- open hierarchy view on org.eclipse.ui.internal.registry.RegistryReader - it has several subclasses called PluginRegistryReader - there's no way to determine which package and source folder these come from without opening them
I would expect this info to appear in the status line, or a tooltip.
It's possible that info in the status line is getting wiped out by the background progress monitor.

buginformation.summary: Duplicate Entry in CVS Compare
buginformation.description:
While using WSDD 5.5, which is built on Eclipse 2.0.2, I saw the following strange behavior: I was comparing the contents of selected packages with those in the CVS repository. You can see from the attached screen shot that a difference appeared twice when it should have appeared once.
Note that I am using CVS on Windows, which might have something to do with this, but I have no way of telling.

buginformation.summary: osgi.bundles bundles are being installed twice
buginformation.description: The bundles whch have version numbers appended to the directories are being installed twice. Once as a result of being on osgi.bundles and again because they are in the platform configuration. This is either because the name is wrong or because the locations are different (one has the version number and the other does not) and the lookup is identifying them as different. This is likely since the location is the unique value in traditional OSGi. The name is just a string.

buginformation.summary: Wrong default reset for preferences/help
buginformation.description: When a custom browser was selected in precefences/help and then the "default" button is clicked, the "custom command" box is not grayed out.

buginformation.summary: Support for Breakpoint groups
buginformation.description:
I saw few enh. requests concerning the breakpoints view, and I thing that the best would be to have an arborescent view, permitting to group them logically and enable only some groups.
Groups would have to be 3-state for the view to be really efficient, internal selection should be kept when the parent group is enabled/disabled.
The view could provide a global toggle action to enable/enable all the breakpoints, without needing to put them under a top level root node.
By the way, when a breakpoint is disabled (maybe because its parent group is), its font should be grayed (more user friendly).
Tell me if you need nore info on that, but it is something I would really be happy with !
--Steve

buginformation.summary: [Preferences] Field editors in Preference Page not shown
buginformation.description: Field editor preference pages that are very similar (same number and type of field editors) are not displayed correctly. From two similar pages only the first page created is displayed correctly, in the second page the field editors are not displayed. I traced through the construction of these pages and through PreferenceDialog.showPage(). Both were executed correctly. Both pages were set to visible when selected but on the second page setVisible(true) seems not to work properly. I could bypass this error by adding another widget (Label) to one of the pages. Bug in Windows?

buginformation.summary: Workbench Help set on wrong Composite
buginformation.description:
In BuildPathsPropertyPage and SourceAttachmentPropertyPage the Workbench Help is set on the parent Composite passed to createContents(Composite parent) rather than on the control that is returned from getControl(). As a result the Help for the preference page cannot be used in when performHelp() is called.
In JavadocConfigurationPropertyPage and JavaElementInfoPage the Workbench Help is set on a different composite, but still not the control that is returned from getControl().

buginformation.summary: [CVS] Share wizard dialog takes up entire screen width
buginformation.description: M3 The title says it all.

buginformation.summary: JDT compiler more restrictive than javac
buginformation.description:
Here is the scenario that is causing problems to PDE when self-hosting against OSGi runtime:
1) Take M4 build 2) Download OSGi runtime from Equinox home page (build 1010) and unzip on top of the build 3) Start another Eclipse driver (not this one) with a clean workspace. Configure it so that PDE->Target Platform points at the M4 OSGi build created in 2). 4) Import all the external plug-ins and fragments as binary projects into the workspace. 5) Create 'Hello, World' plug-in using PDE 'New Plug-in project' wizard. Keep all the defaults.
Notice that the build fails with the following error in XyzPlugin.java:
The type org.osgi.framework.Bundle cannot be resolved. It is indirectly referenced from required .class files. XyzPlugin.java
XyzPlugin does not reference Bundle type directly anywhere. However, it does extend AbstractUIPlugin, which in turn extends Plugin (provided by org.eclipse.runtime.compatibility) and this class has 'Bundle getBundle()' method, as well as Bundle private field.
As suggested, I went into the workspace from the OS shell and tried to compile XYZPlugin using javac.exe. I managed to get it to compile without having to put org.eclipse.osgi.framework.core plug-in on the classpath (this is where Bundle type is declared).
It seems to me that JDT compiler is too eager when resolving Plugin class. It should not need to resolve Bundle reference since it was never used explicitly in XyzPlugin class itself.

buginformation.summary: pocketpc - Pop-Up menus do not work on Tables
Too many Util classes in JDTCore
buginformation.description:
Build 3.0M4
There should only remain 2 of these. One for the compiler, one for the rest of JDTCore. This would also require to group all message catalogs.

buginformation.summary: Opening binary type gives file changed prompt
buginformation.description:
build I20031023
- in a self-hosting workspace with UI projects in source, rest in binary, - open type on a binary type in a binary project, e.g. EditorsView in CVS UI. - it gives the "file change" prompt - press Yes to load the changes - editor comes up - close it - open file again - you get the same prompt again

buginformation.summary: Regression - Incorrect Shell highlighted in Windows Taskbar
buginformation.description:
When a breakpoint is hit, the correct WorkbenchWindow containing the Debug perspective used to flash/blink in the windows taskbar. Also, the windows taskbar would slide out if set to "auto-hide".
In 3.0 M4, the incorrect workbenchWindow is flashed instead. For me, it is the "first" shell, which happens to contain the Java perspective. If I ALT+TAB to the WorkbenchWindow containing the Debug perspective, windows is not happy, and refuses to hide the Taskbar until I make the other workbenchwindow be the active shell. Of course I must do this, because the taskbar (Left side of Desktop) is covering most of the Variables View.

buginformation.summary: Code Complete finds local variables
buginformation.description:
Searches for the declarations of local variables return the function name they are defined in as the search result.
Code Complete should not include local variables for 2 reasons: 1) search will find locals not visible at the point the user hits ctrl-space and 2) the function name will appear in the code complete list and it will not usually start with the same prefix.
Search needs to provide support for excluding local variables from the search and Code complete needs to use that support.

buginformation.summary: Variable selection UI
buginformation.description: We should make a pass over all launch config fields that support variables and make sure they have some UI for adding variables using the variable selection dialog. For fields where a button isn't good, we should add an item to the context menu "Insert Variable..."

buginformation.summary: C/C++ editor - should generate C comments for C files
buginformation.description: In the C/C++ editor, if I open a C file, select a section of the file, right click, and select comment, it will insert C++ style comments (//) instead of C style comments (/**/. This is not usually a problem, but when trying to compile with the -ansi flag to gcc (2.95.2 or 3.22) it will not recognize // as a comment

buginformation.summary: cannot traverse to ToolBar items
buginformation.description: default

buginformation.summary: Ant outline not shown if editor is unable to load DTD
buginformation.description: When using Ant editor for editing XML files with external DTD specified (i.e. web.xml) outline does not appears if editor failed to load DTD (usually happens behind corporate firewall).

buginformation.summary: IncompatibleClassChangeError at runtime when compiling with -1.4 option
buginformation.description:
So we finally figured what changed between 3.0M3 and 3.0M4: the Java Compiler options changed to having 1.4 compliance as the default for generated class files. (We found this out through the circuitous route of inspecting the class file attributes of an M4 compile vs a working command-line one.
The optimisation to swizzle JoinPoint for JoinPointStaticPart fails when ajc is passed the -1.4 option, resulting in an IncompatibleClassChangeError at runtime.
Test case about to be checked into ajcTestsFailing.... and then we'll see if we can fix it!

buginformation.summary: [browser] add api to read html from memory on Photon Browser
buginformation.description:
1. Implement the following api: public boolean setText(String html); where html contains plain html as in: String html = "HTML example

HTML example

This is a really cool page

"; browser.setText(html); // render this page 2. Investigate if the following api could be implemented on Photon: public boolean setText(String html, String urlSource); where html is an html document that may refer to links relative to the location url (for examples, images). public boolean setText(InputStream data, String mime, String url); where data is a binary stream containing a document to be interpreted by a reader for the given mime type (html, text, etc). If this is relevant to the given mime type, relative links are relative to the given url argument.

buginformation.summary: [find/replace] Labels for Regex ContentAssist in Find/Replace should include example
buginformation.description:
Labels for Regex ContentAssist in Find/Replace should include the regular expression (before or after the describing string).
My use case is e.g. this: I remember there was a pattern for word-characters (\s, \w, \W, \S, or something like that). I press Ctrl+Space and resize the list to see half of the proposals at once. Now, the label "alphanumeric" doesn't match my mental pattern, and I have to look at every single label. The info hover takes a second to appear, and I get tired of waiting for it, because I know that I would have spotted \w right away if it was part of the proposal label (e.g. "Alphanumeric - \w").

buginformation.summary: Compare editors not updated when file changes
buginformation.description: The compare editors opened from the sync view never update when the IFile in the workspace changes. This is not standard behavior in the platform, and users expect it to be up-to-date.

buginformation.summary: Autobuild kicks in and stops
buginformation.description: Build: I-20031029 Fresh workspace. No classpath containers, no nothing. Import org.eclipse.ui and all its pre-reqs as source. The projects are all imported successfully. All the classpaths are set correctly. Then autobuild starts, and abruptly ends. You will see 1-2 warnings and that is it. Invoke a full build manually, and you will see all warnings, etc. and everything will be fine.

buginformation.summary: Contribute variables should indicate the plugin that contributed them
buginformation.description:
The variables currently state that they are contributed but not who contributed them.
See the Ant preference pages for examples (tasks, types, properties...)

buginformation.summary: Editor tab has "User File Editor" instead of "plugin.xml"
buginformation.description: I20031029 - create a new environment - check out some projects from CVS - import external plugins - open a plugin.xml file with a double click from the Search window - PDE's multi-page editor opens fine (with pages for Overview, Dependencies, Extension Points, Source, etc.) - by default, the Source page had the focus - the editor's tab in the titlebar of the Editor window had "User File Editor" when I was expecting the filename "plugin.xml"

buginformation.summary: What JVM is Hyades using to run java processes?
buginformation.description:
(Hyades 1.1.0, Eclipse Workbench 2.1.1)
When using "Launch Java Process", what JVM is Hyades using to run the process?
Is it supposed to use the same JVM as the Eclipse workbench specified with eclipse -vm startup option? Or maybe the JVM specified in the system path?
My application does not behave correctly with JDK 1.4. I started eclipse with a -vm option to use JDK 1.3, but I have JDK 1.4 in my system path. I'm not too sure which JDK Hyades is using when launching my application using Lauch Java Process, but the runtime behavior of my application suggests that Hyades is using JDK 1.4 (i.e. the JDK in my system path).
Please explain how Hyades selects the JDK used to run applications, and how to control this.

buginformation.summary: Unable to launch more than 25 programs
buginformation.description:
I'm using 3.0m4. I have launched 25 actively running java programs (using the Run menu) but can't launch the 26th. External programs can't be launched either. I thought perhaps I was running out of memory but I don't get any error dialog and the .log file is clean - no messages output anywhere I can tell. All the programs I launched earlier are still running fine, and the console window is popping all over the place with new output from the different processes.
One of the 25 is a Workbench, and the other are instances of one smallish Java program I built in the workspace. I still have virtual memory available on the machine (dual Xeon running XP).
Is there a limit of 25 launches, or is some undiagnosed error occuring?

buginformation.summary: notes on making PDE work on OSGi/Equinox
buginformation.description:
This PR is a place where any problems found while making PDE work on Equinox are stored.
1) At least in M2, PDE UI declares that it requires org.eclipse.pde (the feature plugin), but not org.eclipse.pde.core. Since we use the requires list to manually define the Dependant-Bundles manifest entry, PDE was not being properly activated when PDE UI was.
2) PDE Core requires org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.parsePlugins, which is not currently available. Adding to core.internal.plugins.InternalPlatform.
3) PDE Core requires the model classes and registry resolution. Re-adding.
4) Some classes usually available from org.eclipse.ui now must be imported from other UI plugins (such as views or workbench).
5) Added helper methods to PDECore to provide access to platform configurations (using the IPlatformConfigurationFactory service).

buginformation.summary: [CVS Core] parse 'waiting' and 'obtained' messages from server
buginformation.description:
build N20031031
- working in the RCP stream, I selected all the UI projects after releasing the results of the merge to the RCP stream - chose Tag with Version: RCP_MERGED_WITH_v20031028 - it completed, but the Progress view showed an error: Problems tagging the resources: 10 project(s) successfully tagged and 1 project (s) with errors.
At first I was puzzled as to how to determine which project had errors, and what they were, but I eventually tried Show Error in the context menu, and then clicking Details on the dialog. It shows:
Problems tagging the resources. 10 project(s) successfully tagged and 1 project (s) with errors. The following warnings were reported while performing the "cvs tag" command. org.eclipse.ui.win32: cvs server: [12:37:41] waiting for rkulp's lock in /home/eclipse/CVSROOT/Emptydir org.eclipse.ui.win32: cvs server: [12:38:11] obtained lock in /home/eclipse/CVSROOT/Emptydir
These are just warnings though. Is it possible there was some other error? The tag shows up on org.eclipse.ui.win32 in the repos view.

buginformation.summary: thisEnclosingJoinPointStaticPart cannot be resolved
buginformation.description: The ajc v1.1.1 doesn't seem to regognize the thisEnclosingJoinPointStaticPart keyword. With J2SE's (build 1.3.1_04-b02) and (build 1.4.1-b21) I get compilation errors from Ant and from Eclipse. Ant (v1.5) says: " aj:comp: [iajc] C:\projects\aspectJTest\src\aspects\mypkg\DebugLog.aj:146 thisEnclosingJoinPointStaticPart cannot be resolved [iajc] stream.println("Entering from " + thisEnclosingJoinPointStaticPart.getSignature()); [iajc] ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ "

buginformation.summary: Move Member Type to New File refactoring gone from context menu
buginformation.description:
Select the name of a "member type" and right-click. The context menu is missing this refactoing. Go to the main Refactor menu from the frame window, and the refactoring is available.
Worked fine in 3.0M2, broken in M3.

buginformation.summary: [DCR ] Create field with comment
overspecified directory path by "eclipse" when exporting a feature
buginformation.description:
Hi Eclipse Team
Eclipse : Version: 2.1.1 Build id: 200306271545 Java : version "1.4.1_02" Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.1_02-b06) Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.1_02-b06, mixed mode)
When exporting a feature to a zip file, the generated path includes the "eclipse" prefix. While it is ok for a feature added to the Eclipse IDE, it precludes to unzip the zipped feature in the "right" features & plugins directories when used with an IDE based on Eclipse but whose name and master directory is not "eclipse" but "foobar" with sub directories:
foobar/features foobar/plugins
Thus, in my opinion, one should remove the "eclipse" prefix for an easier way of use and an a greater generality of the export process.
Regards

buginformation.summary: Find/Replace copy/paste doesn't work.
buginformation.description:
If i select some text in the editor and Copy it to the clibboard and then i open the Find/Replace dialog if i then try to paste te text in the find/replace dialog in te find or replace with fields. The text isn't paste in the thos fields but in the textarea below it!
copy text (CTRL-C) in the find/replace dialog doesn't seem to work either.

buginformation.summary: Display of a selected variable is not working frequently
buginformation.description: Using 1105, the display of the selected variable is not working very frequently. I am using JDK1.4.1 vms and I get numerous examples where I cannot see the string representation of the selected variable in the variable view. This is very frustrating and it is wasting a lot of times. I don't remember such issues with M4 or previous integration builds. Sometimes after a while I get an error message instead of the expected display saying that the evaluation failed. Debugging takes lot of time and patience.

buginformation.summary: Need proper shutdown hook for cleaning up platform on termination.
Inefficient use of setClasspathContainer(...)
buginformation.description:
Build 20031105
PluginManager.updateAffectedEntries(IPluginBase[]) loops over the model entries and for each entry, updateClasspathContainer(boolean) calls setClasspathContainer(IPath, IJavaProject[], IClasspathContainer[], ...) with one Java project and one classpath container.
updateAffectedEntries should better call setClaspathContainer(...) with all projects and the corresponding containers once.

buginformation.summary: [typing] Tabs are messed up
buginformation.description:
When I type code that has string literals in it, and press enter to move the string literal to the next line, the tab logic seems strange.
e.g. String twoLines = "System Contains Many Defects,Systemet inneh氓ller m氓nga fel\n"+"Stories Are Too Complicated,Stories 盲r f枚r komplicerade";
Move the cursor after + and press enter. It somehow moves the new line to column 0, while I'd expect it to align with the first line. If you try this with a single string, the bug will still be seen.
Interestingly, when I am within a method's parantheses, the behavior is different.
e.g. assertEquals( "converted data", "Systemet+inneh氓ller+m氓nga+fel|Stories+盲r+f枚r+komplicerade",convertedData .toString() );
Note, the two lines within have a single tab each. Now position the cursor on convertedData and press enter - while I'd expect it to line up with the previous line (two tabs), the IDE adds three tabs.
Now here's the one which really annoys me:
assertEquals(
There is one tab before assertEquals. Press enter after the paranthesis. Three tabs are inexplicably put in. I would expect only two.
I am assuming these are bugs as previous releases had the right behavior.
Regards, Somik

buginformation.summary: Outline flickers when opening/editing files
buginformation.description:
When I'm editing a larger files with a lot of items to display in the outline window (a header file for instance with lot of defines), the outline windows begins to flicker and begins to consume all processor time. The effect is so strong that the UI is nearly unusable. The only way is have the outline window closed.
I'm using eclipse 2.1.2 and CDT 1.2 GA.
Thanks

buginformation.summary: Classes in certain directories not compiled/found
buginformation.description:
I am running the latest integration build (dated 08/13/03) - and souce files in certain directories dont show up when I use Ctrl+Shift+T - they dont even get compiled. The source files reside in the following location (from the .classpath file): <classpathentry excluding="**/org/**" kind="src" path="Development/plugins/dixons-branch-tools/src/java"/>
These were compiled and I was able to browse to classes in this directory when I used the 08/06/03 integration build. (Maybe this is not working due to the hyphen symbol in the directory?

buginformation.summary: Extract interface from org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Layout
buginformation.description:
Is there a reason, why org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Layout became a class instead of an interface? If one has to create an own layout imlpementation, having such an interface would often make that job easier.
My refactoring request: org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Layout implements org.eclipse.swt.widgets.ILayout { // everything else is the same }
Thus you still could add methods and fields to them in the future. The name of that new interface is up to you ;)
br Saibel

buginformation.summary: [ErrorHandling] [RCP] SafeRunnable in JFace opens an error dialog
buginformation.description: The class org.eclipse.jface.util.SafeRunnable opens an error dialog if the runnable it contains throws an exception. There are cases (e.g bug 46960 ) where an exception in this runnable can happen frequently. I got 137 error dialogs when I was reproducing this problem. Would logging the error be sufficient in this case? Otherwise, some mechanism to avoid poping up multiple dialogs at the same time should be employed.

buginformation.summary: Poor choice of color
buginformation.description:
Build 20031119
The green color chosen to show the current line is really agressive. Can this be changed, or configured?

buginformation.summary: add to javadoc for List.remove(int start, int end)
buginformation.description: The method remove(int start, int end) in class List, removes any items that it can before throwing the exception ERROR_INVALID_RANGE. This should be added to the javadoc as this behavior is specifically tested in the junit test Test_org_eclipse_swt_widgets_List.test test_removeII()

buginformation.summary: Eclipse allows setting a source folder's parent as output folder, which wipes out source code
buginformation.description:
It's possible to select a source folder's parent as the output folder, as described below. This has the majorly annoying side-effect of wiping out your source code. Viz:
Suppose you have a project named MyProject.
- Create a source folder MyDir/src as a source folder. This will set the new default output directory to MyProject/bin. - Create a class, package com.abs.stc, name Hello, in this directory.
Now change the source folder to /MyDir/src and the output folder to /MyDir as follows:
- Right click on the project and select Properties->Java Build Path->Source. - click on Allow output folders for source folders. Click on Output folder, (expand the source folder MyProject/MyDir/src if necessary), press Edit, click on "Specific Output Folder" and change it to MyDir. Click OK. - You'll get a message about not being able to nest MyProject/MyDir/src inside MyProject/MyDir. Make this message go away by changing the Default output folder at the bottom of the dialog box from MyProject/bin to MyProject. (This is probably where this bug should get fixed; it shouldn't let you do this.) - Click OK. You'll get a message box asking if it's OK to remove the old generated sources from the old output folder; click Yes. BOOM! If you're using Eclipse 3.0 or 2.1.1, this will immediately wipe out your source directory.
(If you're using 2.1, you get a reprieve; your source directory won't get wiped until try to run Hello.java when you get an error about the main class not being found.)

buginformation.summary: [Plan Item] Improve UI scalability
buginformation.description: Improve UI scalability. Despite efforts to ensure UI scalability with a large base of available tools, the Eclipse workbench still intimidates many users with long menus, wide toolbars, and lengthy flat lists of preferences. This problem is acute in large Eclipse-based products. The Platform should provide additional ways for controlling workbench clutter, such as further menu and toolbar customizability, distinguishing between novice and advanced functions, supporting different developer roles, and more specific object contributions for particular file types. [Platform UI, Platform Debug, JDT UI] [Theme: User experience]

buginformation.summary: Background checkout blocks removing bookmark
buginformation.description:
I2003-11-19
1) Create a test project with a test class 2) open the test class in an editor 3) add a bookmark 4) from the eclipse repository, check out "org.eclipse.jdt.ui" (in the background, as per default settings). 5) in the editor, remove the bookmark from the ruler context menu 6) observe: The UI is non-responsive until the checkout finishes.

buginformation.summary: [KeyBindings] CapsLock == R ???
buginformation.description:
M5 test candidate, observed on both motif and gtk
- go to the Keys preference page - click in the Key Sequence - Name field - press CapsLock and R appears - others: ScrollLock = T, PrintScreen = W, Pause = U
Is this expected? I ran a small swt snippet that prints Key events, and I don't see much resemblance between those of CapsLock and R. Interestingly, pressing Ctrl+CapsLock has the same affect in the java debugger as pressing Ctrl+R, so at least the preference page isn't lying <g>.

buginformation.summary: First bug towards CVS component!
buginformation.description: default

buginformation.summary: new ParserMode required for a better CModel
buginformation.description: A mode for the parser that follows includes but does not go into function bodies need to be implemented. This will help us build a better CModel that has cross reference information. Building such a CModel could be made available for potential clients other than the outline view. Building such a model could be made optional (through a user preference) for the outline view because of the expected degradation in performance.

buginformation.summary: Unexpected warning when launching Eclipse in Eclipse
buginformation.description:
Build 20031120
After importing all Eclipse plug-ins in self-hosted workspace, the target platform got set to point at my SDK install (which I imported).
Attempting to launch plugin Junit tests, I get notified that my workspace contains now twice as many plugins, is it ok to continue ?
I have the impression that it automatically append the plugins from the target platform, which I don't need as I have them all in my workspace now. I don't recall this occurring before.
It should realize that on the target platform, there is nothing more than what I have already in my workspace and should take precendece over it.

buginformation.summary: Subclassing does not remove the original graphical edit part
buginformation.description: Subclass JFrame, e.g. MyFrame extends JFrame. Now change so it subclasses Object, fix up errors in initialize() method The GUI updates OK with the content pane orphaned, however the JFrame edit part remains, including when a pause/reload occurs. Close and re-open the .java file and it's all OK, but while the editor remains open the original graphic edit part never goes away on resubclassing

buginformation.summary: Use of deprecated API from IActivityManager
buginformation.description: IActivityManager.match(String, Set) has been deprecated to be replaced with isMatch(String, Set)

buginformation.summary: [OLE] OleAutomation for non-embedded objects
buginformation.description:
I would like to be able to use OleAutomation and the event handling functions of Active-X on non-embedded COM Objects too.
Unfortunately the general COM services and the services specific to embedded components are mixed in OleClientSite and OleControlSite, so this feature might need some refactoring.

buginformation.summary: [plan item] Rename Refactoring
buginformation.description: This feature represents our first foray into the world of refactoring. This includes bringing in a refactoring framework that is very similar to the JDT's refactoring framework. The focus is then on rename refactoring which will leverage off and make improvements to the C/C++ Search feature to correctly refactor the references.

buginformation.description:
Using M5, as soon as I click in a stack trace to open the related type, I get: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/jface/text/BadLocationException at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.ui.FailureTraceView.createOpenEditorAction(FailureTraceView.java:119) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.ui.FailureTraceView.access$2(FailureTraceView.java:103) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.ui.FailureTraceView$1.handleOpen(FailureTraceView.java:62) at org.eclipse.jface.util.OpenStrategy.fireOpenEvent(OpenStrategy.java:209) at org.eclipse.jface.util.OpenStrategy.access$2(OpenStrategy.java:204) at org.eclipse.jface.util.OpenStrategy$1.handleEvent(OpenStrategy.java:233) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:82) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:847) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java:2187) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1877) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:1405) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runUI(Workbench.java:1381) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.createAndRunWorkbench(Workbench.java:237) at org.eclipse.ui.PlatformUI.createAndRunWorkbench(PlatformUI.java:139) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.IDEApplication.run(IDEApplication.java:47) at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:858) at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:461) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:299) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:767) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:601)

buginformation.summary: Hotkey to popup right click menu
buginformation.description:
A hotkey to popup the right click menu, would prevent repositioning the mouse (even on datahands with integrated mouse it's a pain). ie ctrl-r->S->V to bring up override methods box... mas vite.
Andy

buginformation.summary: [plan item] Improve file encoding support
buginformation.description: Improve file encoding support. Eclipse 2.1 uses a single global file encoding setting for reading and writing files in the workspace. This is problematic; for example, when Java source files in the workspace use OS default file encoding while XML files in the workspace use UTF-8 file encoding. The Platform should support non-uniform file encodings. [Platform Core, Platform UI, Text, Search, Compare, JDT UI, JDT Core] [Theme: User experience]

buginformation.summary: Switching to use JRE Library container
buginformation.description: We need to switch to use the JRE Library container instead of the JRE Library variable. org.eclipse.debug.core from HEAD is not compiling by default, because the XML parser is not include in rt.jar.

buginformation.summary: Show some XML attributes in Ant editor outline view
buginformation.description:
Ant's editor allows to edit XML files and have a good capability to show outline of xml document.
It will be very convenient to see values of some attributes in the outline view of Ant editor in the same node as XML element, i.e. "name" and "id". It will aloow to easily navigate through the groups of the repeatable elements. List of such attributes could be configurable in the editor properties.

buginformation.summary: Variable value should be displayed as hover tip when debugging
buginformation.description:
To reproduce: 1. Start a C program in the debugger. 2. Verify that you have a local variable with an assigned value in the variable view. 3. Put the mouse pointer over that variable in the displayed source code.
Expected result: The value of the variable should have been displayed in a hover tip.
Current result. Nothing happens.

buginformation.summary: AspectJ does not honour libraries defined via Project Properties
Package view should offer properties for JRE classpath container [build path]
buginformation.description:
Build 3.0M5
Currently, in order to select a different flavor of a JRE container, one has to select the project, find the build path tab, then library tab, then select container and edit it.
It would be far simpler if it offered properties directly on the JRE container element in package view.

buginformation.description:
I have successfully run eclipse for a few months now. All of a sudden, I am having a new problem while starting eclipse: When I launch eclipse, it takes a very long time to come up, then I get a window which says File Has Changed. Apply changes Yes or No
whether I say yes or no, it takes a long time and then I get an error, error in startup, look in log file. When I view my workspace/.metadata/.log file, I have the following error: !SESSION ---------------------------------------------------------------------- !ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Jul 21, 2003 08:00:55.46 !MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform: !STACK java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:291) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:747) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:583) Caused by: java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:848) at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:461) ... 7 more Caused by: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError

buginformation.summary: working set filter for Breakpoints view
buginformation.description:
Please add different sorting options (including per-project sort).
Please add an option to enable and disable break point, enable and disable hit count and enable or disable condition without opening breakpoint properties dialog (i.e. by making this view as a table and showing those properties as a checkboxes).
It will make it much convenient to control break points. Especially if this will be implemented https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=41058
