buginformation.summary: Eclipse deadlocks when switching from Java to CVS perspective
buginformation.description:
Linux/Motif 3.0M4 on RedHat 9
I started running a long job in Eclipse over night, which ran to completion. This morning when I tried switching from Java to CVS perspective, Eclipse appears to have deadlocked. The hourglass cursor is spinning, but only the backgrounds of the widgets in the window are redrawing. (From the size and positioning of the view outlines, it looks like I'm actually in the CVS perspective.) CPU activity in Eclipse's JVM process is 0.0, and there is nothing in the log. I could kill the process, no problem, but wanted to log a bug here first and ask for advice if I can somehow coax Eclipse to at least throw me a stack dump so I can include a report here on where it got deadlocked. This has happened once or twice in the past, although I still haven't figured out how to reliably reproduce it.

buginformation.summary: consider listening to start level events to start the application
buginformation.description:
Currently, we have the application runner as a separate bundle with the highest start level so when it starts we know that all user bundles are startable before we run the application.
Another approach would be to use the framework event for start level changes as an indication that it is time to start the application. The benefit of this approach is that we could get rid of another bundle/project.

buginformation.summary: CVS commit should run in background
buginformation.description:
I'm using 3.0 M5, and when I commit files, I have to wait for the commit to complete before I can start using Eclipse.
I see no reason why I have to wait for the completion, and it should run in the background.

buginformation.summary: [content assist] Incorrect cursor position after code assist
buginformation.description:
The cursor is left in an incorrect position after choosing an option (using Enter key) from the code assist pop-up.
Create a class, Test, with a main method. When using code assist inside the main method for class/method completion (not template expansion), the cursor keeps being positioned to one of: - after the closing brace of the main method, - after the closing brace of the class, - last character of the file. The cursor should end up after the text chosen from the pop-up. Template expansion works OK.
Tried with code assist preferences both on "completion inserts" and "completion overwrites".
Cursor positioning has worked correctly on longer classes.
Eclipse 2.1.2 Build 200311030802, Windows XP, Sun J2SDK 1.4.1_01.

buginformation.summary: Update in sync view loses expansion state
buginformation.description:
build I20031121
- do a sync - several projects show incoming changes - select some of the projects and choose Update - while the update is going on, expand another project 2 levels deep (i.e. to see the files) - when the update is complete, the project's top-level expansion state is not lost, but its folders' expansion state is lost

buginformation.summary: [Wizards] WizardNewFileCreationPage should support a default file extension
buginformation.description: In the WizardNewFileCreationPage, there should be a method to set what the default file extension should be. So when the page is asked to create the new file, it can check the entered file name if it ends with the default file extension provided, and if not, append it to the end of the file name.

buginformation.description:
N20031201 (really!)
I get this NPE everytime I try rebuilding all projects in my workspace. Couldn't reproduce it with a new workspace.

buginformation.summary: CDT failes to install: plugin and it's features unreachable
buginformation.description:
Only with gtk version on linux (motif): unzip eclipse 3.0M5 gtk version and after it cdt 2.0 gtk version, start eclipse. The initial eclipse logo appears, disappears and appears again, eclipse creates the workspace and starts. After this I can't reach any CDT functionality eg: new project, preferences, perspectives. Motif version works fine, on the same machine. Also eclipse 2.1.2 with CDT 1.2 works fine
In the .metadata/.log:
!SESSION dec. 01, 2003 16:25:58.831 -------------------------------------------- java.version=1.4.1 java.vendor=Blackdown Java-Linux Team BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=hu_HU Command-line arguments: -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86 -data /home/zvadasz/.eclipse-3.0-workspace/ -install file:/home/zvadasz/Programs/eclipse/eclipse-SDK-3.0M5-linux-gtk/ !ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 2 1 dec. 01, 2003 16:25:58.833 !MESSAGE Problems encountered loading the plug-in registry. !SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.runtime 2 1 dec. 01, 2003 16:25:58.833 !MESSAGE Plug-in descriptor "org.eclipse.cdt.core" not found for fragment "org.eclipse.cdt.core.linux". Fragment ignored.

buginformation.summary: Adding first source folder to project looks too complex [code manipulation] [general issue]
buginformation.description:
I20031119
- create new project with New Project wizard - after specifying the name go to next page (don't use Finish button) - select project and press "Add Folder" Observe: a new modal dialog appears showing the same information as the original dialog. You can repeat the selection you've already made and you have to press another "Create New Folder" button. This feels clumsy (for the 95% case).
I suggest either to: - rename the "Add Folder" button to "Add Source Folder" (because that's what it is). - skip the second dialog if the select project doesn't contain any folders. In this case there is no need for letting the user select an existing project.
or - rename the button "Add Folder" to "Add Source Folder" - and create a new button "Create Source Folder"

buginformation.summary: NPE occurs sometimes bringing up alignment dialog
buginformation.description:
Create a class subclassing JPanel. Drop at two components onto the JPanel. Change the layout of the JPanel to null. Bring up the Alignment dialog. Select the two components so that the alignment actions are enabled. Close the dialog.
Now select the JPanel while holding down the ctrl key so that the two components and the JPanel are selected. Bring up the alignment dialog again and it will be blank (no actions) and a NullpointerException is thrown in the log. If this doesn't happen, try closing the dialog, deselecting one of the components and reopening the dialog. You may have to do this with deselecting and selecting the components and the JPanel... each time closing and reopening the alignment dialog. At some point, the NPE is thrown when you open the dialog and the dialog comes up blank.
From the stack trace and code it looks like there is no primary selection and as a result there is no anchor object in the distribute request.
Here's the stack trace from the .log file: java.lang.NullPointerException at at org.eclipse.ve.internal.cde.core.XYLayoutEditPolicy.getCommand (XYLayoutEditPolicy.java:211) at buginformation.summary: Quick Diff hovers don't use text editor font
buginformation.description:
Quick Diff difference hovers use the java editor's text font for hovers to provide an easy "visual diff" by hovering/unhovering.
This doesn't work in *text* editors (e.g. on a *.properties file), since the hover uses a default font and doesn't take over the text editor's.

buginformation.summary: Ant view icons for default target confused with Java protected decorator.
buginformation.description: The little blue triangle which overlaps the target is confusing since in the Java view the blue triangle means protected. Just a thought: You could use the same running-man decorator to mean default target that is used also used to say "this class has a main() method". The current icon means "protected" target, to me, at least ;-) Version 3.0.m5

buginformation.summary: Synchrinization is not working properly - resynchs from the root
buginformation.description:
I am working with Version: 3.0.0 Build id: 200307120010
I traverse 4 or 5 levels deep into a project which is stored in a CVS repos. At this level, when I right click on any file/folder, and select Team > Synchrinize with remote, in the status bar at the bottom, I see that: 1) There are multiple messages which say "Authenticating using extssh". Shouldnt this be done only once per synch run? 2) The synchnonization happens from the root - at least the messages indicate as such.

buginformation.summary: [Examples] Readme Example no longer contributes marker resolutions
buginformation.description:
I20031203 (likely in previous 3.0 releases as well) - self-hosting - build a simple project with a *.readme file in it as described in the documentation for the readme example - in the readme file editor, right click -> Add -> Readme Marker Example <n> (where n is 1 - 7) - this will add a marker which shows up in the Tasks view (you may have to explicitly open the Tasks view to see it)
According to the documentation in Platform Plug-in Developer Guide- >Programmer's Guide->Advanced workbench concepts->Marker help and resolution- >Contributing marker resolution you should be able to right click on this task and then select Quick Fix to run a resolution. But QuickFix is no longer offered on the Tasks view (see bug 40637 )
Perhaps we should change the readme example so it creates 'problems' instead of 'tasks' so this example is still valid.

buginformation.summary: iterator in clone() may provide a copy of arrayList in different order
buginformation.description:
in org.eclipse.hyades.logging.events: some of the clone() methods uses Iterator to retrieve all the elements. This was OK before since it iterates through a hashMap, which order does not matter. However in CBE 101, it uses ArrayList instead of hashMap. By using a iterator, we have clone a copy of the ArrayList which has elements in different order than the original.
This is what stated in the sun javadoc: public Iterator iterator()Returns an iterator over the elements in this collection. There are no guarantees concerning the order in which the elements are returned (unless this collection is an instance of some class that provides a guarantee).
Classes affected by this bug: CommonBaseEventImpl.java ExtendedDataElementImpl.java

buginformation.summary: The Software Update has a problem when it is configurated with HTTP proxy.
buginformation.description:
The "Help/Software Update/Find and Install" menu has a problem when it is configurated with HTTP proxy. The "window/preferences" menu hasn't the option "Proxy Authentication". When I want to update the following message appear:
Network connection problems encountered during search. Unable to access " http://update.eclipse.org/updates ". Unable to access Site stream: " http://update.eclipse.org/updates " [Server returned HTTP response code: 407 for URL: http://update.eclipse.org/updates ] Unable to access Site stream: " http://update.eclipse.org/updates/site.xml " [Server returned HTTP response code: 407 for URL: http://update.eclipse.org/updates/site.xml ]

buginformation.summary: [Compiler] x && false evaluates to "true"
Expose dialogs for creating classpath entries
buginformation.description:
This is a request to provide non-internal access to the dialogs used to create classpath entries within the JDT UI. These would be simple dialogs or perhaps even just helper methods (e.g. IClasspathEntry[] showExternalJARDialog(Shell shell)) that could be used to present the user with the same dialogs and return a classpath entry. Specifically, the dialogs that appear by clicking on the following buttons on the Java Build Path properties, Libraries tab: Add JARs... Add External JARs... Add Variable.. Add Library... Add Class Folder...
Exposing these dialogs would allow downstream JDT users to create and edit classpath entries outside of the regular JDT dialogs. For instance, providing a UI to set a server's classpath in an editor.
Currently, this is done by duplicating the dialogs. Maintenance of duplicate dialogs is an issue, as well as a usability problem since the dialogs are inevitably different.

buginformation.summary: Review InternalPlatform.handleException
buginformation.description: This method catches and discards Throwable. It needs to be cleaned up.

buginformation.summary: [RCP] New and Import wizards lose selection
buginformation.description:
I2031119
1. In the Package Explorer: select a Java project or folder inside a Java project 2. Import... 3. Select any import (e.g. from ZIP) ==> the container (Into folder:) is not set
This works using the Navigator or a non-Java project.
Other scenario: Select a project and add a simple folder ==> you have to select the project again.
Maybe it is not a major bug but it is very annoying and it look like a (RCP?) regression.

buginformation.summary: Source code not always found in debugger
buginformation.description:
This report includes a description of my setup, a description of the problem, a description of the source of the problem, and a description of two possible solutions.
SETUP: My setup is a little complex. I think that most of this is irrelevent, but I'm including it all just in case.
I'm running Eclipse 2.1.2 with CDT 1.2 on Windows XP. I have a current cygwin installation (as of 2003-12-4) and prc-tools 2.3 installed (< http://prc - tools.sf.net>). I'm running from a drive (K:) that's mapped to my Documents directory (C:\Documents and Settings\Keith Rollin.PALMSOURCE\My Documents). My workspace (K:\Projects\Eclipse\plugins) is outside of my Eclipse directory (K:\Downloads\eclipse\2.1.2\eclipse). I launch Eclipse with a shortcut that specifies the following command line: K:\Downloads\eclipse\2.1.2 \eclipse\eclipse.exe -data k:\Projects\Eclipse\plugins. My runtime workspace is in the normal location relative to the main workspace (K:\Projects\Eclipse\runtime-workspace). I am using the Eclipse for Palm OS plugin (< http://www.redfelineninja.dsl.pipex.com/software.html >) to debug Palm applications. Because I'm developing extensions, most of my debugging is in a runtime IDE. The problem I describe occurs both in the runtime IDE as well as the host IDE.
PROBLEM: The problem is that source files are not always found in the debugger. Assume that I've developed a Palm application, have launched under the control of the Palm OS Emulator and the m68k-palmos-gdb debugger that comes with prc-tools, and that my Palm application has crashed and that I'm looking at a stack crawl in the debugger. Clicking on a stack frame that corresponds to a function in my application results in a page saying that the source file cannot be found.
SOURCE: I think I've traced the problem to a couple of methods in CSourceLocator. findFileByAbsolutePath() is given the path of a file to look for. As part of its operation, it creates a File on that path, calls File.getCanonicalPath, and then passes the result to CSourceLocator.findFile (). findFile iterates over all project members, looking for an IFile that has the same path.
The problem is that findFileByAbsolutePath is given a path where the drive letter is lower-case. findFile also generates project item paths where the drive letter is lower-case. However, the call to getCanonicalPath converts the lower-case drive letter to an upper-case drive letter, cause the strict string match between the target path and the project item paths to fail.
Eventually, it occurred to me that the paths being generated had a lower-case drive letter because I'd specified a lower-case drive letter in the command line in the shortcut I use to launch Eclipse. Changing that, and changing the path to the runtime-workspace in my launch configuration (which appears to have been generated from the path I'd specified in the shortcut) fixed the problem.
As an interesting workaround, I also noticed that the source files could be found if my project was not in the workspace directory (that is, when I'd imported an existing project into my workspace from another location on my hard drive without actually copying the files into my workspace). I never bothered to track down why this was so.
SOLUTION: One obvious fix to this problem would be to make more use of getCanonicalPath, thus generating consistant paths that could be compared against each other. However, I have another suggestion. While tracking down this bug, I noticed that the source-locator routines were given a simple file name (no path information), and were asked to find a file with that name in the project. The algorithm used to perform this search involved iterating over the project, prefixing the file name with every possible path in the project, and then iterating over the project again looking for a file with that full path. It seems to me that a much simpler approach would be to iterate over the project, and for each IFile, to see if the file name (without the path) matched the simple file name that was passed to the source locator.

buginformation.summary: [Navigator] file icons are not updated when file associations are modified.
buginformation.description:
I20031203
1. launch Eclipse on a new workspace 2. create a project 3. create a file named 'test1.xml' The new file is displayed with the default (text) file icon. 4. associate '*.xml' files to the ant editor in window>preferences>workbench>file associations 5. create a file named 'test2.xml' The new file is displayed with the ant file icon, test1.xml is still displayed with the default file icon.
Closing/re-opening the view solves the problem.

buginformation.description:

I'm running Eclipse 2.1.2 with CDT 1.2 on Windows XP. I have a current cygwin installation (as of 2003-12-4) and prc-tools 2.3 installed (< http://prc - tools.sf.net>). As an interesting workaround, I also noticed that the source files could be found if my project was not in the workspace directory (that is, when I'd imported an existing project into my workspace from another location on my hard drive without actually copying the files into my workspace). I never bothered to track down why this was so.

However, I have another suggestion. While tracking down this bug, I noticed that the source-locator routines were given a simple file name (no path information), and were asked to find a file with that name in the project. It seems to me that a much simpler approach would be to iterate over the project, and for each IFile, to see if the file name (without the path) matched the simple file name that was passed to the source locator.

buginformation.summary: ZoomManager's "Page" settings cause erratic behavior
buginformation.description: Keep entering 1% in the zoom combo box and you will see that the diagram keeps shrinking a little by little. This is because the ZoomManager is interpreting that 1% as "Page," and shrinking the diagram accordingly. And since it's using the Figure's preferred size to calculate the zoom level, and because changing the zoom level changes its preferred size, when you enter 1% the next time, the new minimum zoom is slightly less than earlier.

buginformation.summary: CVS metafiles always have unix EOL

Our CVS server is running on an OS X Machine (10.2.6)
When checking out a project from CVS on Windows, it is checked out as a Unix project. If you try to perform any CVS actions on the checked out project using Tortoise CVS, you are shown an error message that tells you did. Seen on WinXP and Windows 2000.

buginformation.summary: Plugin import - wizard does not consider target platform refresh
buginformation.description:
Build 20031202
I am developping for Eclipse 2.1 using a self-hosting 2.1 workspace on top of Eclipse SDK 3.0. I wanted to launch Eclipse 2.1 as a runtime workbench so as to run some test suites (due to bug 48125 ); and thus remembered I needed to import an extra plug-in: org.eclipse.pde.junit.
In order to do so, I did the following: - open the file import plug-in wizard - configured the target platform there to point at a 2.1.2 SDK install - select import as binary - press NEXT - in the list of available plug-ins, org.eclipse.pde.junit isn't available (ok as it is not part of the 2.1 delivery) - hit BACK, keep import wizard up, - outside Eclipse, expand the missing plug-in into the 2.1.2 install - back inside Eclipse, import wizard is still up, click on target platform button - in target platform wizard, press RELOAD - observe that org.eclipse.pde.junit is listed, press OK - back into import wizard, press NEXT - observe that org.eclipse.pde.junit is NOT listed (you have to close and reopen the wizard so as to see it)

buginformation.summary: Synchronizing RTF files always reports same

I have some MS Word RTF documents in my project. I have added the documents successfully to the projects CVS module. However, now that I have changed the documents with Word (started from Eclipse), Synchronize believes no commit is necessary. It consistently reports no changes and I am not able to commit the changed version to the repository. Even when I just "commit" without synchrinizing first, nothing happens.
Things I checked:
- The Eclipse properties for the local file shows the correct, new date. - In CVS there is only the initial version, with correct (old) date. - The local document is really different from what's in the repository. - The document is checked in as binary.

buginformation.summary: Difficulty creating "swt-like" fragment
buginformation.description:
eclipse-SDK-I20031202-win32
I created a fragment in M5 that replaces some functionality in an existing plugin. I did this by: 1. modifying the plugin's plugin.xml to include an additional runtime jar "replace.jar" (first in the list of jars) 2. creating a fragment that contained: a. replace.jar (this is not window system specific so is just in the root directory of the fragment) b. a fragment.xml that imported the necessary plug-ins to make replace.jar run correctly. There is no runtime declaration for replace.jar
In M5 (pre-osgi) the previous steps worked successfully. The plugin is augmented with both replace.jar and the additional imports.
In the first osgi build, I appear to be failing. I say "appear" because my pre- osgi debugging steps are not available so I could be making a trivial pilot error. First failure: check to see if the fragment is installed (not shown in current configuration details - e.g., cannot see swt fragment).
bug 46494 makes me believe that this should work. bug 43658 discusses how swt works, however, I see manifest files in the swt plug-in and fragment so there may be additional steps I need to do (but did not see any requirement for additional steps in the porting guide).
Please advise. We need to be able to do something like this (target: M6). Given that swt works, I hypothesize that I am either missing some required step or just pilot error.

buginformation.description: The new fragment format supports improved hierarchy and causedBy events, but existing tools may use the old fragment grammar. Update the new fragment producer code and the new loader code to work properly with the old fragment grammar.

buginformation.summary: JDT : report final, report static
buginformation.description: Report final use : It is possible with this architecture to report that a member, a method or a parameter or a local variable is used as an final one (not reassigned). In that case a hint would be to mention that. Report static use : It is possible with this architecture to report that a method is a static one (no access to this). In that case a hint would be to mention that

buginformation.description: We should improve the editable table of the change method signature. Either we have to find a good solution or we should remove the cell edit support.

buginformation.summary: Autoformat inserts unwanted tabs when formatting javadoc
buginformation.description:
Hi,
This has been occuring for a while in the 3.0 stream. Using 'ctrl-shift-f' style autoformat will insert tabs ahead of javadoc comments even if the preference dialog is set to use spaces instead of tabs.
To demonstrate:
Set up your prefs: Uncheck Java -> Code Formatter -> Style -> Insert tabs for indentation & Check Java -> Editor -> Typing -> Insert spaces for tabs
It doesn't matter if you're using the old style formatter or have checked the new autoformatter in the Work In Progress sheet.
Then select all in a java file with poorly formatted javadoc. Tabs will be inserted.
-tim

buginformation.summary: Support for multiple JDK levels of BeanInfos
buginformation.description:
The current level of BeanInfo in the VE is JDK 1.3 and the VE allows other JDK levels in the remote VM (e.g. JDK 1.4) but the property values, events, and layout managers in the IDE are reflective of the JDK 1.3 BeanInfo level only.
An example of this is the 'rollover' property on a javax.swing.JToolBar. It's not available in JDK 1.3 but is new for JDK 1.4.
We need the capability for the user to specific a different JDK BeanInfo level in order to make use of additional functionality in JDK enhancements.

buginformation.summary: Cannot create patch from multiple projects
buginformation.description:
Build 3.0 M5
When multiple projects are selected the 'Create Patch...' menu item becomes disabled.

buginformation.summary: Runtime is no longer a plugin
buginformation.description: The fact that runtime is no longer a real plugin causes some griefs to some plugins that were used to get the plugin object and then access preferences. One example of such a problem occurs to the CVS UI.

buginformation.summary: M5: Running Ant in separate VM gives no console output
buginformation.description:
On Eclipse 3.0 M5 I have the following problem:
Running an Ant build in a separate JRE (1.3.1_04) results in just one line appearing in the console: Buildfile: xxxxxxx\build.xml
In case of failure even the error dialog (if enabled in Ant preferences) doesn't show up, so there is no way to tell, that the Ant build has failed.
The only way to tell that the build has finished is when the console window title changes to "Console - <terminated> ...".
When I run the Ant build in the same JRE (1.4.2_01) as Eclipse I get the full build output as expected.
In has worked in my last 3.0 version before M5, which was I20030813. Ant version is 1.5Beta2.
Probably related to resolved Bug 42222 .

buginformation.summary: Rich client improvement

This address field would not be used to display web pages of course, but to access an application and download the needed updated plugin to perform the tool. Exemple : I wa

buginformation.summary: fragments not searched for classpath entries
buginformation.description:
In DefaultClassLoader.getClasspath() we are looking for a file to match a given classpath entry. Currently we only look in the bundle itself, we never consider fragments of the bundle. This makes the following interesting usecase impossible
Bundle A manifest.mf Bundle-Classpath: foo.jar
Bundle B manifest.mf Bundle-Host: BundleA
where bundle A does NOT contain foo.jar and bundle B DOES contain foo.jar

buginformation.summary: ExtensionPointSchemaBuilder process unneccesary schemas
buginformation.description:
I have a project, with a "test" folder, that contains several schemas, dtds, etc., used for testing. When I do a "rebuild all", I get the the following build error. The error itself seems to be another bug on schema processing (which I'll open after this one), but this bug I'm reporting is that is seems that the schema builder should not be processing all schema files in a project. I'm not sure how its decided which might go with extension points, but in large projects with lots of schemas, would result in lots of unnecessary processing. Plus, there could be truely invalid schemas (perhaps under development), which should not interfere with build. I've seen this on M4 and M5 builds.
= = = = = Build problems Errors during build. java.lang.NullPointerException encountered while running org.eclipse.pde. internal.builders.ExtensionPointSchemaBuilder.

buginformation.summary: All bookmarks and tasks lost after Eclipse crashes.
buginformation.description:
////////// My configuration: ///////////////////// 1. Eclipse platform Version: 2.1.0 Build id: 200303272130 2. Besides the standard plugins came with Eclispse platform, I've installed the following plugin: - PHPEclipse Tools Core (1.0.9) - PHPEclipse SQL Utility (1.0.1)
///////// How did the problem rise: /////////////// 1. I'm doing a PHP project on another machine (mounted the remote directory with NFS to my local disk).
2. The remote computer reboot without closing Eclipse properly. And then Eclipse goes dead ("ps afx" command reveals that the status of Eclipse's main thread is "D" (uninterrupted IO process? not sure...) )
3. I "kill" all its child-threads by force, but I was not able to kill its main thread.
4. The remote computer done its reboot, and Eclipse threads got killed automatically.
5. I re-open Eclipse and the project, and I found all my bookmarks and tasks disappeared... (All other settings, like short-cut keys, are working fine)
this is TOO bad because there were more than 50 of them over there... I'm reading the source code written by another guy, and those bookmarks are really important to me. Is it possible to restore them?
Can anyone help? Big thanks in advance!

buginformation.summary: @throws reference incorrectly warned as not declared
Need to open-up the plugin converter
buginformation.description:
As of today the plugin converter generates manifest one by one ignoring all other bundles. This has a limitation for bundles that do not have their own jars like SWT.
The idea in opening the converter is to give capabilities to PDE (who has the global view of the system) to say what to generates for those cases.

buginformation.summary: JVE Palette should persist its open/closed state
buginformation.description:
This apparently was fixed and now it doesn't work. From cmvc defect 239921:
<Note by myersdj (MYERS, JEFFREY D.), 2003/02/24 14:26:14, seq: 1 rel: 0 action: open> This is a regression on defect 215557. It appears this regressed and no one noticed it. The behavior doesn't work in v5.0 GA either. See defect 215557 for description of the problem and the solution.
Here's defect 215557: <Note by sri (Gunturi, Srimanth), 2002/07/16 12:07:03, seq: 1 rel: 0 action: open> JVE Palette should persist its open/closed state.
The palette is not persisting its opened/closed state across sessions of editing. Perhaps it should remember per input file, its persistance state.
<Note by gmendel (Mendel, Gili (Dr.)), 2002/07/18 11:33:52, seq: 2 rel: 0 action: assign> Old Owner: gmendel New Owner: winchest
<Note by winchest (Winchester, J), 2002/07/23 12:05:23, seq: 3 rel: 0 action: verify> When you open/close the palette is now updates the flag that is shown on the preferences page that comes from the VCEPlugin. This then affects the next opened editors. I didn't want to make the open/close state on a per file basis - it seemed to be more like resizing a viewer to me so it is just global for the editor configuration of either split pane or notebook
<Note by rkalim (Kalim, Rolf), 2002/08/12 12:29:16, seq: 4 rel: 0 action: note> Nice feature, Works in 20020812_0100-WB20-V50W
<Note by sri (Gunturi, Srimanth), 2002/08/20 11:58:24, seq: 5 rel: 0 action: verifynote> Persists state across sessions.

buginformation.summary: Deferred creation of Table items
buginformation.description:
Creating large Tables (10,000 or more items) in SWT is currently very slow and memory-intensive.
It would be possible to improve the runtime if the SWT Table could request TableItems via a callback when they first become visible rather than requiring all TableItems to be created in advance. This would also allow Table to reclaim the resources for TableItems that are no longer visible.
Alternatively, the SWT Table widget could provide a Listener interface that sends notifications when rows gain and lose visibility, allowing some higher-level object to implement a deferred creation strategy.

buginformation.summary: Need to maintain settings order
buginformation.description:
Testcase: Marathon Beans - MBTJTextField Weight: 5
There are two problems, currently we can't maintain settings order. The order stored in the java file is not maintained.
The second problem is that certain properties cannot be set before other properties. Because of this we must be able to modify the order of the properties, plus we need a registry of what the proper order is for a particular class.
For example, JTextField, can't set selectionStart until after Text has been set. The problem is in this example is that the order of properties returned is independent of the order set, and due to hashing, the selectionStart may be applied before text has been set, even though in the code it is the other way around.
Waiting on EMF to support this concept.

buginformation.summary: // comment at the end of the file
buginformation.description: In the case of // comment at the end of the file, adding a button for example, will duplicate the comment. This is because JDOM (local doc) consider the // comment as part of the method

buginformation.summary: Import filter type will not reduce to xml selection
buginformation.description: When you try to import files into a java project you can not select xml files to automatically be included when trying to reduce the filter selection when selecting the filter types. Trying to add xml to other extensions does not work as xml disappears from the list. Other extensions added to the other extensions seems to work fine.

buginformation.summary: Support of implicit properties
JTabbedPane - tabText should appear on JavaBeans viewer + feedback on drop should be more explicit
buginformation.description: JTabbedPane. The JavaBeans viewer should show the tabText for the page on the JavaBeans viewer so the user knows which entry corresponds to which page Also - on graph viewer drop the feedback for new pages is not that clear. There is no visual feedback such as a rectangle or otherwise cue that a new page is being created. One thing I like is the use of hover help in other feedbacks, so maybe we need to think about things like "Create a new tab page" appearing. We could use this in other places as well in the JVE and just have more feedback to the user about what is going to occur after a drop rather than just drawing lines or highlighting GUI areas - sort of similar to what we already do for GridBagLayout and works well with row/column feedback but we could extend this to other areas

buginformation.summary: Split editors to view two parts of same file
buginformation.description: It would be very useful to be able to view two parts of the same file at the same time. An alternative would be to allow two editors to look at the same file, maybe limiting one to a read-only view.

buginformation.summary: Breakpoint can be set in an empty method
Move to use the Platform UI color support
buginformation.description: From the platform ui mailing list, there is now Color support much like the Font support. Ant should move to using the new extension points and the color support.

buginformation.summary: [RCP] New file in a java package does not default to package dir
buginformation.description:
Creating a new file in a java package, such as 'package.html', does not defaultl positions the new file within the package directory. ie: selecting package 'org.my.package', r-click, choose new->file, opens 'New File' dialog whose parent folder is the root of the workspace, rather than the /myproject/src/org/my/package/ directory, which must be browsed to manually.
Thanks,
Andrew

buginformation.summary: LD error parser always assumes error conditions
buginformation.description:
The current ld error parser always assumes that information being reported is an error rather than a warning. This makes statements such as:
ld: warning: libcpp.so.2, needed by C:/temp//libdisplay.so, may conflict with libcpp.so.3
Cause red errors instead of yellow warnings =;-)

buginformation.summary: 3.0M5 - java editing performance killed by unnecessary "Java AST creation" threads
buginformation.description:
Monitoring the "Progress" tab, I'm noticing 3.0M5 takes a ton of CPU, and it looks like the "Java AST creation" threads that happen aren't just when the java source changes, but even when the cursor just moves. Just clicking around to select things can have up to 3 or 4 of those threads going (all but one goes to "cancelled" state fine). It's making the editing basically unusable on a decent (p3/700, 512MB) system, especially when a number of cut-and-paste operations are needed. It "feels" like 3.0M4 was much more responsive on the same machine.
What things can I do or provide to help debug this if necessary?

buginformation.summary: Replace With... should not attempt replace with non existing version
buginformation.description:
Build 200312162000
1. Check out version v20031215 of org.eclipse.jdt.ui.tests and org.eclipse.jdt.ui.tests.refactoring 2. Select both project 3. Replace With...->Another Branch or Version... 4. Select version v200312161200 Observe: After the replacing has complete, org.eclipse.jdt.ui.tests.refactoring is empty. This is because there is no version v200312161200 for this project.

buginformation.summary: Process will not show as terminated after reattach
buginformation.description:
Driver: 20031211_1537
This can be reproduced using the "DetachAttachTest1" test case below. Upon reattach, the program is run to completion but the agent is not turning to "Terminated".
Instructions: 1. Launch (locally/remotely) InOut. Ensure "Boundary class included" box is NOT checked. 2. Open the Method Statistics view after the entry prompt is displayed in the Profiling Console. Refresh until no additional data is shown. 3. Detach the agent 4. Press enter in the Profiling Console. Refresh the views and verify that no additional data is displayed. 5. Attach and start monitoring the agent 6. Press enter in the Profiling Console to terminate the program. 7. Open the Execution Flow view and verify that there is no call to InOut.methodA().

buginformation.summary: Coolbars not colapsing rows after a resize.
buginformation.description:
Open the workbench and switch to the java perspective make the workbench window really small, forcing there to be a four (4) row toolbar then resize the window large again
Note that there still are 4 rows in the toolbar when they could have been collapsed back to one. This is painful because moving all the little toolitem groups back takes time
Note2, this also happens on GTK as well as MOTIF

buginformation.summary: Configuration corrupted when eclipse opened twice
buginformation.description:
Whenever I mistakenly start eclipse twice, the configuration seems to get corrupted.
Now, whenever I open window > preferences, the tree is empty, the Updates View throw an exception, etc.
Is there a workaround to get things up and running again? Other than by reinstalling eclipse, that is.
I do not know if I should post the log since it is around 1.2MB long uncompressed.

buginformation.summary: [Workbench] Two debug views
buginformation.description:
I20031218 0955
I got into a state where there were two debug views tiled together (see attached image).
When I closed one debug view, the other tab remained, but the view content area was blank. I then moved another view into the group (console view). When I closed the console view, the remaining debug view was back to normal (showing usual contents in content area).

buginformation.summary: Scrapbook launch config name is not user friendly
buginformation.description: The names used for scrapbook launch configs are not user friendly, and not meant for display in the current format. Since LC names are now displayed in the console title bar, we should change this. For example "Console - snip.jpage-Scrapbook-1071679716544".

buginformation.summary: [SSH2] JSchException: channel is not open
buginformation.description:
Thanks for a great plug-in it works just fine under Windows, but on Linux I experience a problem: It works when Eclipse is started, but when I have not used the cvs connection for a while (10-20 minutes maybe?). I get the following error: Authentication error: com.jcraft.jsch.JSchException: channel is not opened Seems I have to restart Eclipse to make it work again.
> I have not been able to reproduce this problem by myself yet, > but I found a defect in the code. I guess this problem will happen > in the session down by IP routers, NAT, etc., and not by the remote sshd. > Now, I have rewritten the code and he has written me that his problem has > disappeared.

buginformation.summary: Cannot create log correlation in other perspective and cannot cancel wizard
buginformation.description:
Test cases: (log_Navigator_4) Driver: hyades.runtime_1.2.0_20031217_1814.zip
To repoduce: >Import one or more log file >switch to perspective other than profiling perspective, eg resouce perspective. >File->New->Other->Profiling and Logging->Log Correlation > NO available Logs is shown >click CANCEL and cannot cancel wizard.

buginformation.summary: Log Navigator does not refresh in Symtom DB deletion
buginformation.description:
Test Case: Log_Navigator_5 Driver: hyades.runtime_1.2.0_20031217_1814.zip
To Reproduce: >Impost several reomote Symtom DB >In Log Navigator, delete a symtom db > Log Navigaot is NOT refresh to reflect the deletion made > and multiple deletion can be made on the delected symtom bm.

buginformation.summary: Tracing options not honored.
buginformation.description:
20031217 Create launching configuration. Enable tracing, change some tracing option values.
After launching tracing options that were changed in the launching configuration have the wrong values (the defaults), not ones specified in the launching configurations. Going to launching configuration, to double check the options reveals that the choices were also not saved. All the tracting options show default values (from file).

buginformation.summary: Replace doesn't open next file anymore
buginformation.description:
I20031218
- create project - add to text files containing the content "eclipse" - search for eclipse in project - open replace dialog - replace eclipse with 3clipse - press replace
observe: the first file is removed from the search matches, but next file doesn't open. Nothing in log.

buginformation.summary: Refresh from Local is not consistant as in PD Expolorer
buginformation.description: Import some logs, save the logs, import a symtom db and create a log correlation. and then run a refresh from local, the view is not update.

buginformation.summary: number of calls is incorrect for serverImpl()
buginformation.description:
machine:peanut driver: 20031218_1210
Problems: the number of calls of serverImpl() I get is 1, while the testcase description state that it should be 6. (i also looked into the source code it should be 6)
Steps to recreate problem: 1. Launch (locally/remotely) StatisticsTest 8>Press enter in the profiling console until it terminates 9>Open Instance Statistics window and verify that there is the following class information.
Class Name Live Instances StatisticsTest 0 Reporter 1 ServerImpl 1
10>Open Method Statistics window and verify the following:
Method Name Calls Reporter() 1 getQuote() 2 loadNewVersionOfServer() 6 main() 1 ServerImpl() 6 (on HP,Solaris method name is -clinit-()) test1() 2

buginformation.summary: Current Update Manager unacceptable for new users
buginformation.description:
Currently the new user using the update manager for installing has to install 3 components separately.
This is unacceptable for the following reasons:
-no guidelines on the order of installing the components (ambiguous to the user) -there 15 ways to install the CDT components for testing even though 12 of them does not make any sense. -you cannot create a C/C++ project if you are installing only the CDT (managed and standard projects are only available by installing the build components) -there is a Component ID error when installing only the CDT and Managed Build components
Suggestion: -for users, one package to install is the best way.
This has to be done soon so that we can have time to test the customer scenario before release.

buginformation.summary: M5 New File from context Menu of a package does not work
buginformation.description:
This is on 3.0M5. When I want to create a new file directly in a package, the wizard window won't select the associated directory. In fact, all the fields of the window are blank.
On previous version, when doing the explained action, the directory of the selected package would automatically be selected in the "New File" window.

buginformation.summary: SWT shell cannot gain focus
buginformation.description:
SWT shell displays but cannot gain focus. This occurs with numerous applications using the SWT toolkit, including the examples from org.eclipse.swt.examples. (for example, the Hello example). After trying to select the SWT shell using the mouse to gain focus, I get a "bus error" with no other details provided.
I'm running Max OS-X 10.3.2, but have also seen the problem on 10.3.1 and 10.3.0, in all cases using libswt-carbon-2135.jnilib. Running Java 1.4.1_01.

buginformation.summary: [plan item] IBM-Rational Managed Build Enhancements
buginformation.description: This is a partial SRS for the managed build system for the CDT 2.0 release. A long list of requirements was compiled based on feedback we received from a number of end users. However, there were simply too many suggestions for us to implement in the time we have allocated to this release. This document describes the requirements that we feel are important to the end-user experience and that should be considered for the next release of the managed build system. That said, the requirements that are not on the short list are all valid, and if some other partner wishes to contribute the work, then they can also be considered for the release.

buginformation.summary: build project fails after build clean
buginformation.description:
Right-click project in C/C++ Projects View - select "Build Make Target..." - build target "clean" Right-click project again - select "Build Project"
The build should start but instead nothing happens.

buginformation.summary: GTK fires additional events than Windows when selecting a Combo item
buginformation.description:
When running org.eclipse.swt.examples in package controlexample, I selected 4 kind of event listeners for Combo widget: Selection, defaultSelection, FocusIn, FocusOut. Then I click the combo and select a different item. The event console shows 4 events in the following order:
FocusIn, FocusOut, Selection, FocusIn
Repeat the same steps on WondowsXP, 2 events are fired: FocusIn, Selection.

buginformation.summary: Cumulative time for main() is much less than expected on iSeries
buginformation.description:
On the iSeries, the cumulative time for the main() method is too small. For our InOut test case, the cumulative time for main() is 0.062582 sec but the actual elapsed time is 8.788 sec.
This is an iSeries JVMPI specific bug.

buginformation.summary: Badindentation and TAB key behavior after an opening parenthesis
buginformation.description:
I am reporting what I consider a new, flawed behavior of the TAB key in 3.0M5, as compared to the 2.1.x versions.
My test scenario:
I enter a line in the Java editor which ends with a ( and hit ENTER. In both 2.1.x and 3.0M5 the caret is moved to the following line (as expected). However, 3.0M5 automatically inserts 2 extra tabs in that new line. 2.1.x does not try to outsmart me and places the caret at the indentation level, i.e. start of the new line in context of the current block. At this point I should mention that I want to indent the following line with just ONE tab. Example:
{ someMethodName( arg1, arg2, arg3); // ok! }
What 3.0M5 forces is:
{ someMethodName( arg1, arg2, arg3); // WRONG! }
So to get back to preferred state in 3.0M5, I have to hit backspace 4 times after hitting ENTER (as I use space-for-tab substitution).
There is yet another related situation in which 3.0M5 "helps" to reduce my typing speed and temper. Suppose that I place the caret at the block indentation level (below "s" in the example), or even an the very beginning of the line following the one with (. When I hit TAB now, and it results in a huge caret jump to the location where "arg1" begins in the flawed version.
I thought that it may be some new crazy preference in 3.0, but I did not find any way to disable it. Fiddling with both "smart cursor positioning" preferences under "Java/Editor/Typing" does not help.

buginformation.summary: User entries' classpath top element should be always displayed, even if empty
buginformation.description:
If the user classpath is empty (for example, a launch configuration without project, or if the user removes everything),the 'User entries' top element is not displayed when the classpath tab is recreated.
I see two problems: - if a new user sees that, he won't know that there should be a 'User entries' element. - the only way I found to add back the element, is to select 'Restore Default Entries', which delete all changes done on the boot classpath.
I think 'User entries' should be always displayed.

buginformation.summary: Strange formatting (bold) in Javadoc pop-ups
buginformation.description: Random parts of the Javadoc help shown on mouse hover are drawn in bold face. This happens consistently for many, though not all, javadoc descriptions. I am using Linux with GTK 2.2.4. See the attached screenshot for an example.

buginformation.summary: [JUnit] The "Runs", "Errors" and "Failures" fields accept keyboard focus
buginformation.description:
Click on the "Runs" value displayed in the JUnit view. A blinking caret will appear. Because these fields never contain more than a single, at most two numbers, it does not seem that you need to support keyboard focus for copy/paste's sake.
I tested on Linux GTK 2.2.4, but I guess that the same problem will be reproducible under Windows, too.

buginformation.summary: Pref Pages Team/CVS/SSH2 Connection Method/General - Private key text problem
buginformation.description:
Open the preference page.
Select the entire contents of the "Private key" text field.
Press "Delete" key -> the text field should be empty now.
Now click on the "Add Private Key..." button and select a key.
Observe the key will be added to the text field but will be prefixed by a ","

buginformation.summary: [templates] QuickFix: Surround with do,for,etc is suggested when class/method selected
buginformation.description: If you select a method or class, and then open QuickFix, it suggests Surround with do,for,etc which doesn't seem correct.

buginformation.summary: [SSH2] Passphrase validation warning in wizard
buginformation.description:
The following behavior would be appreciated:
Empty passphrase/Empty confirm:
Typing in passphrase -> no error message. Typing in confirm -> error message "don't match" (unless they match .)
Empty passphrase/Non-empty confirm
Typing in passphrase text -> error message "don't match" (unless they match .)
@@@@
There could be a warning that not having a passphrase (i.e. both text fields are empty) is insecure.

buginformation.summary: Pref Pages Team/CVS/SSH2 Connection Method/Key Management - Comment
buginformation.description: Changing the comment in the comment text should immediately update the comment in the preview above.

buginformation.summary: Pref Pages Team/CVS/SSH2 Connection Method/General - Button size
buginformation.description: The "Browse..." and "Add Private Key..." buttons should be in their "natural" size and not be sized according to a Layout.

buginformation.summary: NullpointerException in TypeBinding.getInterfaces().
buginformation.description:
get an NullPointerException in TypeBinding.getInterface() line 189.
this method should handle NullPointerException and return NO_INTERFACES.

buginformation.summary: Delete an entire line
buginformation.description: A nice feature I would like to see added is the ability to delete an entire line of text by pressing shift and delete.

buginformation.summary: Source/uncomment does not work
buginformation.description:
M6, german keyboard layout, configuration: default. The command source/uncomment has the key sequence Ctrl+\ assigned, which does not work with a german keyboard. However, i also was unable to assign a more appropriate key sequence. Toggling using Ctrl+Shift+/ does not work, either.
Ref.: http://carbon.cudenver.edu/~tphillip/GermanKeyboardLayout.html http://www.microsoft.com/globaldev/keyboards/kbdgr.htm

buginformation.summary: New code formatter prefs: can't look at predefined profiles [code formatter]
buginformation.description:
I200312162000
I am forced to create a new copy of predefined profiles to see the settings.

buginformation.summary: outline and ant runner views should include imported targets
buginformation.description:
In handling an imported file (using the <import> task), the outline and ant runner views should behave similarly as when entity includeds are used.
The difficulty in implementing this, I am guessing, is that imports are probably resolved at runtime rather than at parse time. A build file author might, perhaps, use a property dereference to in the <import file=""/> declaration. To accomediate this an action in the views could prompt the user with a dialog allowing him to associate the import with a specific file in the file system. This configuration detail could be saved in a comment in the build file itself or else in some other configuration store.
Of course, we could handle direct file references now and code for property dereferences in the import's file attribute later.

buginformation.summary: [External Tools] Add the ability to associate an external tool with an extension
buginformation.description:
It would be nice to allow one to run an external tool whenever a file with a certain extension, or pattern, is modified. This is useful when it's not really worth writing an editor for some particular type of file, but it must still be compiled or processed in some manner. I would imagine the UI to be similar to that of the "File Associations" preferences page, except that multiple external tools could be specified, with order being significant.
The particular use case that I have is developing applications for the Hiptop platform ( http://www.danger.com/ ). The Hiptop folks have defined a file of type .rsrc (resource), which is a fairly simple text file. I would like the ability to launch the Danger Resource Compiler external tool that I have defined whenever I save the file in the default text editor. Currently I must do it manually, which is a little clunky and error-prone. I could (and perhaps I will) make a plugin that is specifically meant to edit that type of file, but in the meantime, it would be nice to have the aforementioned tool-launching ability.
It may be that this functionality already exists somewhere; but I cannot find it if it does. :)

buginformation.summary: AspectJ weaver API is not threadsafe
buginformation.description: I am using the weaver API (mostly BcelWorld and BcelWeaer) in a multithreaded environment and ran into problems. I tracked them down to some static variables in the BCEL library implementation that can cause exceptions in the weaver (signatures are not parsed correctly) when executed via mulitiple threads. Maybe the weaver implementation can use the BCEL library in a threadsafe way to allow multiple threads working with the weaver API.

buginformation.summary: Source control folders should not be visible in package view
buginformation.description:
When using folder based source control e.g. CVS and Subversion, the CVS folders appear in the package view of the application. I'll try and do a simple ACSII drawing of this
Assuming your source is in src you get
+ src + CVS - empty + foo.CVS - empty + foo.myPackage - has content + foo.myPackage.CVS - empty
All the CVS entries should not be present, they should be ignored as they're not valid packages. Same applies to .SVN folders if your using subversion. You probably should be able to configure eclipse to tell it what files to ignore.

buginformation.summary: FTP Sync wants me tu upload non-existant file
buginformation.description:
I have trouble syncing my projects with remote FTP server. Sometimes the FTP Sync gets mixed up somehow and offers me stupid things to do like uploading a non-existant file.
see attackement for esample

buginformation.summary: Remote empty for outgoing deletion on branch
buginformation.description: I opened a compare editor on an outgoing deletion and both the local and remote were empty. The error in the log said 'Exception creating editor: File does not exist" but there was no stack trace.

buginformation.summary: Spelling mistake in the FORMATTER_INSERT_SPACE_BETWEEN_EMPTY_ARGUMENTS string constant
[CellEditors] Need StyledTextCellEditor
buginformation.description:
GEF needs to support editing of word-wrapped strings using CellEditors. We tried using TextCellEditor with MULTI | WRAP style bits. It is problematic due to its limitations on win32.
Our workaround is to use StyledText. Therefore, we need a StyledTextCellEditor.
We can provide the test case and implementation if needed.

Snippet 98 missing import statements

buginformation.summary: Source action to generate a default constructor [code manipulation]
buginformation.description:
From bug 49419
I also would like to see some additional menu items in the editor's context menu. In the submenu Source, I wuold add some features:
- Add default constructor - Add default destructor - Inherit from (only when I select a Class in the editor)

buginformation.summary: New Code Formatter pref page: White Space: Mixed capitalization [code formatter]
buginformation.description:
I20031216
Edit a profile using the new code formatter pref page, go to "White Space" tab: some terms are fully capitalized (e.g. Member Functions) while others only start with a big letter (e.g. Control statements).
The page should use everywhere the same pattern.

buginformation.summary: API to get access to a IColorManager implementation
buginformation.description:
For the WSADIE tooling, we have an expression editor which uses a java-like syntax. We would like to reuse the color define by the java editor (for strings, keywords, other).
I found the public interface IJavaColorConstants and IColorManager. But I could not find an API to get access to an implementation of IColorManager. The only thing I could find was JavaPlugin.getDefault().getJavaTextTools ().getColorManager(). But JavaPlugin is an internal class.
Is there some API I did not see to accomplish this? If not, could one be added?

buginformation.summary: Table row doesn't stay colored as selected when editor is displayed on Linux
StyledText control not wrapping correctly.
[JUnit] JUnit - Run Test for Class
buginformation.description:
If I just want to test a single unit of the application, I do not want to look for the corresponding test case. I thought that selecting the class in the package explorer should bring up the option "Run JUnit Test for Class". The corresponding test is then looked up and run automatically.
The same could be implemented for a set of classes or a package.

buginformation.summary: Project-wide default for Junit Plug-in Test "requires UI"
buginformation.description: Currently, when I do "Run as JUnit Plug-in Test", the option on the Arguments Tab "Plug-in Tests require a user interface" defaults to checked. I would like to be able to set this to default off on a project-wide basis.

buginformation.summary: dump only changed classes
buginformation.description:
As suggested by William Louth on aspectj-users, could the compiler support a flag to only dump unchanged classes? That would permit a simple copy rule for updating jars and provide the SCM world with concrete de-minimus proof and protection against aspects gone wild. It might soothe some of the pain if we don't fully support -outjar.
For those interested in contributing a patch on point, Jim suggested how to implement this: modify the method org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.BcelWeaver.dumpUnchanged to do nothing.

buginformation.description:
User shuts down eclipse by clicking the X box in the top right hand corner and the JVM crashes. Any suggestions as to possible causes? Error log follows. Note: This is an intermittent problem but it occurs enough to be a concern (approx. 1 shutdown in 50).

buginformation.summary: [Workbench] Weird Java perspective icon in action bar
buginformation.description:
See attachment.
Version: 3.0.0 Build id: 200401070010 GTK build
Steps to reproduce:
New workspace.
Clicking on the "Open a Perspective" button will show the regular icon.
Once I've opened the perspective the checkmark icon will be shown after clicking on the "Open a Perspective" button again.

buginformation.summary: change tooltips on-the-fly
buginformation.description: It would be nice to change a tooltip and have it appear on the fly. A specially useful case would be to set the tootip to null and have it disappear right away.

buginformation.summary: [Commands] Search action gone after a while
buginformation.description:
I20031211
After working a while with Eclips the actions in the global search menu are all disabled. Got the impression that this happens on perspective switching but don't have a reproducable case.

buginformation.summary: eclipse won't start under Solaris using eclipse 2.1.2.1.
buginformation.description:
After installing on Solaris 8 eclipse does not run.
I believe the problem is because the java command in jre/bin is just a script containing the line: .java_wrapper
.java_wrapper looks parses $0 and uses it for progname: progname=`/usr/bin/basename $0`
On our system progname was set to .java_wrapper and eclipse failed to run because: prog="$APPHOME/bin/${proc}/${ttype}/${progname}"
# Run. if [[ -x "$prog" ]] then # Calling: exec $DEBUG_PROG "$prog" "$@" exec $DEBUG_PROG "$prog" "$@" else echo >&2 "$progname was not found in ${prog}" exit 1 fi
Changing java to be a hard link to .java_wrapper solved this problem.

buginformation.summary: New code formatter prefs: No feedback when loading invalid profiel [code formatter]
buginformation.description:
I200312162000
When loading an XML file which contains no or invalid syntax nothing happens (at least that's my impression). The user should get feedback.

buginformation.summary: error logged showing annotation for non-shared resource
buginformation.description:
M6
- in the Navigator expand a java project's bin directory - drill down if needed until you reach a contained .class file - select it, right-click and invoke popup item Team -> Show Annotation - an error dialog is shown saying that this can't be done
Two problems: 1. There's a real exception occurring here; a stack trace is written to .log and the error dialog is an actual Error Dialog. This should be handled better. 2. The error message that's shown says "Cannot display...an remote revision", where "an" should be "a"

buginformation.summary: Accessibility-Duplicate Mnemonics on C/C++Editor page
buginformation.description: An accessibility requirement is that when a mnenomic is activated, the target control gets a visual focus. If a label has an underlined letter x, hitting Alt+x will bring that label's control to focus. Where there are duplicated mnemonics visible, then the second one never gets focus. Here are the duplicates mnemonics in the C/C++ Editor Preferences page: Overall: 'Annotations' and 'Apply' (a) General Tab 'Insert space for tabs' and 'Content Assist' tab (s) 'highlight matching brackets' and 'show print margin' (m) 'highlight current line' and 'Colors' tab (c) Colors Tab 'Bold' (b) doesn't bring focus Content Assist Tab 'Search current file' and 'Content Assist' tab (s) 'Search current project' and 'Insert single proposals' (p)

buginformation.summary: JUnit and the green color [JUnit]
buginformation.description:
Well I am checking out the Eclipse M6 stable and got a bit disapointed about the color of the most important(!) green bar of the JUnit TestRunner. The color looks awful. I am missing the bright and sunny green bar, where is it?.
Best would be to add a color picker for every color possible in the preference page of the JUnit plugin. Whouldn't be that hard to implement I guess - I've read the contribution book, therefore I know what I am speaking about *g ;-).
Well to summerize it,
* Current green bar looks awfull dark, but I need it to shine sunny and bright to encourage me! (and my folks too ;) * Best would be to add a bunch of color properties to the property page of JUnit
Thanks for considering,
Martin (Kersten)
PS: Who the hack likes that dark one?;) Someone made that change and had to clap his shoulder in selfconfidence. (I've never meat one who likes that kind of green)
My System: Win2K, Eclipse M6

buginformation.summary: [History View] Can't select words by doubleclick in CVS Resource History Comment Viewer
buginformation.description: I sometimes want to copy a bug number from the lower-right 'Comment Viewer' of the CVS Resource History view. Unfortunately, doubleclicking the word doesn't select it.

buginformation.summary: Drawing directly to GC "flickers"
buginformation.description:
On Linux-GTK, if you draw images directly to the GC (using GC.drawImage()) the image flickers on each re-draw, even if it's exactly the same as before.
This is testable on GC created from tables or canvas.
If you can't reproduce it, I'll post a snippet

buginformation.summary: GridBagLayout conversion should use "elastic" properties
buginformation.description: Currently VE does convert null layout into gridBagLayouts by using insets and padding to get exactly the same appereance. Quite often this is not what I'm trying to get, I'd prefer to have a way to use "elastic" properties of the constraint such as placement and weight instead, so that when the form resizes the control keep their relative position (even if this means not getting exactly the same positioning as in the null layout).

buginformation.summary: problems during CVS team -> unedit
buginformation.description:
Hi,
When I try to use the unedit feature during CVS "teamplay" (after I have demolished my code ;-)), I get the following error pop-up:
"Problems encountered while moving recources"
When I push the OK button, my source isn't available anymore in my "Package Explorer view". So I have to update the source from the CVS repository.
Do you know what's wrong with my Eclipse (version 3.0.0M6).
Any help is greatly appreciated.
Tnx, Martijn

buginformation.summary: C-Build not updating in the first compilation.
buginformation.description:
The C-Build panel opens but shows nothing during the first compilation using Eclipse. Subsequent compilations work fine.
The C-Build panel is in 'FastView' mode.

buginformation.summary: Breakpoint hit not reported on remote debug session
buginformation.description:
I try to debug a java application (Jboss in my case) with a remote debug connection on Eclipse 3.0M6 (connection type "Socket Attach", remote JVM as well as local JVM is sun 1.4.1_02)
I set a breakpoint with "Suspend Thread" attribute on a certain place within my application. I know that the breakpoint is hit, because the remote application stops, but the breakpoint hit is not shown in Eclipse, all threads of the remote application are still shown as running.
When I change the breakpoint to "Suspend VM" everything works as expected.

buginformation.summary: Shift-space content assist hotkey interferes with typing
buginformation.description:
3.0 M6 and I20031218
Recent versions of Eclipse open a content-assist window when typing shift-space. Previous versions of Eclipse (and most other windows applications) treat shift-space like a normal space. This change can make it difficult to type punctuation followed by a space.

buginformation.summary: DCR: New SelectionTool with support for panning
buginformation.description:
Create a new SelectionTool subclass. I want it to behave exactly like the existing selection tool, with the following additions:
- When selection tool is in its initial state, if it receives the SPACE keydown, it will switch to a PAN state - While in the PAN (or PAN_IN_PROGRESS) state, a hand cursor will appear - If I mouse down in the pan state, I will transition to a PAN_IN_PROGRESS state which allows scrolling the viewport by pressing and dragging the mouse. - When leaving the state PAN_IN_PROGRESS, return to either the PAN state or the STATE_INITIAL based on whether the SPACE bar is still depressed.
Use the obvious name choices for constants, not exactly what I've used. Pratik to review changes before releasing.

buginformation.summary: update class path should prompt to save the plugin.xml
buginformation.description:
If you edit build.xml and then do update class path you are not prompted to save the build.xml file. This can make things very confusing (and anything which improves the comprehension of plugin classpath juggling is a good thing)
Ideally this classpath update should happen automatically

buginformation.summary: Double-click and quick fix annotations
buginformation.description:
Build: I20040106
I was annoyed by the fact that warning annotations hid my breakpoints, and by the fact that double-clicking in the vertical rule to add/remove a breakpoint also caused the quick-fix shell to pop up.
So, I removed the warning annotation from the vertical ruler from the java editor preference page.
However, even after removing the annotation from the ruler, double-clicking on a line that contains a warning still causes the quick fix shell to open. It seems that the action associated with that annotation should not happen when the annotation is turned off.

buginformation.summary: [source lookup] Call stack editor annotation ambiguous
buginformation.description:
Build: 3.0 M6
If I have two threads suspended with the same method somewhere in their call stack, I cannot distinguish between the two because both are highlighted in the same way in the editor. I would expect only the call stack of the selected thread to be displayed in the editor (not the stacks of all threads).

buginformation.summary: [TableEdtior] Several wierd behaviors in TableEditor
Add an option to control alignment for constructor declaration parameters vs method declaration parameters
buginformation.description: These two are merged for now and we should have a different option to be consistent with other options added for method declaration.

buginformation.summary: Create Patch wizard should remember path in file system
buginformation.description:
Each time I create a patch, I have to click on "Save In File System" and then hit the 'Browse...' button in order to enter a path. This is tedious as I usually put my patches into the same location each time.
The wizard should remember the user's last path in the file system if one has ever been entered. Optionally, also the radio button's position could be remembered, but this is less of a problem as only one click is needed to set it up.

buginformation.summary: [DCR] Quick assist : unneeded bracing
[Viewers] Compare editor should show hovers indicating change types
buginformation.description:
The compare editor should show a text hover for items in the overview ruler and for the icon indicating the change type (see attached screenshot).
The hovers should tell the user what kind of change the colors and icons stand for: Incoming Change, Outgoing Change, Conflicting Change.

buginformation.summary: JavaDoc of ITypeBinding#isLocal() talks about local interfaces
buginformation.description: The JavaDoc of ITypeBinding#isLocal() talks about local types and local interfaces. If I understood the JLS-2.0 correctly, interfaces cannot be local (there are only local *classes*).

buginformation.summary: CVS Annotate switches to CVS Perspective
buginformation.description:
The CVS Annotation feature switches to the CVS Perspective irregardless of what you are doing. We would prefer that it remain on the current perspective (generally the JDT) or at least that this was a configurable option.
Thank you for your time.

buginformation.summary: Nothing happens when launching
buginformation.description:
I20030113
I first thought there's a severe bug in Debug: after importing the latest build and clicking on the Run (and later Debug) buttons in the toolbar nothing happened, no UI feedback and the Debug view was empty.
I then remembered that I recently chose to always wait until a build is finished (Debug preference). Going to the Process view I saw tons of Launch jobs waiting.
There needs to be better feedback. I suggest to show those launches in the Debug view.

buginformation.summary: setRawClasspath(...) should fire a F_CLASSPATH_CHANGED delta
buginformation.description:
Build 20041013
As described in bug 38513 , calling IJavaProject.setRawClasspath(...) currently fires no delta when the resolved classpath is the same. It should always fire a F_CLASSPATH_CHANGED delta if the raw classpath has changed. This new flag would be attached to an IJavaProject delta.

buginformation.summary: [EditorMgmt] Typo in IPageLayout.ID_EDITOR_AREA = "org.eclipse.ui.editorss"
buginformation.description: Someone asked me if they could add a few to a perspective relative to the editor area instead of another view. I believe the answer should be yes, they just have to refer to the area by name in their plugin.xml. However, looking at the source code, the editor area name is defined by the constant IPageLayout.ID_EDITOR_AREA which has the value "org.eclipse.ui.editorss". This looks like a typo so it probably shouldn't be documented this way and it should be changed. Changing it would probably break binary compatibility but I think you can just add a check to test for both the right and wrong values in IPageLayout.addView() and any similar functions to support plug-ins using the old value.

buginformation.summary: AntEditorPreferencePage does not present all of the annotation prefs
buginformation.description:
Show in vertical ruler and Highlight in text are not exposed on the Ant Editor Annotations tab.
See the Java Editor for example.

buginformation.summary: Highlight in text annotation preference does not work for Ant Editor
buginformation.description:
In the Ant Editor set bookmark annotations to highlight text (using the Ant editor preference page annotation tab). Add a bookmark to an Ant editor.
The text is not highlighted.
Compare with a generic text editor

buginformation.summary: Help says "Repositories" instead of "Navigator"
buginformation.description: Workbench User Guide>Getting started>Basic tutorial>Perspectives>Saving Perspectives should say "we saved the perspective with Navigator and Outline stacked" instead of "we saved the perspective with Repositories and Outline stacked".

buginformation.summary: Error importing a IHS Error Log
buginformation.description: AC build:20040113_2042 OS: LinuxGTK When I try to import an IHS Error Log from the com.ibm.etoos.logging.adapter.config plugin, I get the error hyades.logging.LogParser saying that the file contains no error records when it actually does.

buginformation.summary: Hidden Tabs for spaces dialog
buginformation.description: The switch to the new code formatter hides the dialog Code Formatter/Style and makes it hard for me to change "Insert Tabs for spaces" This flag seems to be used when inserting templates for methods etc to control the indentation (I don't want tabs).

buginformation.summary: GLA does not generate error messages for missing/invalid/empty log files.
buginformation.description: GLA does not generate error messages for missing/invalid/empty log files.

buginformation.summary: [PropertiesView] allow property pages to handle multi select
buginformation.description: The current PropertyPage system is hard wired to only allow a single selection. It would be nice if it was similar to the popupmenu system - this allows multiple selections and works out common things between the selection. I know this is not a trivial thing to provide - but I thought I put in the suggestion. Example of use - select multiple files and set readonly on them all. Very useful in RCP apps (select multple product items and change discount%)

buginformation.summary: The code formatter should be enhanced to handle XDoclet tags better.
buginformation.description:
The code formatter keeps changing my java doc from /** * @ejb.bean * name = "CustomProperty" * display-name = "Custom Property EJB" * jndi-name = "ejb/CustomPropertyHome" * local-jndi-name = "ejb/CustomPropertyLocalHome" * type = "CMP" * cmp-version = "2.x" * schema = "CustomProperty" * primkey-field = "identityKey" * description = "A user/application defined name and value pair." * view-type = "local" * transaction-type = "Container" * * @ejb.value-object * name = "CustomProperty" * match = "*" * * @ejb.persistence * table-name = "CUSTOMPROPERTY" * */
to
/** * @ejb.bean name = "CustomProperty" display-name = "Custom Property EJB" * jndi-name = "ejb/CustomPropertyHome" local-jndi-name = * "ejb/CustomPropertyLocalHome" type = "CMP" cmp-version = "2.x" schema = * "CustomProperty" primkey-field = "identityKey" description = "A * user/application defined name and value pair." view-type = "local" * transaction-type = "Container" * * @ejb.value-object name = "CustomProperty" match = "*" * * @ejb.persistence table-name = "CUSTOMPROPERTY" * */
The only solution I have found is to turn off comment formatting which is a great loss. It would be better if there was a way to maintain the formatting in these cases.

best regards

buginformation.summary: New code formatter: ?: uses "default indentation"
buginformation.description:
Note: This only applies only to typing. Formatter is as expected when invoking the formatter on the block.
I start typing this expression:
foo = bar != null ?_
(_ = cursor)
Now if I hit Enter, and continue typing blindly, I get:
foo = bar != null ? bar : foo;
instead of the expected:
foo = bar != null ? bar : foo;
In the new formatter prefs, "Line Wrapping "tab", I have set the indentation policy of "Conditionals" to "indent by one".

buginformation.summary: Missing localizations for extension point names
buginformation.description:
See bug 50174 .
3.0 M6
While using the Plugin Registry view, i noticed that some extension points showed up with non-localized names. Perhaps missing resource translations should be logged to the platform log, as it indicates the programmer has forgotten to translate something. I got htis list by logging MREs in the BundelModel class.
Here is a list of all the missing resource keys (and their plugin) that i could find: org.eclipse.core.variables %valueVariablesExtensionPointName org.eclipse.core.variables %dynamicVariablesExtensionPointName
org.eclipse.debug.core %logicalStructureTypesExtensionPointName
org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui %vmInstallTypePage
org.eclipse.jdt.ui %deleteProcessorExtensionPoint
org.eclipse.team.ui %ActionSet.description
org.eclipse.ui %ExtPoint.actionSetPartAssociations org.eclipse.ui %ExtPoint.elementFactories
org.eclipse.ui.editors %ExtPoint.documentProviders org.eclipse.ui.editors %ExtPoint.markerUpdaters
org.eclipse.ui.workbench.texteditor %category.textEditor.description
