buginformation.description: default

buginformation.summary: Error in the XSD facet item providers
buginformation.description: The problem is in the item providers for the XSD facets. Each XSD facet item provider has a getPropertyDescriptors(Object) method that creates the property descriptor for the "Value" property. The logic in the provider incorrectly set the EStructuralFeature reference to be the one found in the super class and not the feature value for the subclass. The error was specifically found in the XSDMaxLengthFacetItemProvider and XSDMinLengthFacetItemProvider classes. For example, XSDMaxLengthFacetItemProvider calls xsdPackage.getXSDMaxFacet_Value() instead of xsdPackage.getXSDMaxLengthFacet_Value().

buginformation.summary: Vertical scrollbar is not created as expected
[Commands] Error in command schema context definition
buginformation.description:
The explanation of the "context" definition within the org.eclipse.ui.commands extension point schema includes both a "parent" and "parentId" attribute. Since the descriptions are identical, it looks like one of them is outdated?
# parent - The unique id of the parent context. If this context has a parent, it will borrow all key bindings from its parent, in addition to the key bindings defined in its own context. # parentId - The unique id of the parent context. If this context has a parent, it will borrow all key bindings from its parent, in addition to the key bindings defined in its own context.

buginformation.summary: Paste omits a character
[SSH2] Keyboard-interactive authentication support has not been supported.
buginformation.description:
My original eclipse-cvsssh2 plug-in has supported the keyboard-interactive authentication, but that functionality has been dropped at
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/org.eclipse.team.cvs.ssh2/src/org/eclip se/team/ccvs/ssh2/JSchSession.java.diff?r1=1.5&r2=1.6
Can I hear the reason about it? And, is there no plan to support it again? The keyboard-interactive authentication will be very useful for enterprise users, who require SecurID and S/Key, etc., authentication to get accesses to their sshd.
I know how to support it, but some modifications will be required in org.eclipse.team.cvs.core and org.eclipse.team.cvs.ui and I'm not a committer for them. So, I must ask for help if I will.

buginformation.summary: BiDi bug: SWT controls flip the alignment if SWT.RIGHT_TO_LEFT style is set.
buginformation.description:
If SWT.RIGHT_TO_LEFT style is set, some SWT contols also change the alignment direction. If the alignment is right, then set SWT.RIGHT_TO_LEFT style, we see the alignment becomes left, and vice versa. This never happen on J2SE Swing. Swing does not change the alignment, even if the component orientation is RTL or LTR.
Steps to reproduce:
1. Download the following files on http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/index.php and install them: eclipse-SDK-3.0M6-win32.zip eclipse-examples-3.0M6-win32.zip 2. In the example, set RTL_SUPPORT_ENABLE = true in org.eclipse.swt.examples.controlexample.Tab.java in org.eclipse.swt.example plugin. 3. Rebuild org.eclipse.swt.example plugin. 4. Launch "SWT Examples\SWT controls" view 5. Click "Button" tab on the SWT controls view 6. Change "Size" to "100x100" 7. Change "Alignment" to Left. 8. Change "Orientation" to SWT.RIGHT_TO_LEFT and SWT.LEFT_TO_RIGHT. 9. You can see the visual alignment is also flipped. The alignment should not be changed, whatever the orientation setting is.
In addition, I see the same problem in the following cases: "SWT Example\SWT controls" view: Button, Label, "SWT Examples\SWT Custom controls" view: CLabel
Test OS: Windows2000 SP3 Test Java platform: Sun Java2 SDK 1.4.1_06

buginformation.summary: Compile errors fixed by 'refresh' do not reset problem list or package explorer error states
buginformation.description:
When you have a project that also references external jars, there appears to be a problem with error tagging.
Consider the following example:
I have a project that has some code that references external jars.
In the first instance, there were missing methods in classes in the external jars, so the compile failed. The open editor displayed the errors, as did the Package Explorer and the Problems view.
I replaced the external jar with one that fixed the errors, and did a Project 'refresh' from the package explorer.
The rebuild occurred and, in the open editor, all indications of the error state disappeared.
However, the Problems view still displays all of the original compilation problems (now resolved), and the Package Explorer still has a red 'x' next to the class and package that had the problems.
Doing a "rebuild all" correctly resets the state of the Package Explorer and Problems view.
It would seem that the build done by the 'refresh' does not clear the error states in the views before performing the compilation.

buginformation.summary: [workspace] Fails building plugin JARs with multiple source folders
buginformation.description:
We have several plugin projects where we use source folders to organize our code. It is not uncommon to have a plugin with five source folders each of which is built into a seperate runtime JAR. This setup compiles fine and runs just fine but the PDE build is failing. It fails because our source folders depend upon each other and PDE requires that a dependent JAR be built first. The problem is that since they depend on each other, it doesn't matter which order we put the JARs in the build.properties file, it will always fail.
An example is a plugin with three runtime libraries mapped to three source folders A, B, and C where A depends on B and C and C depends on A.

buginformation.summary: [Decorators] Decorator mechanism does not allow for optimizations
buginformation.description:
At present our decorators show up piecemeal because we do them in a background thread and thus the order they appear is 'random'.
The way we decorator mechanism works does not allow us to optimize in some areas. Specificly:
1. The icon and text are asked for separately. This requires us to go to our sync info twice, which is on disk and expensive to get.
2. The decorators are asked individually. In the case of CVS, all the sync info for sibling resources is in the same file, so its faster for us to determine all their decorators at once.
3. In order to avoid doing work in the UI thread, we create a background thread to generate the decorators. When then need to tell the UI via an event that we now have decorators, and then they ask us for them. It would be better if we could just give the UI the decorators we know about all at once.
Note: to be a good citizen we should be computing the decorators in a thread different than the UI context.
The combination of #2 and #3 could result in the decorators appearing in parent child ordering, with all siblings appearing at once.

buginformation.summary: Code generation for Getter should support field JavaDoc Comment
buginformation.description: When I am setting up code generation to generate comments for my getters and setters, I would like it to copy the javadoc comment I have for those field to the javdoc comment for the getter and setter. I would propose add another variable $fieldjavadoc$ which I can insert into the template and it would mean that it locates the javadoc comment for the origina field definition and puts it into the correct place.

buginformation.summary: uppercase ZIP and JAR classpath entries ignored
buginformation.description:
From bug 45897 :
----- The JDT's ..batch.FileSystem() constructor only accepts lowercase .zip and .jar and silently ignores other entries, which affects any such entry on the classpath. (Java and Javac both handle uppercase-suffixed files fine.) Test case checked in, uses libraries org.aspectj/modules/tests/bugs/extdirs/lib/uppercase. ----- This is a bug in the jdt batch compiler. This bug should be raised against org.eclipse.jdt.core. When they fix it we'll pick up their fix. -----

buginformation.summary: Generic Log Adapter does not handle wrapping of log files
buginformation.description:
The GLA needs to handle log files which wrap. Thats is log files which shift their content up(left)as they append to the end of the file.
I have a solution to handle the following four scenarios for log processing:
1. File has had content appended to the end. 2. File has been replaced but otherwise content is appended to the end 3. File has been replaced with data shifted up/left (circular log) 4. File has been replaced with all new data.

buginformation.summary: Editor context menus don't apply to mouse location
buginformation.description: Context menus in Eclipse editors perform actions on the current cursor/selection, which is unrelated to the location the mouse was when it was right-clicked. This is inconsistent with every GUI I have ever used, as well as the behavior in other views of Eclipse. It is quite jarring.

buginformation.summary: Build Path & Runtime Path inconsistent WRT Library/Container
buginformation.description: In the build path (project properties->Java Build Path) groups of jar files are referred to as Libraries (i.e. Add Library button). In the runtime classpath (Run->Run...). The launch configuration editor refers to (what appears to be) the same thing as 'Container' (Advanced... button, Add Container: radio button).

buginformation.summary: MessageBox locks out application
buginformation.description: The following scenario causes SWT to lock under SWT for windows. A parent shell X is created and opened. Then, a text entry dialog Y (a child of the X) is opened titled "X". In this scenario, given the nature of the dialog, it is of style APPLICATION_MODAL. At some point while Y is open, the application must present an important error message. So, a MessageBox Z, also a child of X (or Y, same effect) is created and opened titled "Z". MessageBox Z will of course stay on top within the application which is intended. However, the taskbar at the bottom (under win2k) will list windows "X" and "Z". If you select "X" at the bottom, it will put windows X and Y on top and beep at any mouse or key click. Clicking "Z" at the bottom does not redraw Z back on top and the screen remains with X and Z displayed. Because the user must click okay in the message box (and is prevented from doing so, this effectively locks out the application forcing a manual termination to exit the program. Based on my testing this seems to be because the SWT thread is locked in a wait until the MessageBox (Z) is exited, so any redraw or other SWT requests are postponed indefinitely.

buginformation.summary: Compiler warns on missing Javadoc tags for private methods.
buginformation.description: The Java compiler warns on missing Javadoc tags for private methods. The Style preference page has a checkbox to enable this feature for public methods. So either the wording is wrong or there is a bug. Perhaps, the access level could be specified for this *great* feature, from private all the way to public with public the default. Thanks. Version 3.0.m5.

buginformation.description:
The "Add" button does not have a mnemonic.

buginformation.summary: Evaluation that hits breakpoint confuses debugging
buginformation.description:
Jdk1.4.1_b11
Source will be attached Set breakpoints on lines 21 and 39 Debug to a breakpoint at line 21 From the editor, display, "this.hitBreakpoint()"
you hit the breakpoint at line 39, but the thread still claims to be evaluating, no indication of the breakpoint Hit Run to Return You are back at line 21, but the thread still claims to be stepping, and the stepping actions are not enabled. Click resume and things are back to normal.

buginformation.summary: CVS History: allow to wrap comment in lower right pane

I20040124
I use the CVS History as fast view with low width. It would be nice if I could choose to wrap the comment in the lower right pane.

buginformation.summary: In M6 cannot get Plugin for a given class
buginformation.description: We have used some code for a couple of years now. This code will take a class and get its ClassLoader. It checks if the class is a PluginClassLoader and, if so, it gets the Plugin for this PluginClassLoader. Now, when we move to M6, the ClassLoader for the class is an EclipseClassLoader. I don't see a way to get back to the plugin that loaded this class. Am I missing something or is this not possible anymore when using osgi?

buginformation.summary: workspace location is not always fully qualified
A menu and/or keybinding to toggle UPPERCASE or lowercase toggling of a highlighted item.
buginformation.description: I would like to request that a keybinding and/or menu action be made so that when an user highlights a word, phrase, etc. they have the option to change the highlighted word to uppercase or, if in uppercase, to lowercase. Perhaps the action should first uppercase the entire highlighted phrase, and on a second iteration of the toggling keystoke/menu choice, the entire highlighted phrase is placed into lowercase. From my investigations, of both the Preferences->Workspace->Keys and the menus visible at the current time, there is no keybinding for the Ctrl+T key combo. Might I suggest this be the keybinding for the above suggested action.

buginformation.summary: Improve DOM/AST support for doc comments
buginformation.description: The current API for doc comments has a flat text string. This is not helpful for clients that want to analyze or change the structure of doc comments.

buginformation.summary: PDE classpath container not working with importing binary projects (SWT fragments)
buginformation.description:
3.0 M6
I downloaded 3.0 M6 today (to do some quick coding for draw2d and gef) and created a fresh install including workspace.
Steps to repeat:
1. new workspace "C:\eclipse-develop-3.0\plugins" (autobuild is still on) 2. import external features "org.eclipse.jdt" and "org.eclipse.platform" 3. import external plug-ins and fragments contained in these features as binary projects (66 of 80) 4. checkout "org.eclipse.draw2d" and "org.eclipse.gef" from CVS HEAD (they are using pde container)
Although "org.eclipse.swt" is in dependency list of "org.eclipse.draw2d" the plug-in doesn't compile and shows errors that imports "org.eclipse.swt..." can not be found.
Updating classpath for draw2d plug-in with context menu "PDE Tools -> Update Classpath..." doesn't fix the problem. You need hack the binary project (fragment) "org.eclipse.swt.win32" to export its jar and add this to the classpath manually to resolve the compile errors. After rersolving this new compile errors complain about missing "org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform" and "org.eclipse.core.runtime.IPluginDescriptor" classes.

buginformation.summary: Hook for resource scheduling rule factory
buginformation.description:
I20040121
I have released new API that allows clients to ask for the scheduling rule for various operations (copy, move, delete, validateEdit, setContents, etc). Many of these rule requirements actually vary based on the repository provider (for example CVS needs to lock the parent folder for most operations). Core needs to expose something in the TeamHook to allow repository providers to provide a rule factory.

buginformation.description:
When creating the patch for bug 50655 , parts of my change were omitted from the patch. The same problem occurred with various patches in bug 44443 . In all cases, the contents of a newly inserted switch(...) statement were omitted from the patch.
Attached is the patch that was generated for bug 50655 . The "new" directory contains the changed code, the "old" directory contains the versions in CVS, and the *.txt file is the patch that was generated. Notice that the patch is missing the contents of the switch statement on the first page.

buginformation.summary: need a cheaper way of accessing the system state
buginformation.description:
There is need for clients to make simple queries to the system state that would not require a working copy as returned by PlatformAdmin#getState.
The proposal is to have a #getState(boolean mutable) operation that allow clients to get cheap read only access to the system state.

We are currently on 1.2 but are planning to move to 2.0 soon.

buginformation.summary: Check-in the rules for Apache HTTP server access log and Apache HTTP server error log
buginformation.description: Check-in the rules for Apache HTTP server access log and Apache HTTP server error log

buginformation.summary: DCR: API to determine files that will be 'cleaned' when changing a classpath
buginformation.description:
20040129
We have several bug reports that jdt deletes files when changing the class path. The build path wizard should warn about this, but to do this correctly, we need support from core. The request is to get an API that tells me if and which files would be scrupped after changing the build path.
Releated to that is to get information which files and folders get obsolete after a class path change (e.g. old class files). Here we have the same problem that we are very unprecice as analysing the classpath settings (output location / source folder combinations, source folder specific output locations) is difficult.
see related bug 50717 , bug 20042 , bug 34843

buginformation.summary: Verification error tracing constructor that takes arguments
checkbox tree behavior in refactoring not consistent
buginformation.description:
In at least the rename-refactor wizard, after the changes have been identified, the "changes to be performed" tree's checkboxes exhibit the following behavior:
Clear a task, and expand its sub-tasks. check one of the sub-tasks. This causes the super-task to be a grey 'partial-type' checkbox (expected)
immediately clear that sub-task. This leaves no sub-tasks selected, but the super-task is still grey, indicating it is partially selected.
This may relate to a checkbox-tree SWT widget, rather than this dialog in particular.

buginformation.summary: File transfer
buginformation.description: Provide mechanism to transfer files (binary intially) from the remote machine to the local machine. This can be leveraged to pull data collection results back from the SUT at different times then the actual test is run.

buginformation.summary: Opening a very large sequence diagram hangs the UI
buginformation.description:
The vast majority of the time is spent loading the model, not drawing the diagram. There is a progress monitor dialog, but it is frozen and the user cannot cancel, even though the cancel button is enabled. All the work is still being done in the UI thread.
The solution involves forking a new thread to perform all the work except UI work. As far as displaying progress, displaying a dialog may be too intrusive. I will consider alternatives.

buginformation.summary: Importing existing binary projects leads to errors
buginformation.description:
An old problem is back. When updating existing binary projects with plugins from 1119 integration build, I got these errors in the .log:
!MESSAGE Problems detected while importing plug-ins !SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 273 Nov 19, 2002 14:57:44.109 !MESSAGE Could not delete: /org.eclipse.help.ui.win32. !SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 273 Nov 19, 2002 14:57:44.109 !MESSAGE Could not delete: /org.eclipse.ui.win32. !SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 273 Nov 19, 2002 14:57:44.109 !MESSAGE Could not delete: /org.eclipse.update.ui.win32.
That was a problem in the past. It has been fixed a while ago and it looks like something has been broken.

buginformation.summary: [ExternalTools] Cancelling project/working set scope dialog dismisses two dialogs
buginformation.description:
build 20021017
-Create a new/edit and existing external tool -Open the refresh scope dialog -Select "specific project" -Select Ok -Press ESC in the "Browse Projects" dialog or click cancel ->This dismisses both the "Browse projects" dialog and the "Browse Refresh Scope" dialog. This may be intended to hide the fact that ok in the refresh scope dialog sneaks another prompt on you. However, it is confusing and unexpected. If I clicked ok in the refresh scope dialog I probably really want to select a scope. If I click cancel in the project selection dialog I should just get back to the scope dialog. The working set selection dialog has the same problem.

buginformation.summary: [navigation] Outline popup window has problems usability
buginformation.description: The outline popup window (Navigate->Show Outline), should persist size/position changes between invocations. As well, the mouse scroll wheel does not scroll the outline when moved while on top of the member list.

buginformation.summary: [painting][preferences] annotation preference not correctly inherited
buginformation.description:
I20040129
After adding an occurrence annotation with search annotation as super type and only setting the keys and default values that differ I ended up with incorrect annotation painting.
The key problems are - default preference initialization does honor values from fragments - painters only search for "true" in the super chain and don't stop/test for false

buginformation.summary: Tab folders in Windows XP do not draw gradient background.
buginformation.description:
Some Windowing systems have added features to their look which are not being manifested when running Eclipse. These should be investagated and added where possible to accomplish a more up-to-date look.
For example I have attached a tabbed note book snapshot

buginformation.summary: Provide UI for showing call graph affected by flow advice
buginformation.description: The effects of cflow advice can be challenging to infer and currently get no help from the tool support. Now the at the IDEs are starting to show static call graphs, we can use this information to give the programmer an idea of the execution that will be affected by a cflow advice. The attached mock-up shows a first pass at how this could look in AJDT.

buginformation.summary: Difficulties with hidden files and folders
buginformation.description:
I have difficulties understanding the policies for hiding files and directories on different platforms.
On Unix and MacOS X the .metadata (and now the .config folders) are hidden. I have no problem with that. But I don't understand why most (but not all) files within these hidden directories are itself hidden too. On Unix and Mac OS X it is really a pain for ordinary users to find these hidden files (especially the .log file and now the .keyring files) within their hidden folders. And if a user has decided to look into a hidden folder .metadata, why can't she see the log file without further hassles?
The additional odd thing here is that on Windows all this '.' business seems to have no effect at all, so ordinary users have access to everything in .metadata and .config without any hurdles.
What am I missing here?

buginformation.summary: Preference Dialog goes blank after removing plugin
buginformation.description:
This was in Milestone 6. I installed the eclipse-cs plugin ( http://eclipse-cs.sourceforge.net/ ) and it didn't appear to work. The preference dialog was working fine at this time. Then I removed it and added the Checkclipse plugin ( http://www.mvmsoft.de/content/plugins/checkclipse/checkclipse.htm ), and that didn't work at all. The preference dialog wouldn't even come up. So I removed it. Preference Dialog would come up, but was empty. I reinstalled eclipse-cs, and I got the same thing. I installed both of them, and the Preference Dialog returns, but it refuses to bring up preferences for those plugins.
Here is the stack trace puke that happens when the preference dialog is blank --- java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.ui.internal.registry.RegistryReader$1.compare(RegistryReader.java:103) buginformation.summary: Wrong Number of Arguments produced by starter program
buginformation.description:
When starting Eclipse under Redhat 9 with Sun J2SDK 1.4.2_03 the starte program ./eclipse seems to produce a call to the java-environment wirh too many arguments (perhaps not taking into account the difference between windows and unix - latter gives the name of the procedure called, too). The messages in the java-webstart-window exception window is:
TooManyArgumentsException[ Zu viele Argumente angegeben: {-cp, /tmp/javawH8XtI1, org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main, -os, linux, -ws, gtk, -arch, x86, -showsplash, "/usr/eclipse/eclipse -showsplash 600" }] at com.sun.javaws.Main.main(Main.java:161)

buginformation.summary: Eclipse won't startup
buginformation.description:
Ecplise was running when I had a power failure and now it won't startup again. the message I get is to check the .log file for possible reasons why...I have attached the .log file. Thank-G-d I had my work backed up...and I then even re- installed eclipse by downloading the most recent version, but I still get the same error even though I had no workspace dir to begin with after the re- install.
What's up?

buginformation.summary: CommonBaseEventLogRecord does not respect nested CBE values when retrieving the CBE.
buginformation.description: CommonBaseEventLogRecord does not respect nested CBE values when retrieving the CBE. Instead, if proeprties are set in the super class (e.g. LogRecord), the mapped CBE properties are overwritten. The CommonBaseEventLogRecord should have two modes at runtime (e.g. CBE and LogRecord modes).

buginformation.summary: [find/replace] Regular expression replace does not handle groups
buginformation.description: If I find a group like "(\w+)" and try to use the group in a replacement string like "found: \1" the group data is not inserted, and the group number is echoed instead.

buginformation.summary: Searching in sequence diagram does not always scroll to the correct area
buginformation.description:
WSWB 3.0 Build 20040202_1722
In the object or class interactions sequence diagrams, if you search for an object or class for the first time, it works; the view is scrolled to that object/class. But, if you search a second time (for a different object), it scrolls to a seemingly random location that does not contain the object/class. Or, it scrolls to the top left corner.

buginformation.summary: Overview does not agree with sequence diagram view
buginformation.description:
WSWB 3.0 Hyades build 20040202_1722
When opening a medium-sized sequence diagram (~25 columns, square), the overview does not always agree with what's displayed in the view. If you scroll to the center of the diagram, the red square is in the center of the overview, but the diagram in the overview has moved to the left. The overview diagram should remain fixed, while the red square moves around.
I will provide a link to a profiling file containing a suitable Object interactions diagram in the following comment.

buginformation.summary: Progress dialog should provide description of ongoing task
buginformation.description:
Build 20040128
When getting the progress dialog to report a conflict with some background activity, it is not mentionning which task is colliding with others. This is very misleading as you can only see description of other jobs.

buginformation.summary: Update floods log with meaningless stack traces
buginformation.description:
Faling to establish a network connection is *normal* and not an indication of a problem. Definitely not worth a stack trace, and probably not worth reporting at all unless the attempt to connect was initiated by user command.
I develop on a laoptp, often disconnected from the net for hours at a time, so I get a LOT of these.
Successful updates, on the other hand, should be logged.

1. Create a new C/C++ Make project containing file.c:
#include <stdio.h> #include <stdlib.h>
int main(int argc, char* argv[]) { return EXIT_SUCCESS; }

buginformation.summary: org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Table.getTopIndex() returns wrong value
[formatter][api] ContentFormatter2 should pass indents based on partition
buginformation.description: Typical implementations of ContextBasedFormattingStrategy keep a list of partitions to format individually, however each call into the FormattingStrategy sends the same indent information (the region's initial indent) rather than indentation information for each partition, which is not particularly helpful when each partition may be indented differently.

buginformation.summary: More cvs options needed
buginformation.description:
I don't know how well they could be abstracted, but it's certainly would be nice to have a way to have more options. Mainly for me I miss the date specification for tagging/updating etc.
Even making the console take typed commands would help a little. Right now I have to do these things externally

buginformation.summary: [New Look] 'Show multiple editor tabs' should be on by default
buginformation.description:
200401290841
I strongly believe that the new 'single-tab editor' feature is something that is only for power-users who know all of the keyboard accelerators. As such, it should not be the default setting. New users (and old users familiar with the previous multi-tab default) will think "Where did my other editor go?". (Old users will also think "What happened to single-click editor navigation?")
In fact, I will go so far as to say that the single tab feature is only useful to "power-users who know all of the keyboard accelerators and who have very long class name (or filename) prefixes that are all the same for large groups of classes". As I - and arguably, most developers - do not fit into that category, I don't think it should be the default.
To reiterate, here is a list of "reasons why the single-tab editor feature should not be the default". This list was originally in an email that was arguing for multi-tab editor capability, but now that it has been added, it needs to be the default, and the same old arguments still apply:
a) New users, and old lazy users like me who use the mouse for navigation, don't know the keyboard accelerators. And they never will. The 1-tab will therefore seriously annoy a large group of users.
b) New users won't even realize that they can switch to another editor - they will wonder where their other editor went.
c) Can't see "at a glance" which editors are open.
d) Can't see "at a glance" which editors have changes.
e) The list of accelerators (keyboard shortcuts) is buried in a submenu - which is the appropriate place for them, but which makes them more difficult to find when a user is scanning the menus looking for shortcuts, because the typical method is to scan for accelerator text to the right of menu items.
f) Editor navigation using the mouse used to be only one "visual cue" mouse click, whereas with 1-tab, you need to do mouse motion, click, then an extra mouse motion and an extra mouse click, making this very common interaction take twice as long as before.
g) Editor navigation using the keyboard is difficult also, because I have to use 2 hands to type the accelerator (ctrl+F6). (I have small hands, and I just cannot do ctrl+F6 very easily with only one hand).

buginformation.summary: Unclear text in Code Formatter|Style panel of Preferences
buginformation.description:
A couple of options on the Code Formatter|Style panel of the Preferences is really unclear in my opinion. I am talking about Indentation is represented by a tab Number of spaces representing a tab
The first option would be clearer if it said something like Use hard tabs for indentation, not spaces or something to that effect, like Insert tabs for indentation, not spaces Insert hard tabs for indentation, not spaces
The second one is really bad though. It has nothing to do with tabs, but rather the number of spaces to use when indenting, when tabs are turned off (e.g. if the first option is not checked). So, first of all, it should be greyed out if the first option is selected, since it will have no effect in that case. And the description should be changed to something clearer, like: Number of spaces to insert per indentation level. Number of spaces representing an indentation level. etc. That, together with the fact that it will be greyed out if tabs are turned on, will make it clearer how both of these options work.
Every person I know who has used Eclipse has been confused by how these two settings work, in relationship with the the setting on the Appearance pane of the Editor area which also has a setting for displayed tab width, and the other setting on the Editor|Behaviour pane which has a setting for 'Insert Spaces for Tabs'.

buginformation.summary: Wrong error message "LogParser should extend LogParser interface"

In the org.eclipse.hyades.log.ui.internal.wizards.LogParserItem class you get the error message "LogParser should extend LogParser interface" if your Logger does not extend the org.eclipse.hyades.logging.parsers.Parser class. The error message is missleading.
It would be much nicer according to my opinion if an implementation of an interface would be expected (like org.eclipse.hyades.logging.parsers.IParser) than an implementation of a class.

buginformation.summary: [CoolBar] [JFace] ApplicationWindow.createCoolBar tests coolBarManager 2x
buginformation.description:
In ApplicationWindow, the createCoolBar method tests coolBarManager 2x, and doesn't test toolBarManager:
if ((getShell() == null) && (coolBarManager == null) && (coolBarManager == null)) {
(Line 255)
This is the case in 3.0 M6, as well as N20040207. Both win32.
The effect of this is that if you call addToolBar(), then addCoolBar(), you get both toolbar and coolbar, though the documentation says you get one or the other. If you call addCoolBar(), then addToolBar(), only the coolbar gets created.
Obviously, the code should read:
if ((getShell() == null) && (toolBarManager == null) && (coolBarManager == null)) {

buginformation.summary: Display latest synchronize info at top of synchronize view
buginformation.description:
Currently the latest synchronize info is displayed in the status bar on the bottom right. Typically, I will have synchronize view in a fast view with outgoing only selected. Because the latest synchronize info is on opposite sides of the screen, I sometimes miss that there are also incoming changes.
I would like to have the latest synchronize info displayed at the top of the synchronize view so I don't have to remember to glance across to check. Don't care whether the info is also still displayed in the status bar.

buginformation.summary: Ctrl+Space gives two key down events
buginformation.description:
On Windows XP using I20030923, "Ctrl+Space" gives two key down events. This key binding is used by Eclipse for code assist. Affects keys preference page, and causes a flicker as the code assist is executed twice. If the key is bound to any other command, it can make the command completely unusable.
Problem does not occur on Linux-GTK.
This is required for M4.
DOWN: stateMask=0x0, keyCode=0x40000, character=0x0 '\0' DOWN: stateMask=0x40000 CTRL, keyCode=0x20, character=0x20 ' ' DOWN: stateMask=0x40000 CTRL, keyCode=0x20, character=0x20 ' ' UP : stateMask=0x40000 CTRL, keyCode=0x20, character=0x20 ' ' UP : stateMask=0x40000 CTRL, keyCode=0x40000, character=0x0 '\0'

buginformation.summary: Ant in Eclipse breaks after upgrading to Java 1.4.2
buginformation.description:
I just updated my Mac OS 10.3.2 JVM from 1.4.1 to 1.4.2 using Software Update. Ant tasks, which were working fine before the update, now report via the Progress view:
ERROR: Launch : Specified VM install not found: type MacOS X VM, name 1.4.1
Eclipse otherwise still seems to be running fine, and in the Java preferences it's aware of the new VM, but I can't figure out where the Ant VM is supposed to be specified.
Sometimes the attempted Ant launch just hangs.

buginformation.summary: Dependent updates are not discoverable
buginformation.description:
Updates that "require" another update are not displayed in the "Available Updates" dialog. Only the first update is shown to the user, even though the second update is also pertinent to his/her product.
As a result, users must continue to press the "New Updates" action until it displays the "no updates available" message.
Requirement: user should be made aware that they need to return to this action for more updates. Alternatively, they should be able to select "any/all" update (s) which would then be installed in the proper order.

This bug is annoying becuase it happens 2 times during startup for JDK WINDOWS_I586.SUN_J2SE_1_4_200.NEZE.DE on Windows 98. Btw: This happens not for Windows NT (perhaps because there is no file missing). This is possibly an bug of the JVM ... .
Kind Regards
mle

buginformation.summary: Add filter button to Expressions view to show expressions by debug target
buginformation.description: Similar to the breakpoints view add a button that would filter the expressions by debug target.

buginformation.summary: error parser order cannot be set
buginformation.description: i noticed that you can't set the order of the error parsers. the up/down buttons work, but it doesn't take. doesn't matter whether it's global or project settings.

buginformation.summary: should unregister URL handlers when they are removed
buginformation.description: PlatformURLPluginHandlerFactory listens to registry events to add URL handlers dynamically as they appear, but the opposite is not being done when they go away.

buginformation.summary: Sharing a project - Module exists reported when it doesn't
buginformation.description:
I'm using WebSphere 5.1.0 and I am trying to Share a project with CVS. It is a brand new project and when I try to share it I get the error that the specified module already exists when it doesn't. It is like it is not even trying to do the cvs import. I am running a cvs server on a Solaris 8 machine. I can connect and work with the cvs server using other cvs clients and the import happens fine. Let me know if there are more details that you require. Sorry if this is a duplicate.
Mike Slywka

buginformation.summary: progress dialog would stay forever
buginformation.description:
i200402101200
Got two Progress Summary modal dialogs at the same time one, waiting for a background operation, did not show any jobs to be cancelled. The other, in foreground, was waiting for "Refresh Workspace" (I have it enabled) although "Building workspace" appeared in the job list. Please see screenshot and VM dump (to attach) for details.
When I realized it was not coming back (no CPU activity) by itself, I tried cancelling the selected job. That removed it from the list of jobs, but the progress dialog remained open. Only cancelling the blocked job made the two dialogs go away.

buginformation.summary: document outline focus is different from JDT's
buginformation.description: In AJDT the document outline focus switches to the editor if any element is selected. This makes it impossible to up/down arrow through the elements like you can in JDT's outline.

buginformation.summary: [Tasks] Problem with task list when deleting an element and description field is being edited
buginformation.description:
- Create a bunch of tasks - Click on the description field of one of the tasks. You are now editing a task description. - Click the delete button. The task list has now one element less, but the description test of the deleted task remains in the field, and the task above is invisible. As soon as the description field loses focus the list is back to normal and the invisible task is visible again.
This does not happen if the whole task line is selected.

buginformation.summary: [formatter] pref page - restore defaults should select "Default" profile
buginformation.description: Clicking on "Restore Defaults" should select the "Default [built-in]" profile.

buginformation.summary: [Fonts] Java Pref Pages leak 17 fonts
buginformation.description:
How I did it:
With sleak and graphics-trace on:
Open Resource perspective; open sleak view; close all perspectives but resource perspective; close all views but sleak view.
Close Eclipse.
Open Eclipse again.
Open Window/Preferences. Close Preferences. Reopen and close again. => loads Dialog fonts and all fonts on the first preference page.
Take a snapshot in sleak view.
We start w/ 52 colors, 2 cursors, 5 fonts, 1 GC, 87 images
For each pref page: open preferences select page in tree, close preference dialog, reopen preference, close preference, note new resources.
Java: 52 colors, 2 cursors, 6 fonts, 1 GC, 87 images [+1 font]
Appearance: 52 colors, 2 cursors, 7 fonts, 1 GC, 87 images [+1 font => "Note" should be in the Banner font which has been already loaded through the Workbench pref page]
Members Sort Order: 52 colors, 2 cursors, 8 fonts, 1 GC, 96 images [+1 font; +9 images (the member/visibility icons) -> no leak]
Classpath Variables: 52 colors, 2 cursors, 8 fonts, 1 GC, 101 images [+5 images -> no leak]
New Variable Entry Dialog (reached through Classpath Variables/New...): 52 colors, 2 cursors, 9 fonts, 1 GC, 101 images [+1 font]
Code Formatter: 61 colors, 2 cursors, 12 fonts, 1 GC, 101 images [+9 colors (colors used for the embedded editor-> no leak), +3 fonts (one is probably the Java Editor font, the other two are leaks)]
Show Profile Dialog (reached through Code Formatter/Show...) 61 colors, 2 cursors, 16 fonts, 1 GC, 102 images [+4 fonts, +1 image (the warning icon -> no leak]
Code Generation: 62 colors, 2 cursors, 17 fonts, 1 GC, 103 images [+1 color (will be used by Insert Variable dropdown), +1 font (appearantly the one used by the Insert Variable Dropdown -- shouldn't this be shared/disposed?), +1 image (local type icon -> no leak]
Detail formatters: 62 colors, 2 cursors, 18 fonts, 1 GC, 103 images [+1 font (the Java Text Editor font should have already been loaded by the Code Formatter preference page)]
Step Filtering: 62 colors, 2 cursors, 18 fonts, 1 GC, 105 images [+2 images -> no leak]
Add Step Filter dialog (reached through Step Filtering): 62 colors, 2 cursors, 19 fonts, 1 GC, 105 images [+1 font]
Add Packages dialog (reached through Step Filtering): 62 colors, 2 cursors, 23 fonts, 1 GC, 108 images [+3 images -> no leaks; +4 fonts (1 is from the progress dialog)]
Work in Progress: 62 colors, 2 cursors, 24 fonts, 1 GC, 108 images [+1 font]
Compiler: no leaks Debug: no leaks Installed JREs: no leaks Javadoc: no leaks Editor: no leaks Spelling: no leaks JUnit: no leaks New Project: no leaks Organize Imports: no leaks Refactoring: no leaks Task Tags: no leaks Type Filters: no leaks
@@@@
All in all 17 fonts on the following:
Java, Appearance, Members Sort Order, New Variable Entry Dialog (reached through Classpath Variables/New...), Code Formatter, Show Profile Dialog (reached through Code Formatter/Show...), Detail formatters, Add Step Filter dialog (reached through Step Filtering), Add Packages dialog (reached through Step Filtering), Work in Progress

buginformation.summary: [Fonts] Workbench Pref pages leak 7 fonts
buginformation.description:
How I did it:
With sleak and graphics-trace on:
Open Resource perspective; open sleak view; close all perspectives but resource perspective; close all views but sleak view.
Close Eclipse.
Open Eclipse again.
We start w/ 52 colors, 2 cursors, 0 fonts, 1 GC, 86 images
For each pref page: open preferences select page in tree, close preference dialog, reopen preference, close preference, note new resources.
Workbench: 52 colors, 2 cursors, 5 fonts, 1 GC, 87 images [+5 fonts (2 should be loaded: Dialog Font + Banner Font), +1 image (banner) -> no leak]
Keys: 52 colors, 2 cursors, 9 fonts, 1 GC, 91 images [+4 fonts , +4 images -> no leak]
Appearance: no leaks Colors: no leaks Label Decorations: no leaks File associations: no leaks Fonts: no leaks Linked Resources: no leaks Local History: no leaks Perspectives: no leaks Startup: no leaks Work in Progress: no leaks Search: no leaks Search/Work in Progress: no leaks

buginformation.summary: Unused import warning but type used in Javadoc
[misc] Annotation roll-over action for Mark Occurrences removes sticky occurrences
buginformation.description:
200402101600: When clicking into the annotation roll-over icon for marked occurrence, the other occurrences lose their marking even when occurrences should be sticky.
Steps: - Enable Annotation roll-overs - Enable Mark occurrences in file (also enable sticky)
- In this code fragment: new ArrayList().size(); new ArrayList().size(); - set caret into "size" - set caret to end of line (occurrences of "size" stay marked) - hover over vertical ruler icon and click onto the arrow (tooltip: "size") => expected: occurrences stay marked and (selection is "size" or unchanged) => was: occurrence on current line is still highlighted, all other occurrence marks disappear, selection unchanged

buginformation.summary: NPE from step into selection
buginformation.description:
Build 20040210
I periodically get an NPE out of StepIntoSelectionHandler#doStepIn(...).

buginformation.summary: [RCP][Views] Need the ability to resize views programmatically
buginformation.description: We need the ability to resize any view in a perspective programmatically.

buginformation.summary: [Progress] "Pending" TreeItem causes unexpected shifting (usability)
buginformation.description:
When population of children treeitems is done using a background job, a "Pending" TreeItem is places as child 0 of the container treeitem. When the job completes, this treeitem is disposed. So, when the user places the mouse over an item and tries to select it, the item often moves up one position because of the above disposal.
To avoid the sifting, the "Pending" item could be the last child instead of the first, since that is where the pending children show up. Or, the parent treeitem could be decorated in its string to show something like: "cdt-home (pending)"

buginformation.summary: TrimLayout margins inconsistent with other layouts
buginformation.description:
Trimlayout has a margin width and height of 0 initially. This is inconsistant with other layout classes currently existing.
While this is a non-typical layout and likely not going to be used outside the workbench, but it might. And I think it is better to be consistant in these cases than different. It will likely just cause frustration for anyone new to this layout.

buginformation.summary: Feature request: Allow more control over Debug view
buginformation.description:
It would be nice to exert more control over the Debug view. For example, the debugger I am writing is a multi-core debugger. Multiple breakpoints can be hit simultaneously. The default behavior of the Debug view is to select a new Stack Frame when a breakpoint is hit, open up the source code, and position it at this line. This is very confusing in the multi-core environment. I may be stepping through code when another breakpoint is hit, and suddenly I am staring at a completely different file.
The control I would like to exert over the debug view would include:
1) Control whether or not selection occurs. 2) Control whether or not tree expansion/contraction occurs.

buginformation.summary: UI blocked by quickdiff during CVS update
buginformation.description:
I performed an Update of about 200 incoming files in the sync view. About half way through this background operation, the workbench was locked by another operation. It is strange that the user would be blocked by an operation they did not explicitley perform. Here is the traceback of the blockage I got when I canceled the job blocking the UI. In general, it is a bad idea to obtain resource scheduling rules in the UI thread. I'm assigning this to the text component since it appears to e related to text editors. If I am mistaken, please forward appropriately.

buginformation.description:
i20040212
The following log will have the subentry titled "titleC" omitted. It seems to be a presentation problem, since the PDE's LogReader is able to parse and build a correct data model (LogEntries).
!SESSION Feb 12, 2004 15:21:15.423 --------------------------------------------- !ENTRY titleA 0 0 Feb 12, 2004 15:21:15.438 !MESSAGE message !SUBENTRY 1 titleB 0 0 Feb 12, 2004 15:21:15.438 !MESSAGE message !SUBENTRY 2 titleC 0 0 Feb 12, 2004 15:21:15.470 !MESSAGE message !SUBENTRY 1 titleD 0 0 Feb 12, 2004 15:21:15.470 !MESSAGE message

buginformation.summary: two session headers for the same log
buginformation.description:
i20040212
If something bad happens during startup, that may cause entries to be written to the log. Since there are situations were the Eclipse Starter may throw an exception to the launcher (org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main), that exception will be logged as well, causing a new SESSION header to be written to the log. That may cause a lot of confusion.

buginformation.summary: [NewLook] floating toolbar is behind view after detach (tear off)
buginformation.description: The Z-ordering of the windows is wrong after tearing off a view. This results in the toolbar being below the view for example if you move the right hand side of the view to the right hand edge of the screen.

buginformation.summary: can't copy/paste from the property views to the run configuration view
buginformation.description:
I20040210 gtk
Select a java file from the java perspective. Right Click and select properties. Copy the path/name of the file (either with CTRL-C or with a right-click and select copy in the popup menu). Go to the Run Configuration dialog. Do CTRL-V or try to paste the previously selected path/name into the Program arguments textbox. There is no text to paste.

buginformation.summary: NPE in SettingsBlock of Standard Make project properties
buginformation.description: Scenario: 1. Open Standard Make project's properties, C/C++ Make Project page, Make Builder tab. 2. Uncheck Use default build command checkbox. 3. Press Apply or Ok. 4. Go to step 1. 5. There is an error message: Could not accept changes: The currently displayed page contains invalid values. caused by NPE in SettingsBlock.java.

buginformation.summary: [FloatingWindows] Floating Progress Window
buginformation.description:
Several issues:
1. The floating window should disappear if another view or editor gets focus 2. The flowating window should disappear if the Progress Monitor view is opened
IMHO the floating progress window is a big UI break. Some people prefer the "old style" progress report by text in the status line. The flowating view is unessary and adds unwanted UI clutter. If a user wants to see enhanced or detailed progress indication he can double click on the progress bar icon and the Progress view is opened. That is ok.
You might consider changing this from a floating window into a tool tip like yellow bubble that informs the user about new progress but this should only stay visible for a few secondes (like the yellow bubbles used by Windows tray notifications).

buginformation.summary: Generated code is wrong when testing UI object existence
[ActivityMgmt] Show all option should move to a radio button
buginformation.description:
The Show all option should be a radio button at the bottom of the relevant dialogs.
Selecting it will replace the contents of the tree with the new entries. We should attempt to keep selection and expansion state as much as possible.
This button will not be shown if 1) There are no activities 2) The application has the "do not show all" option set.

buginformation.summary: CatchClauseSignature has broken operation
Ant complains about missing jars in classpath
buginformation.description:
In build M5, there seems to be a problem with running Ant for any target when the containing project points to jar files which are are currently missing AND the project is not associated with CVS.
Normally I use CVS, check out projects containing source code only, use an Ant target to retrieve external resources (jars, zips, tlds, etc.) and then add the needed jars to the Java Project's libraries under the "Java Build Path" section of the project's properties. Once I have the project set up I can build the project, clean the project (run an Ant "clean" target which deletes all generated and retrieved resources), and then build the project again or whatever I want. However, trying this same senerio with a local (non-CVS) project Ant gives the following type of error (depending on the needed resource):
ERROR: Launch: The archive: /someproject/some.jar which is referenced by the classpath, does not exist.
This sort of error is given even if I edit the build.xml file to include only a test target containing an <echo>This is a test</echo>. If the project wasn't the result of a CVS checkout, the Ant invocation doesn't seem to run if the Eclipse project can't find all of its resources. Since my resources are retrieved by an Ant target which can't be run, I have to delete the missing resources from the project's library list, run Ant to retrieve them again, then reassociate them with the project. Is this fixed with a later build?
Derek Greer

buginformation.summary: "Include constructor or setter methods parameter" doesn't correctly react changes
buginformation.description: "Include constructor or setter methods parameter" doesn't correctly react to changes of "Local variable declaration hides another field or variable" level.

buginformation.summary: Add variable expansion for Main Class in launch configurations
buginformation.description:
Java Application and Java Applet launch config delegates should implement variable expansion on their Main Class and Project fields. This would allow generic launch configuration "templates" that support the re-use of common arguments in launch configs.
There may be the need for contributed variables from Java and Applet plugins that support these variables.

buginformation.summary: Possible serious performance issue
buginformation.description:
I make a habit of constantly running my Xray profiler on my runtime workbenches. Today, I ran into a case where I loaded eclipse. No editors open, just a navigator with a few hundred HTML files. I selected one and deleted it. Then, progress monitor pops up without any progress. CPU is at 100% for almost 2 minutes. As you can see from the included Xray report, 32 million objects were created, 1 gigabyte was burned on the heap and about 32MB was read from disk (summary somehow missing in the report). I can see when this happens to a large workspace that the user simply kills the eclipse instance (as I was close to doing).
I sent the bug report to Platform-Core as they would probably have the best insight into what happened. The thread to look for is ModalContext.
No, I cannot replicate.

buginformation.summary: [Preferences] Unable to resize tree control in Preferences dialog
buginformation.description:
I200402170800
Window->Preferences
Notice that a horizontal resize sash appears to the right of the tree control, but dragging it has no effect.

buginformation.summary: Cryptic Error Message from Platform Loader
buginformation.description:
I try to launch my runtime workbench. Apparently, there is something wrong with my plugin. However, all I get as a message is "Problems encountered starting up plug-in: "org.osgi.framework.BundleException: The BundleActivator org.eclipse.core.xray.Plugin is invalid". What does that mean? What is a BundleActivator? Why is it invalid? What can make it invalid?
I also get a java.lang.InstantiationException: org/eclipse/core/xray/Plugin.<init>()V, so something went wrong there? What?
2 other messages in the .log file are identical and similarly cryptic: "Unhandled Exception", "An exception stack trace could not be found.".
Seems like someone is swallowing and translating an exception. I would like to know what the original exception is, so I can debug my plugin.

buginformation.summary: [RCP] definition of IProduct and IBundleGroup properties needed
buginformation.description:
This is a reminder/placeholder for work that has been ongoing/pending but I can't find a matching report.
Runtime has added IProduct to model the default primary feature and IBundleGroup to model features. The UI gets various bits of information from the original entities and needs to adapt to the new structures.
After consulting with Nick, both IProduct and IBundleGroup were left open ended and UI ignorant. Rather they provide a general getProperty() method. The valid key value pairs are to be defined by the consumers/users of the objects. So the UI should define the form of the information it needs for the product branding (e.g., windowImage, ...) and the about dialog.
I don't know where this should be specified but the update team for example will need to know how to map the about.ini information onto IProducts and similarly, how to populate IBundleGroups.

buginformation.summary: OutOfMemoryError opening hierarchy on Object
buginformation.description:
Build 20040212 + latest JDT Core JDK 1.4.2
1. Create new workspace 2. Create new Java project 3. Open hierarchy on Object Observe: you get an OutOfMemoryError while computing the hierarchy

buginformation.description: If there have some Ctrl-M (^M) in the file and open it in Window version. the getStartPosition() in ASTNode will be incorrect.

buginformation.description:

1. Open the Error Log view 2. Hover the mouse over the Delete, Clear, or Restore buttons. 3. The text that appears contains '&' characters for accelerators.

buginformation.summary: [Graphics] Non-transparent icons
buginformation.description:
Build 3.0M7
There are quite a number of instances where view icons have a white background instead of a transparent one (e.g. problems, cvs repo, search, console, navigator, pkg explorer, ...).
Is the plan to make them transparent ? Which would likely fit best in new look, or rather have all transparent ones become white backgrounded (e.g. progress, javadoc, error log, declaration, ...) ?

buginformation.summary: Workbench.compatibility and 3 friends pulled into RCP launch config
buginformation.description:
In the run-time workbench launch configuration, on the Plug-ins tab, I select Choose plug-ins and fragments to launch from the list, put a check mark next to my RCP plug-in only (org.eclipsepowered.rcptutorial3), and click on Add required plug-ins. These three plug-ins get added unnecessarily:
org.eclipse.ui.workbench.compatibility org.eclipse.core.resources org.eclipse.core.resources.win32
The plug-in is not marked as working with older platforms (pre 3.0) and it has no dependencies on the deprecated api that is in the compatibility fragment.

buginformation.summary: Opening a large project causes flashing and mouse problems.
buginformation.description:
I opened a large Java project (~4000 source files) from the Resource Perspective by right-click/Open Project. It takes a while, fine, but the cursor and all of the Perspective icons in the left bar flash like *mad* b/w the hourglass cursor and normal pointer.
The Progress view reveals that eclipse it calculating state for every file. CPU usage is 100% by the Windows Task Manager.
This causes an odd problem on Windows XP: While E is opening the project, when I mouse over to the task bar to click on a different app (Mozilla 1.6, which happens to have multiple windows open, so you get a popup of window titles in the task bar), the pop flashes to and it is very hard to get it to stay open to switch to one of the opened windows.
I wonder if the changing of state of the cursor causes some side effects with the OS?
Version 3.0.m7.

buginformation.summary: [Workbench] Inconsistency in tool bar icons (visual language inconsistency)
buginformation.description:
I20040218
We are using different icons for similar things: - Red cross 'x': Navigator: delete item Part tabs: close tab Problems: delete Tasks: delete - Minus '-' / multiple stacked minus Console: remove all Search view: remove one, remove all - Eraser: Console: clear console
Especially the '-' is problematic. It is hard to recognize as a '-' if there is no '+' nearby. In additon what is the semantic difference between a delete 'x' and a remove '-' ?

buginformation.summary: [KeyBindings] KeySupport.java should support localized key sequences
buginformation.description:
Translator had a question about the need of certain strings to be externalized.
Key values are in English in the Keys Preferences page.
Steps to recreate: 1. Select Window -> Preferences 2. Select Workbench -> Keys 3. Select any item in the Commands box 4. Press the pull down button next to the Key secuence field
Question from translator: We observed that the keys are displayed in English, however there is a file named: eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.ui.workbench\workbench_jar\org\eclipse\ui\internal\c ommands\keysupport.properties that seems to contain the translation for the keys. Should these keys be translated or should they be displayed in English?

buginformation.summary: [EditorMgmt] Single Tab editor drop down position and size is wrong
buginformation.description:
Copied from bug 37997
------ Additional Comments From vraravam@thoughtworks.com 2004-02-19 02:21
I am running: Version: 3.0.0 Build id: 200402181101 on a Win XP machine. Once the number of editors becomes sufficiently large, the editorlist dropdown shows up. But when I click on it, the lightweight popup which shows the list of currently open editors seems to extend beyond the screen. I will attach a screen shot.
The list should be scrollable and visible on the screen at all times, in the event of multi-monitor it should be on the same monitor as it's associated window

buginformation.summary: Remove all infopop plugins
buginformation.description:
In the interest of having less plugins, and being more like the Eclipse platform, we should remove all our infopop plugins. The infopop .xml files should be inside the user documentation plugins (*.doc.user), as they are user docs. To see examples of this, see the following plugins from the JDT and PDE:
org.eclipse.jdt.doc.user org.eclipse.pde.doc.user
Note: We don't have a Doc component in Bugzilla like the platform and JDT.. should we create one?

buginformation.summary: UI Blocked when opening Java Perspective during CVS check out
buginformation.description:
build I20040218
- start eclipse with a new workspace - switch to CVS Repository Exploring perspective - check out a number of projects ( i checkout Platform UI module) - now attempt to switch to the Java Perspective
NOTE that at this point the "UI is blocked" dialog is opened. Probably due to the fact that starting the Java Perspective requires the workbench lock?
The point here is that this will be a common pattern and it would be nice if we could investigate makeing this scenario work more smoothly.

buginformation.summary: [Coolbar] Open a workspace twice causes toolbar icons to disappear
buginformation.description: On the latest I-Build I20040219 if I open a new workspace all the toolbar icons show up and work. If I close and restart eclipse on the same workspace then all the toolbar icons disappear. I can never get the icons to show up again unless I start with another new workspace.

buginformation.summary: Add ability to save list of changed files [refactoring]
buginformation.description: The current "Preview" option that is available when refactoring displays a graphical list of changed files. It would be useful to be able to save this list to a text file for use in heterogeneous development groups.

buginformation.summary: numberic prefix to repeat keystroke
buginformation.description: For example, to input 60 slashes(/) by typing "C-6-0 /" in emacs.

buginformation.summary: OSGI os alias returned instead of name.
buginformation.description:
org.osgi.framework.BundleContext.getProperty( org.osgi.framework.Constants.FRAMEWORK_OS_NAME ) should return canonical OS name rather than alias. So on Windows XP it should return "WindowsXP" rather than "Windows XP".
Am using M7 btw.

buginformation.summary: [KeyBindings] Delete key does not work in compare editor
buginformation.description:
build I20040219
While doing a sync, I opened a compare editor on a file with conflicts. Tried deleting some text using the Delete key, but it had no effect.

buginformation.summary: export plugin requires boot to be present
buginformation.description:
To export a plugin you seem to have to have boot loaded/available otherwise you get a dialog saying the system cannot find org.eclipse.core.boot.
I am running M7, targetting M7 and have org.eclipse.osgi* and org.eclipse.core.runtime* as source in my workspace. I try to export any of these and get the above result.

buginformation.summary: [About] Help | About dialogs non-modal
buginformation.description:
The Help | About dialog, the Plug-In Details dialog, and the error dialogs that 'more info' currently put up are non-modal when they should be modal.
Btw, wrt to error dialogs - see bug entered about 15 minutes ago by me for description on them.

buginformation.summary: Missing toolbar icons after restart
buginformation.description:
Build 20040219
After restarting Eclipse, the toolbar icons were missing. I had to reset all perspectives to make them appear again.
Error log is empty.

buginformation.summary: console: no action when drop down is pressed
buginformation.description: The drop down to switch consoles should perform some action when the console button itself (not the down arrow is pressed). I suggest that it switches to the previous console, so that I can easily toggle between two consoles.

buginformation.summary: Allow Bitwise-Or for listener type on widgets
[DetachedView] Undocked/floating windows looses position
buginformation.description:
When I undock my package explorer in one perspective onto screen/monitor 1 and places it at a specific position. I then switch to debug perspective and then back again, the unlocked/floating window is placed in the exact same position as I left it in.
If I place the floating window in screen/monitor 2 however, the window appears to the far left on screen 1 (possible in position 0,0). This means everytime I switch to and from the debug perspective, I have to move my package explorer undocked window back onto the second screen.
Expected result: The floating/undocked window keeps its position when switching perspectives even if it was positioned on screen 2 as it does on screen 1.
I Have only tested this on Linux Redhat 9.0/KDE3.2 using SWT GTK. Except not using this feature, I don't see a simple workaround to keep the window positions.

buginformation.summary: CDT Build number not showing in builds.
buginformation.description:
Currently the only way to check which CDT build that workbench has is to look in the map file.
There is no info available in the "About Eclipse" dialog (and sub dialogs).

buginformation.summary: [EditorMgmt] Editor drop down cut off at edge of monitor
buginformation.description:
When the right hand edge of Eclipse is near the edge of the monitor the editor drop down menu gets cut off. Maximizing Eclipse does not change this. I am running on a machine with a dual monitor setup. Note the menu is not spanning monitors as in defect #51240 but actually cut off.
I have "Show multilpe Editor tabs" turned on. I can also get this to happen with that preference turned off the but I have to size Eclipse down from the left such that the single editor tab does not fit on screen - then the editor drop down clips on the right even though there is plenty of room on the left.

buginformation.summary: Errors from the ant task do not provide links
buginformation.description:
When invoking ant tasks, and getting an error, the console provides a hyperlink from the first line (the one that contains the message "BUILD FAILED" message), but the following two lines, which are more relevant to the error, are not provided with the hyperlinking capability to click right to the line that caused the error.
[javac] ^ [javac] 2 errors BUILD FAILED: C:\BASE\Common\build.xml:188: Following error occured while executing this line C:\BASE\Common\JDC\build.xml:134: Following error occured while executing this line C:\BASE\Common\JDC\shared.xml:113: Compile failed; see the compiler error output for details.

buginformation.summary: message flashing in launch dialog
buginformation.description: The launch config type messages/descriptions flash as I move from one config to the next, even though the message does not change. I realize this is likely due to the dialog updaing/refreshing as a new config is selected, but we should try to avoid changing the message to "blank" and then back to the same thing.

buginformation.summary: No statistics collected when heap option is OPTIONS_NO_INSTANCE_INFORMATION
buginformation.description:
I am running a profile configuration where heap information is not selected, exec flow and method coverage are selected
This map to the following RAC options configuration:
TRACE_MODE = noObjectCorrelation ALLOCATION_INFORMATION = none STACK_INFORMATION = boundary TICKET = true BOUNDARY_DEPTH = 4 METHOD_COUNTS = true UNREFERENCED_SYMBOLS = true
When I run the app, I get exec flow information at the class object level but the statistics at the package , class, etc are all 0

buginformation.summary: what are the (I)Platform.openStream*() API for
buginformation.description: The title says it all. There are two openStream() methods on (I)Platform but it is unclear what they are there for. Why can't a caller use find() or getEntry() (whichever is the appropriate API) and the openStream on the resultant URL?

buginformation.summary: [Font/Colour] Typo in JFaceColors#getErrorText
buginformation.description: defualt should be spelled default

buginformation.summary: [generate delegate] option to use getter [code generation]
buginformation.description:
Two use cases:
-if getter exists use it -if getter does not exist yet create it
@@@@
Would help with "lazy initialization" of the delegate.
@@@@
What would be problematic?
Code like:
class A { private String fValue;
public String getValue() { return "X"; //does not use fValue } }
Now invoke generate delegate methods on "fValue".
@@@@
Another possibility would be offering create delegate methods including get-methods, i.e. the tree would also show getXXX methods.

buginformation.summary: Tasks View gets corrupted clicking on column header
buginformation.description:
I had a Java project with 5-10 classes in it, and about 8-10 //TODO: comments sprinkled throughout. When I clicked the Resource column of the Tasks view to sort by that attribute, all data in the view disappeared. The Tasks panel itself, including the control widgets/icons in its title bar are still there. It just appears as if none of the files in my projects contains any //TODO: comments, which as I stated, is not the case.
Most disturbingly, exiting and restarting Eclipse does not resolve the problem. In fact, I get a message upon startup, apparently as Eclipse is trying to reload the workspace settings which were saved upon the previous exit.
Once started up, Eclipse gives me the same error every time I click on any column header of the Tasks view. The error is:
ERROR: Searching for markers in Tasks view: An internal error occurred during: "Searching for markers in Tasks view".

buginformation.summary: Ecore model doesn't match XML schema
buginformation.description:
On Linux 2.4.22, Sun JVM 1.4.2_02, Eclipse 3.0M7, EMF 2.0.0_20040127_1738SL:
I created an XML schema:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace=" http://coalition/xml/schema " version="1.0" xmlns=" http://coalition/xml/schema " xmlns:cool=" http://coalition/xml/schema " xmlns:xs=" http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema "> <xs:simpleType name="IdT"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:whiteSpace value="preserve"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="NameT"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:whiteSpace value="preserve"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="SomethingT"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Name" type="cool:NameT"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="locationId" type="IdT" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:element name="SomethingList"> <xs:complexType> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" name="Something" type="cool:SomethingT"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> </xs:schema>
When I create an Ecore model from that schema, the names for the elements are being munged in an unpleasant fashion. SomethingList becomes SomethingListType, and its sub-element "Something" becomes "something". When I generate code from these munged names, and try to serialize the objects to XML, the resulting XML doesn't match the schema.

buginformation.summary: Team - loss of functions compared to 2.1.2
buginformation.description: Several functions seem to have been lost from Team/CVS: - "show in Navigator" was very useful - ditto "remove from view" - does not show the last committer on the compare header - appears to pick up directories that are in .cvsignore

JUnit Plugin test wizard fails to find tests that extend a subclass of TestCase

Eclipse I20040212 on OS X (10.3.2)
I created an abstract subclass of TestCase to help my testing and subclassed that with concrete tests.

Channing

buginformation.summary: Browser.setText fires an navigation event
buginformation.description:
if you call Browser.setText() an URL navigation event is fired with an about:blank url.
Is there any chance this can be changed? It is too anoying. We have a case where we want to intercept about:blank URLs, but can differentaiate between an about:blank navigation event generated due to a setText call, or one generated due to a real link that refers to about:blank.
Mazen.

buginformation.description:
M7
When the Conosle view is hidden (by double clicking a file tab in the Java editor, for example) it does not show when running an Ant task. Note that the Console view shows up if it's closed but the lower docked pane is visible.

But when I try to launch a target workspace using PDE's Run-time Workbench launch configuration (I clear the workspace) I get:
!SESSION ---------------------------------------------------------------------- !ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Feb 05, 2004 12:52:26.28 !MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform: !STACK java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to acquire application service at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:100) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:279) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:742) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:581)

buginformation.summary: Target request failed: Thread ID 3 not known dialog box occurs when first breakpoint hit
buginformation.description:
After starting a CDT launch that performs an "attach to process" and resuming it, the first time a breakpoint is hit, I receive anywhere from 3 to 8 dialogs all stating "Error: An error has occurred. See error log for more details." Finally, the first dialog issued (the one at the bottom of the stack of dialogs) states, "Target request failed: Thread ID 3 not known. Reason: Target request failed: Thread ID 3 not known."
I can see similar messages from the gdb trace in the Eclipse Console (included at the bottom of this message).
This seems to be related to the fact that there is a thread that is present when the attach first occurs that goes away before the breakpoint is hit. Note that on subsequent launches in the same Eclipse session, this does NOT occur.
[1,076,614,222,936] (gdb) [1,076,614,223,116] 20-thread-select 3 [1,076,614,223,126] &"Thread ID 3 not known.
" [1,076,614,223,126] 20^error,msg="Thread ID 3 not known." [1,076,614,223,126] (gdb) [1,076,614,223,126] 21-thread-select 3 [1,076,614,223,126] &"Thread ID 3 not known.
" [1,076,614,223,136] 21^error,msg="Thread ID 3 not known." [1,076,614,223,136] (gdb) [1,076,614,223,176] 22-thread-select 3 [1,076,614,223,186] &"Thread ID 3 not known.

buginformation.summary: [interop] NoClassDefFoundError when using SWT_AWT after applying workaround for manifest file
buginformation.description:
Christophe Avare wrote:
> Are you saying that your plugin, when deployed inside the workbench used to > develop it cannot find the SWT_AWT class ?
Yes indeed, thats what I'm saying. Developing the plugin and running it by starting the runtime-workspace (spawns a separate IDE window) works ok. But when restarting the initial IDE, invoking the plugin will cause the same NoClassDefFoundError.
Turning on the OSGI support did not work.
I'm able to reproduce the bug by starting in a clean environment, choose a new project plugin with a view. In the action1 button, instead of showing a message, I construct a Frame via the SWT_AWT class, set the size, add a JPanel containing a JButton and make it visible.
If you now choose "run as..." a runtime workbench is started and everything works fine. Now export the project as a deployable plugin. Then, extract the zip file to the eclipse folder so that the plugin is in the appropriate place. Stop and restart Eclipse, adjust perspective so that the view is selectable and choose show view "Sample view". In the sample view click on the first item in the menu "action1", an exception is thrown and the log file says:
