buginformation.summary: [KeyBindings] Keybinding Service consumes keystrokes for unregistered commands
buginformation.description:
My editor has no "Content Assist" action handler. My editor's canvas does not receive CTRL+SPACE KeyPressed event.
From mailing list:
> I'm pretty sure Nick said that if the action bound to a keybinding is > disabled (or bound to NULL), then the keybinding service would stop > consuming that key. 聽But this is not the behavior we are seeing. 聽For
We check whether the command has a handler (i.e., action) associated with it. If it doesn't, then we don't eat the key. 聽We eat all keys that: (1) have a key binding currently in context; and (2) have a handler currently active.
> example, we also need to receive CTRL+SPACE, which has universal meaning > of "toggle selection" of item with focus. But the keybinding for Content > Assist is getting in the way. Why do native Trees and Tables receive > CTRL+SPACE, but our Canvas does not?
Likely because a handler is registered for your part. 聽I'm just guessing, as I'm not sure of the details of your set-up.
Nope, we are not registering a handler -Randy

buginformation.summary: Fix wording of build path dialog [build path]
buginformation.description: the dialog that appears when you add a sourcepath to a newly created java workspace says Click OK to blahblahblah. and the options are Yes and No.. which are the more mac version of the windows ok/cancel i suppose. can we change the wording to "Do you want to blahblah?" so the dialog buttons make sense?

buginformation.summary: [EditorMgmt] dropdown: too hard to drive
buginformation.description:
The new editor drop down is too hard to drive. editor selection now requires:
- moving the mouse to the (rather small) down arrow/triangle, - clicking - choosing an editor by name of the file - clicking again
This significantly breaks the workflow. driving to the little drop down area requires me to stop what I am thinking about and concentrate on aiming. As a first step I suggest a) make clicking anywhere in the entire "gray" area around the editor tab cause the drop down to appear. This simplifies aiming b) having some modifier key that just brings up the list at the current mouse position (e.g., Alt and button down or some such) c) accelerators for choosing editors (I looked around but did not see anything in the menus etc)
The related issue is choosing by name. This problems here are a) requires you to know/think about the name of the thing you are looking for b) the combo is quite cluttered because the entire path of the file is displayed with little visual separation c) users are unable to leverage their spatial abilities (i.e., I usually just know where the editor I want is but really don't know what the name of the file is)
I don't know what to do about this. Perhaps all that empty space in the fast view docking area can be used to put editor icons with really fast hover help showing the real name. left unsorted or permitting user arrangement users could develop a spatial model?

buginformation.summary: Missing catalog message for error log view
buginformation.description:
I20040128 (5pm)
Open the error log view, and select an error with no stack. The stack text area in the dialog has the string:
LogView.preview.noStack
Looks like a missing catalog message.

buginformation.summary: [Workbench] level of detail option for view title bar
buginformation.description: One of the common new look gripes is that if you have a view pane with several views, and the tabs for those views don't fit, then the inactive views "fall off the end" and are no longer visible. This is made worse by the extra space used by the curvy active tab. Many applications solve problems like this by making the information displayed in tabs configurable (text only, icon only, or both). The initial configuration shows text to help out the novice user, but the advanced user can turn off the text and just use the icons. This would allow you to have quite a lot of views within a pane and not have them "fall off the end".

buginformation.summary: Resolver API should expose new names
buginformation.description: The resolver API still uses old names like getUniqueId. It should be aligned with the Bundle API and say in this case getSymbolicName. There may be other cases like that, I haven't check them all.

buginformation.summary: Changing the style of a Label from SWT.SHADOW_IN to SWT.SHADOW_NONE does not make a difference in the appearance of the Label
buginformation.description:
When I was going through the Eclipse 3.0 M7 examples (eclipse-examples- 3.0M7.zip) which I downloaded from http://fullmoon.torolab.ibm.com/downloads/drops/S-3.0M7-200402122000/eclipse - examples-3.0M7.zip, I realized that changing the style of a Label from SWT.SHADOW_IN to SWT.SHADOW_NONE did not make a difference in the appearance of the Label.
Here are the steps to follow in order to regenerate this scenario: 1. Install Eclipse 3.0M7 on Solaris 9 or HP_UX 11.11. 2. Download Eclipse 3.0 M7 Examples (eclipse-examples-3.0M7.zip) from http://fullmoon.torolab.ibm.com/downloads/drops/S-3.0M7-200402122000/eclipse - examples-3.0M7.zip and install them. 3. Launch Eclipse 4. Select 鈥淲indow -> Show View -> Other鈥︹. This will launch the 鈥淪how View鈥 Dialog. 5. From the 鈥淪how View鈥 Dialog, select 鈥淪WT Examples -> SWT Controls鈥. This will display 鈥淪WT Controls鈥 View. 6. From SWT Controls View, select 鈥淟abel鈥 tab. 7. In the 鈥淪tyles鈥 group, make sure SWT.SEPARATOR, SWT.VERTICAL and SWT.SHADOW_IN options are checked and the rest are unchecked. 8. In the 鈥淥ther鈥 group, make sure both 鈥淓nabled鈥 and 鈥淰isible鈥 options are checked. 9. In the 鈥淪ize鈥 group, make sure 鈥100 X 100鈥 is selected. 10. From the 鈥淪tyles鈥 group, select SWT.SHADOW_NONE option. This will uncheck the SWT.SHADOW_IN option. Expected Behavior: The appearance of the Labels should change Actual Behavior: The appearance of the Labels remains unchanged
Important: When I ran the same tests on Eclipse 2.1.2, the outcome was the same as it was on Eclipse 3.0M7.

buginformation.summary: PDE Projects created by plugin wizard are not loaded in runtime workbench
buginformation.description:
Eclipse: I20040224 OS X 10.3.2
After creating a new project using a plugin template, it is not loaded by the runtime-workbench, the console says
Ignoring bundle at: reference:file:/workspace/test
No other logs are produced.

buginformation.summary: OK button in "Source Folder Selection" window is sometimes grayed out when it is not supposed to be
buginformation.description:
What I wanted: I wanted to add a new source folder called "foo" to the build path. The source folder did not already exist.
What I did: I went into the project properties --> Java Build Path --> "Add Folder...". Since the source folder did not already exist, I selected "Create New Folder..." and created it. After creating the folder, it appeared in the "Source Folder Selection" window as selected but the OK button was still grayed out. I had to deselect and select the folder in order to "ungray" the OK button.
What I expected: The OK button should not have been grayed out.

buginformation.summary: The CView to update with each reconcile
buginformation.description:
For example, the CView via the CElementContentProvider is doing ITranslation.getChildren()
But it seems we are still working on the IFile instead of the WorkingCopy / BufferFactory were the update to date content of the file is(if it is open inside the CEditor).
Reassign to Hoda.

buginformation.summary: [new search] show an indication when there are no matches
buginformation.description:
There is almost no visual difference between a search just has started and a search that has ended without any matches.
Suggest to show an item in the search results view when there are no matches. The item should have an info icon plus the message " no references found" etc.

buginformation.summary: BasicLauncherTab not checking for null
Problem with name collision in XML-schema generated models(?)
buginformation.description:
I have a fairly large XML schema (142 Classes, 133 DataTypes, 30 Enums, 549 Features, 1 Package) that I used to generate an EMF model (EMF 2.0.0_20031219 though I have the same problem with 2.0.0_20040127). I'm using this schema to send and receive SOAP messages, and for most of my messages this works fine. Unfortunately, for one type of message I'm seeing a strange exception thrown when I try to parse a particular XML document. The failing XML is small, and correct by the schema:
<sch:LocationList xmlns:sch=" http://coalition/xml/schema "> <sch:Location locationId="271095"> <sch:Name>Brisbane Australia</sch:Name> <sch:Code codeType="GEOLOC"> <sch:Parameter parmName="GEOLOC">CKKJ</sch:Parameter> </sch:Code> </sch:Location> </sch:LocationList>
Whereas this XML works fine:
<sch:LocationList xmlns:sch=" http://coalition/xml/schema "> <sch:Location locationId="271095"> <sch:Name>Brisbane Australia</sch:Name> </sch:Location> </sch:LocationList>
The problem appears to revolve around the name collision avoidance mechanism that EMF is using to deal with similarly named elements of different types. If the BaseEquipT type is removed from the schema, and everything rebuilt, the problem goes away. Unfortunately, I don't have the luxury of renaming the conflicting schema elements.
The exception that gets thrown is:
java.lang.ArrayStoreException at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList.assign(BasicEList.java:190) at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList.addUnique(BasicEList.java:606) at org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.NotifyingListImpl.addUnique(NotifyingListImpl.java:299) at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLHelperImpl.setValue(XMLHelperImpl.java:748) at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLHandler.setFeatureValue(XMLHandler.java:1448) at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLHandler.setFeatureValue(XMLHandler.java:1438) at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLHandler.createObjectFromFeatureType(XMLHandler.java:1176) at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLHandler.createObject(XMLHandler.java:1086) at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLHandler.handleFeature(XMLHandler.java:952) at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLHandler.processElement(XMLHandler.java:403) at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLHandler.startElement(XMLHandler.java:386) at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.SAXWrapper.startElement(SAXWrapper.java:78) at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.maybeElement(Parser2.java:1637) at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.content(Parser2.java:1926) at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.maybeElement(Parser2.java:1654) at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.content(Parser2.java:1926) at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.maybeElement(Parser2.java:1654) at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.parseInternal(Parser2.java:634) at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.parse(Parser2.java:333) at org.apache.crimson.parser.XMLReaderImpl.parse(XMLReaderImpl.java:448) at javax.xml.parsers.SAXParser.parse(SAXParser.java:345) at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLLoadImpl.load(XMLLoadImpl.java:89) at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLResourceImpl.doLoad(XMLResourceImpl.java:141) at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceImpl.load(ResourceImpl.java:879) at t2.test.Test2.main(Test2.java:42)
I've attached the relevant subset of the schema (the full schema is proprietary and huge), the program that exposes the problem, as well as the genmodel and ecore files.

buginformation.summary: TrimLayout ignores preferred size of widgets even if not resizable

buginformation.description:
I'm trying to use the "extract Interface"-wizard but everytime I hit ok it answers with, "Overlapping text edits"
ideas are welcome
I am using Build 200402260010 on Win2000Pro

buginformation.summary: JSPs should be considered as ASCII files
buginformation.description: Default behavior is that JSPs are currently considered as binary files. It would be nice if the default settings in Preferences --> Team --> File Content state that JSPs are ASCII files.

buginformation.summary: CDT debug suspend and resume
buginformation.description: start a debugging session without an automatic resume (in suspend mode) to give the opportunity to see registers and memories before running the application.

buginformation.summary: Reverting file messes up breakpoint
buginformation.description:
Build 20040226
1. Place a breakpoint on a line. 2. Edit the file in some way (I added a blank line below the breakpoint. 3. File->Revert. 4. The breakpoint marker in the editor ruler disappears. (first problem) The breakpoint is still visible in the Breakpoints View, however. 5. Double-click on the line where the breakpoint used to show. 6. A new breakpoint appears in the Breakpoints View, but it's label is shorter than the "zombie" breakpoint's. It doesn't include the method name. (second problem)

buginformation.summary: Refresh produces duplicate on case rename
buginformation.description:
Eclipse 3.0M7, Windows XP
If a package is renamed, but only changing the case, in Windows explorer, then when refresh is pressed package explorer will have both versions of the package. Probably a Windows only problem.
1) Create a package called testCase. 2) Create a class called Test, but have the package line as "testcase". 3) Go to Windows explorer and change the package to "testCase". 4) Click refresh on the project. 5) There will now be two packages "testCase" and "testcase".

buginformation.summary: Emacs key bindings do not work with C editor
buginformation.description:
When using the C editor with CDT 2.0M7, the key bindings for text editing are not used. It appears that the C editor uses the "In General" key bindings instead of the text editing key bindings, as enabling the Emacs key bindings set has no effect. For instance, typing CTRL+A should normally take you to the start of the line, instead it selects the entire document (windows style).
Admittedly this is minor but is an annoyance if you're used to using the emacs key bindings with Java :)

buginformation.summary: Make the InternalAntRunner more lazy
buginformation.description: For all contributed tasks and types we currently force load the class whether it is used or not. On Ant 1.6 this is no longer required.

buginformation.summary: can not launch "runtime workbench"
buginformation.description:
Using M7 as a development environment, I can not run "Run ... runtime workbench" with last weeks integration build (I20040226) as the target. I get the following message in log. I marked as "blocker" since I'd think this would be a common way of doing development on Eclipse (that is, use milestone build as development platform, and latest integration build as target). I would be surprised if not already found, but I couldn't find existing bugzilla. A workaround would be appreciated. BTW ... using just the integration build, and launching runtime workbench seems to work fine.

buginformation.summary: Determine mixed order of libraries and source folders in class path for debugging
buginformation.description:
I want to debug my server application. I am starting to debug my junit test. Everything seems fine. The test is marshalling arguments and calling the server. The server says: unmarshal exception.
Probable reason: i have configured the source of whole project in eclipse. Eclipse recompiles everything and uses its own compiled classes. That may differ slightly from the classes/libraries on the server. So I get the unmarshal exception.
O.k. I could remove the source entry and use the correct library instead, but then I can not analyse and refactor all sources anymore and I do not want to create a new project for debugging and for developing. (Besides that I already have to make a new eclipse project for each version control branch, and we have many branches. This could be solved by a separate feature request.)
So I would like to be able to add the source to the project but tell eclipse to take the library and neverless show the source at debugging.
If you think this features request is reasonable, perhaps you can give it a reasonable name, too.
best regards
Thorsten van Ellen

buginformation.summary: Can't print on linux
buginformation.description:
This probably isn't the right component, but...
I'm on a redhat 8 system with eclipse 2.1.2. The button to print is grayed out, as is the file menu option to print. Other apps print with no trouble.

buginformation.summary: Editor code assist preference box does not allow you to change background for currently selected proposal background
buginformation.description:
If you look at the preference page for Java->Editor and view the "Code Assist" tab you will notice that you can change the colors for code assist. There isn't a selection for changing the background color for the currently selected "completion proposal background".
My issue is that the background color for the selection looks very similar to the normal background color for code assist. This makes it very difficult to determine what code assist option you are selecting.

buginformation.summary: @generated static initializers are not recognized as generated
buginformation.description: When I generate static initializers and annotate them in the generated code as usual as "@generated", it seems that the merging process does not recognize them later on as being generated. Next time I re-generate, they are not updated.

buginformation.summary: [Coolbar] "Widget is Disposed" Error when using GTK UI
buginformation.description:
Using CDT 2.0 on RHEL 3.0 with GTK on IA32 with Eclipse 3.0 M6. Get errors with the UI when performing normal operations with the Mouse. Pairs of error messages appear in the error log when clicking with the mouse: "Unhandled event loop exception" "Widget is disposed"
This error occurs frequently and requires Eclipse to be shut down and restarted, since it makes the UI unusable - once these errors start, much of the UI becomes unavailable for mouse clicking (each click only generates the two error messages, in sequence).

buginformation.summary: [CellEditors] ComboBoxCellEditor dismissed on first click in Properties View
buginformation.description:
When you click in the properties view on an entry that uses a ComboBoxCellEditor it will activate the cell editor correctly, but when you try to click on the dropdown, the cell editor is dismissed. You then need to click again to activate the cell editor again, and then you need to click the dropdown again, which fortunately works the second time. Any property that uses a ComboBoxCellEditor needs to be clicked four times to access the dropdown the first time. Every time a new input is passed to the properties view, the behavior is reset and four clicks are necessary yet again.
One place to reproduce this is in the PDE's .exsd editor. EMF relies heavily on the properties view, so this problem is a serious usability regression that needs to be addressed before 3.0 is final.

buginformation.summary: Filter debug actions with contexts
buginformation.description:
In order to reduce clutter in the debug perspective and associated views, we should filter debugger-specific actions based on the active context.
See related bug 49934 .

buginformation.summary: Datapool Editor: Add Variable dialog should not allow types that begin with a number.
buginformation.description: 1. Open up a datapool. 2. Right click on the table to bring up the context menu. 3. Select the "Add Variable" context menu item. 4. Enter a type starting with a number. The type is allowed.

buginformation.summary: Bug with DebugModelContextBindings
Problems not removed after fixing
buginformation.description:
Using Eclipse 3.0M7+EMF 0225_1234SL If I create a new XSD file, and add the following:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <schema xmlns=" http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema " xmlns:test=" http://www.example.com/test " targetNamespace=" http://www.example.com/test "> </schema>
there are no reported problems as expected. If you add <element name="foo" type="string"/> to the schema, all is still well. Change the type to "bar". A problem is correctly reported. If you then comment out the element statement with <!-- and --> surrounding it either on separate lines or enclosed within, the error remains. The location of error does not match the layout of the file. If you close the file and re-open it, the errors are gone.

buginformation.summary: Additional fixes for porting SWT to 64-bit
buginformation.description:
Creating separate bug as requested in bug 37775 .
I have made additional changes to SWT-N20040228 to address some problems occuring when using SWT on the amd64 platform. With the patches attached I am now able to get the first window of Eclipse-N20040228 up and running.
There are all kinds of fixes, including changes in the glue .c files - although I understand these are automatically generated? There are changes made to parameters, return values, size constants and pointer arithmetics using the same standard as the other changes ( int -> long /*int*/ ).
btw, I was thinking that being able to get conversion warnings from both C and Java compilers when an implicit conversion from int to long is taking place would be of great help, wouldn't it? Wouldn't that pinpoint possible problem areas?
Anyways, I plan to continue with getting Eclipse going on 64-bit. If I come up with new patches, should I attach them here as well or open a new bug?

buginformation.summary: [DCR] [DOM Comments] Provide extended ranges including leading/trailing comments for AST nodes
buginformation.description: Currently jdt-core does not offer any way to get extended ranges of compilation unit AST nodes hierarchy. As now, we build and store comments table in compilation unit, it's possible to compute and give users acces to these extended ranges...

buginformation.summary: No refs found for WorkbenchWindow.createTrimWidgets
buginformation.description:
build I20040225
- self-hosting workspace with SWT and UI and Text in source, rest as imported binaries - open type on WorkbenchWindow - Ctrl+O to createTrimWidgets - Ctrl+Shift+G - no refs found - Ctrl+T to super implementation in ApplicationWindow - Ctrl+Shift+G - it finds the ref in org.eclipse.jface.window.ApplicationWindow.configureShell (Shell)
This is a protected method, so the first search should have found the same ref.

buginformation.summary: [EditorMgmt] Close All is flashy
buginformation.description:
build I20040225
- using multi tabs - open a bunch of editors - activate the first one - File > Close All - you see the tabs animate as they close
This is a regression from 2.1.

buginformation.summary: GLA's org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter.impl.Component.stop() API is not fully implemented.
buginformation.description:
GLA's org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter.impl.Component.stop() API is not fully implemented.
One result of this defect is that the StaticParserSensor.stop() is not being called which intern calls the StaticParserSensor.clean() API and intern calls the postParse() API on the static parser to release system resources (e.g. close file handle).

buginformation.summary: Debugger should indicate which thread triggered breakpoint
buginformation.description: In a multi-threaded application the debugger currently correctly opens the stack frame for the thread which caused the exception correctly, but there is no other indication that that thread is the cause of the fault. There should be some sort of graphic indicator in the label decorator as well as a text annotation (other than just Suspended) which indicates that this thread is the reason you got to where you are at.

buginformation.summary: Setting Ant home adds jars in reverse order
buginformation.description: With the changes from bug 45450 , when the user sets Ant home, the jars are added in reverse order.

buginformation.summary: EclipseStarter should not alway refreshPackages
buginformation.description: EclipseStarter.loadBasicBundles() attempts to install the base bundles and then always does a refreshPackages() on the base bundles even when no actual installs have occurred. This is causing most all bundles installed on the platform to be refreshed each startup even when nothing has changed. This is pretty expensive. Should try change it so it only does a refreshPackages if something has changed.

buginformation.summary: Format command moves //$NON-NLS comments to next line.
buginformation.description:
When using the Source -> Format command, it moves the //$NON-NLS comments to the next line invalidating them. To reproduce this bug, go to Windows -> Preferences -> Java -> Code Formatter -> Edit -> Arguments -> and set line wrapping to "Wrap always except first element if necessary". Then format some source like the following:
SomeObject someObject = new SomeObject("Parameter1", //$NON-NLS-1$ "Parameter2", //$NON-NLS-1$ null); This will end up like:
SomeObject someObject = new SomeObject("Parameter1", //$NON-NLS-1$ "Parameter2", //$NON-NLS-1$ null);
Which defeats the whole purpose of using the non-internationalizable comments.

buginformation.summary: Run Profile context menu not available
buginformation.description:
In Eclipse 3.0, a Run cascade menu is available in the context menu. What appears in the cascade menu is the Launch shortcuts that are relevant for the selected file in the navigator. We should add our own Profile shortcuts for all available configurations.
This is the extension point :
<extension point="org.eclipse.debug.ui.launchShortcuts"> <shortcut label="%launcher.junit.name" icon="icons/obj16/julaunchpgn.gif" modes="run, debug" class="org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.launcher.JUnitWorkbenchShortcut" id="org.eclipse.pde.ui.junitWorkbenchShortcut"> <perspective id="org.eclipse.jdt.ui.JavaPerspective"> </perspective> <perspective id="org.eclipse.jdt.ui.JavaHierarchyPerspective"> </perspective> <perspective id="org.eclipse.jdt.ui.JavaBrowsingPerspective"> </perspective> <perspective id="org.eclipse.debug.ui.DebugPerspective"> </perspective> <perspective id="org.eclipse.pde.PDEPerspective"> </perspective> </shortcut> </extansion>

buginformation.summary: Allow bypassing "workspace in use" check for RCP applications
buginformation.description:
I would like to be able to specify a commandline option (say, "-concurrentOk") or some other mechanism that would allow running multiple instances using the same workspace simultaneously. Without this ability, RCP applications will often need to be wrappered with some cumbersome launch mechanism that either
o creates a new workspace for each instance (probably losing any chance of persisting state), or
o implements some mechanism for rendezvousing with an already-running instance of the app.
If such an option were supported, I believe it would be acceptable to follow a "last writer wins" policy when it comes time to save the application state.

buginformation.summary: No need for "plugin.xml" strings in platform.xml
buginformation.description: When generating list of plug-ins in platform.xml, PDE currently writes paths pointing to plugin.xml, for example, "plugins/org.apache.ant/plugin.xml". It should instead write plugin location like: "plugins/org.apache.ant/" - for plugins running from a directory, "plugins/org.apache.ant_1.0.0.jar" - for plugins running directly from a jar.

buginformation.summary: [java launching] java_type_name variable doesn't resolve selected binary type
buginformation.description: I created a jar file with a java class with a main method, added this jar to the build path of a project, selected the class from the package explorer. I tried to use a java launch configuration with '${java_type_name}' as type name. I failed with an error : "The selected resource doesn't resolve to a Java element".

buginformation.summary: F: Provide extensible and more flexible filtering in navigators
buginformation.description:
Valentina, please assign to me.
Currently, the filtering in the Hyades navigators is hardcoded. A common mechanism for all Hyades navigators should be provided. This will be done via an extension point element <filterSet .../> under the <navigatorExtensions .../> extension point. This extension specify a label, icon, navigatorID, implementation, and will allow filters to be declared as common, which means they appear directly in the navigator view's menu, and whether the filter set is enabled by default.
This functionality will be placed at the INavigator level, and will apply to all Hyades navigators. Content providers will be wrapped in a FilteredTreeContentProvider, which will consult all filterSet extensions and take care of the filtering.
The interface should also be updated to comply with the Hyades UI guidelines. Filters should also be general, and can include a broad category of items (hence the name filter set), rather than a single item type (e.g. Monitor).

buginformation.summary: A missing optional plugin causes low-level Assert exception
buginformation.description:
I saw this on the I20040226 build. If an optional plugin (that is, marked as optional=true in 'requires' element, is in fact not present, a low-level Assert exception occurs during descriptor. getPluginPrerequisites().
I stumbled across this testing something completely un-related, but since in the base stack you probably don't have optional plugins which are not present, thought you might appreciate the report. [BTW, its actually in Hyades plugins that has an optional plugin which really is not (normally) intended to be present).
I'm not sure what the right solution is .. either ignore it (and return what is there) or return a special descriptor that is marked as "missing optional plugin".
I'll attach test case and instructions, but here's the instructions (not sure you'll even need the test code is so easy to reproduce).
Description: TestPlugin has the test code (see testPluginPrereqs()) TestPlugin 'requires' RequiringPlugin RequiringPlugin *optionally* 'requires OptionalPlugin
Instructions for reproducing
1. Select TesterPlugin 2. Run as ... Junit Plugin Test
All is ok (test passes).
Now, remove (delete or close) OptionalPlugin
re-run steps 1 and 2, and you'll see Assert.isNotNull exception throw deep in internal.plugins code.

buginformation.summary: generating getters and setters puts 1 line of whitespace at bottom instead of top
buginformation.description:
when i generate my getters and setters, the first line of generated code is directly under the existing code, and the last line of generated code has a line of whitespace under it. this is the opposite of what i would expect. i'd expect 1 line of whitespace before the generated code and none below.
my 'insert point' is 'last method'.

buginformation.summary: Search result tree may be a bit to precise
buginformation.description:
I200403030818
I did a search>write access>workspace on the local variable 'type' in the method org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.actions.ManageBreakpointActionDelegate#manageBreakpoint(), the result was (in the New Search view) :
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.actions [...] + ManageBreakpointActionDelegate + manageBreakpoint(IEditorInput) : void (1 match) + IType type org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.actions.ManageBreakpointActionDelegate#manageBreakpoint(IEditorInput) (1 match)
I don't really care that the second match is in a local variable declaration, that doesn't give me any interresting information and break up the list of matches for the method.

buginformation.summary: Attached source file is opened instead of .class
buginformation.description: build I20040303 1) create a fresh workspace 2) show line number in java editor (Preferences>Java>Editor>Show line numbers 3) import all plugin as Binary projects with linked content 4) open CompletionEngine.class 5) add a breakpoint in CompletionEngine constructor 6) launch a Run-time Workbench in debug mode 7) create a class X 8) do ctrl+space inside this class A breakpoint is hit A CompletionEngine file is open but it's not the .class but the .java of the attached source. The is not breakpoint in the left part of the editor and no line numbers.

buginformation.summary: N200404040010 fails to launch, cannot find org.eclipse.core.runtime manifest
buginformation.description:
Here is the .log !SESSION Mar 04, 2004 10:34:58.191 --------------------------------------------- java.version=1.4.2_03 java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc. BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_US !ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 13 Mar 04, 2004 10:34:58.192 !MESSAGE Unable to locate application extension: org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench !STACK 0 java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to locate application extension: org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run(PlatformActivator.java:236) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:173) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:106) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:305) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:745) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:713)

buginformation.summary: Workspace plugins ignored when relative path of workspace given
buginformation.description:
I am doing self-hosting where my dev-ide is I20040226, and my target-ide is I20040226 (seperate directories). When I launch my development workspace with the -data <ws location> option, the plugins which I have in my workspace are being ignored if I specify the relative location of <ws location>. It works fine when I specify the absolute path for <ws location>.
When the development workspace is launched with the relative path, and I launch the target from it, I get the following message in my console : Ignoring bundle at: reference:file:/VE_3.0_M7/org.eclipse.myplugin Ignoring bundle at: reference:file:/VE_3.0_M7/org.eclipse.myplugin.A .. etc. and sure enough the plugins dont show up in the launched target. This works fine when I specify the absolute path to the <ws location>.

buginformation.summary: jardesc does not allow workspace-relative paths [jar creation]
buginformation.description:
All path specifications in a jardesc require absolute paths. This causes problems such as this scenario:
when we use cvs team integration, and we have different branches of the code line, we cannot use the same sandbox workspace folder name. So for the trunk it might be called 'myworkspace_trunk' but on the new version branch it might be called 'myworkspace_v2-1_branch'. Therefore a revision managed jardesc would have to be edited on each branch code line to use the folder name of the branch as part of the absolute path.
A Workspace-relative path could remove the need to specify the absolute path to the output jar, and internally resolve the absolute path of the workspace such that if I say staging/myproject.jar, the logic would be relative to the specific workspace directory.
It might be a nice addition to support Eclipse variables as well in the path, like ${WAS_HOME}/lib/myproject.jar

buginformation.summary: StateBuilder should stop using Bundle-Name as bundle symbolic name
buginformation.description:
i20040204
StateBuilder will default to use Bundle-Name header value as the bundle description symbolic name. This field is free text, and can even be a translation key.

buginformation.summary: Get rid of callback server thread
buginformation.description:
Get rid of the callback server thread and merge its function into the REMMasterServerThread. This way we can get rid of one thread per registry for callbacks.
The individual callback threads still exist.

buginformation.summary: [EditorMgmt] Pressing 'Esc' while editor drop-down list is open kills the list
buginformation.description:
I pressed 'Esc' key while editor area drop-down list was opened. I managed to kill (close & dispose) the list shell and I could not open it again. I had to restart Eclipse to restore it.
Expected behaviour: the list shell should be hidden but not closed and disposed completely.

buginformation.summary: See who commited a file in the Compare Editor in Eclipse 3.0
buginformation.description: In Eclipse 2.1 I can see who commited a remote file in the Compare Editor (the one that opens when you double-click on a file name in the Synchronize View). It would be nice to have this in Eclipse 3 as well, otherwise I have to look at the revisions on the CVS server to see it.

buginformation.summary: The Ctrl + Space
Add "Organize Package" or "Refactor/Copy..."
buginformation.description:
Sometimes I need to duplicate code from one package a new version. So what I really want is to be able to select all or some of the classes in a package, right-click on the selection and choose "Refactor/Copy...", instead of "Refactor/Move...". "Refactor/Copy..." would be the same as "Refactor/Move..." but without deleting the source files.
Today, I create the new package dir and copy the .java files from one dir to the other in the Resource perspective. I must then change each "package" statement, granted I can do this with a Search and Replace, but at this point it would be nice to right click on the selected files or package node and say "Organize Package" such that Eclipse would then fix the package statements.
Thanks, Keep up the superbe work (I'm -1 non-platform UIs). Version 3.0.m7.

buginformation.summary: [New Look] Ensure we are using the latest look and feel on all platforms
buginformation.description:
This bug serves to group problems relating to Eclipse not taking advantage of the latest look and feel on some platforms.
Generally, this is SWT's responsibility, but in some cases we in platform-ui are using valid but antiquated styles which can be improved upon at our end.

buginformation.summary: implement State#compare
buginformation.description: Implement State#compare.

buginformation.summary: Cell Editors do not use dialog font [JUnit]
buginformation.description:
Add Filter
The cell editor uses system default not the one used in the table.

buginformation.summary: No smart semicolon when the selection is empty
buginformation.description: When the selection isn't empty then entering a semicolon should always replace the selection and not have the smart behaviour (i.e. jumping to the end).

buginformation.summary: Team Refresh dialog; Preview Changes button does not set its size correctly
buginformation.description: Use different dialog font.

buginformation.summary: Compare window should use EAST_WEST cursor for sash
buginformation.description:
The area between two panes is draggable with the mouse. There is no indication to the user that this is possible. It would make sense to use the platform EAST_WEST arrow cursor here.
(BTW, how do I do this with the keyboard??)

buginformation.summary: [Dialogs] wrong search window size
buginformation.description:
Two bugs shortly one after the other:
1. Bug
Seems like the (file) search window dynamically sizes (which is generally good, but only at unknown situations, don't have a screen-shot of that) depending on the size of the marked text in the editor. When it does so, all elements seems to scale/resize correctly!
If you have marked a long text passage the window even sizes bigger than the screen. Of course, that is not the best idea, e.g. I can not reasonably select a history entry with the mouse, because either the history button is out of the screen at the right or the shown entries are out the screen at the left.
Seems as if someone has forgotten the restrict the automatically determined window size to a maximum. This does not mean that it should be impossible to make windows bigger than the screen MANUALLY.
2. Bug
The window elements are sized as if the window is very big, but the outer window itself is not sized very big and can not be resized manually, though the elements "are cut off" and can not be seen and used (see screen shot).
best regards
Thorsten van Ellen

buginformation.summary: Would be helpful if launch configurations were loaded with projects
buginformation.description: Consider defining the launch configurations on the project that contains the main / test class -- such that they are added to the launch configurations available when the project is loaded, and they are removed when the project is deleted. This would also permit easier sharing.

buginformation.summary: Remove JUnit FastView
buginformation.description:
I find the fastview shortcut bar to be the biggest waste of space in the workbench. At last, this bar disappears when it is not in use, but the default Java perspective brings it back by placing JUnit as a fast view.
AFAIK, this is the only case of default perspectives defining fast views. Would you consider removing it or stacking it somewhere. Better yet, open it as a fast view, but don't open the view until I launch a JUnit test. i.e., remove it from the perspective.
thanks.

buginformation.summary: 鈥淪how details about the selected log entry鈥 button is removed from Error Log View.
buginformation.description: In Eclipse 3.0M7, the 鈥淪how details about the selected log entry鈥 button is removed from the Error Log View. (See Eclipse 2.1.2 Error Log View)

buginformation.summary: Error dialog pops up after cancelling a synchronization
buginformation.description: Using 0304, I got the following errors in the .log after cancelling a synchronization operation. This happened the first time I started a workspace that ran using M7 before using 0304 build. I will attach the .log file.

buginformation.summary: Cannot remove comparisons
buginformation.description:
I20040304
Now, whenever I use Team compare the result ends up in the synchronize view and I can access them using the "Registered synchronize Partners" button. How can I get rid of previous ones?

buginformation.summary: Show Compare result in synchronize view not good (for me)
buginformation.description:
I20040304
Since last I-build when I do a team compare I end up in the Synchronize view.
This new approach breaks my existing working style: instead of getting a compare editor in the Java perspective where I develop code I am now forced to switched to the CVS perspective where I have the Synchronize view.
What was the PR/feature request that caused this change and what is the benefit?
Note: even if this PR is closed as wontfix at least the name of the view should change since compare and synchronize are two different things or (better) there should be a separate (Team Compare) view.

buginformation.summary: missing help
buginformation.description:
I have a help plugin with the plugin.xml and toc files shown below. If I bring up help, the book defined in toc.xml shows up as well as tocs in other plugins that are linked to the "mainToc" anchor. However, the tocs in this plugin that are linked to anchors defined in mainToc.xml do not show up. They work OK in 2.1.2 and 2.1.3.
plugin.xml toc extension:
<extension point="org.eclipse.help.toc"> <toc file="toc.xml" primary="true"/> <toc file="mainToc.xml"/> <toc file="tocguide.xml"/> <toc file="tocreference.xml"/> </extension>
toc.xml <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <?NLS TYPE="org.eclipse.help.toc"?> <toc label="Remote System Explorer Developer Guide" topic="toc.html"> <topic label="Extending the RSE Perspective" href="rseToc.html"> <link toc="mainToc.xml" /> </topic> <anchor id="mainToc"/> </toc>
mainToc.xml <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <?NLS TYPE="org.eclipse.help.toc"?> <toc> <topic label="Programmer's Guide"> <anchor id="guide"/> </topic> <topic label="Reference"> <anchor id="reference"/> </topic> </toc>
tocreference.xml (doesn't show up) <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <?NLS TYPE="org.eclipse.help.toc"?> <toc link_to="mainToc.xml#reference" label="Reference"> <topic label="Extension Points Reference" href="reference/extension- points/index.html"> <topic label="com.ibm.etools.systems.core.popupMenus" href="../com.ibm.etools.systems.core/doc/popupMenus.html" /> <topic label="com.ibm.etools.systems.core.propertyPages" href="../com.ibm.etools.systems.core/doc/propertyPages.html" /> <topic label="com.ibm.etools.systems.core.subsystemfactory" href="../com.ibm.etools.systems.core/doc/subsystemfactory.html" /> <topic label="com.ibm.etools.systems.core.systemtype" href="../com.ibm.etools.systems.core/doc/systemtype.html" /> </topic> ...

buginformation.summary: deleting elements in the outline asks for confirmation twice
buginformation.description:
i20040304
Deleting Java outline elements is behaving in a weird way in this build.
I have a Java source open. I select some methods in the Outline view, and press <Del>. A dialog opens saying "Are you sure you want to delete these <#elems> elements?". I say "Yes", but the dialog opens for the second time. And while the dialog is showing up, the elements are removed from the outline. Of course, confirm the second deletion fails because the elemnts are not there anymore.

buginformation.summary: [Repo View] Option for auto-refresh of tags
buginformation.description:
I20040304
On our build machine we have the need load concrete versions of some projects. Every time we do this we first have to refresh the tags since the new one isn't in the list yet. A preference where I can select to automatically refresh that list would be great.

buginformation.summary: Source>Sort Members breaks code order dependencies
Hungry code assist (is eating characters)
buginformation.description:
I200303040800 & HEAD
Using [backspace] when typing to select a code assist proposal deletes characters after validation.
in the following ant file:
<project default="test"> <tar </project>
put the carret after '<tar', hit 'g' [backspace] 'g' [enter], the result is
<project default="test"> <target name=""></target>/project>
should be
<project default="test"> <target name=""></target> </project>

buginformation.summary: 'Install Location' wizard page not working
buginformation.description:
I200403040800 Linux-GTK
1. help>software updates>find and install 2. 'Search for new features to install'>next 3. add update site...> name:CDT URL: http://update.eclipse.org/tools/cdt/updates/builds/2.0M7 > OK select CDT>next 4. 'select all'>next 5. select 'I accept ...'>next 6. add site...>select a folder (~/tmp)>type the name of the folder you would like to get created as an install site (eclipseSite) in the bottom text field >OK nothing new appears in the 'install location' page
It's a real problem because CDT2.0 is now only available through install/update, and people using a shared install of Eclipse have to create a new install location.

buginformation.summary: New Test Case Wizard to be improved
buginformation.description: default

buginformation.summary: Site editor: Added features should be published by default
buginformation.description: When adding features it is not intuitive that a context menu has to be run on each of the new features to make them visible for users. Who would add a feature without the intent to publish it??? Default behavior should be to publish new features. A wizard may make sense to ask if a new category should be created before publishing the features?

buginformation.summary: Site editor: Added features should be published by default
buginformation.description: When adding features it is not intuitive that a context menu has to be run on each of the new features to make them visible for users. Who would add a feature without the intent to publish it??? Default behavior should be to publish new features. A wizard may make sense to ask if a new category should be created before publishing the features?

buginformation.summary: Handling of whitespace in Tokenizer & conformace to the spec
buginformation.description: Tokenizer has been updated to consider \n and \r as whitespaces. Checks must be done to make sure we do not break the compliance.

buginformation.summary: [EditorMgmt] List of opened files should close on second click in filename
buginformation.description: When using the new tabs I find myself clicking on the filename tab to show openned files and see that a file I thought was open it isn't... My recorrent behaviour is clicking on the filename expecting the list disapears, but it is redrawn. I think it should have a show/hide behaviour so that the list of openned files closes on the second click in filename.

buginformation.summary: Debugger Tab of launch configuration contains duplicate dialog titles
buginformation.description: 1. Select Run->Run... from the main menu. 2. Select a preconfigured C/C++ local confiuration. 3. Click the Debugger tab. 4. Click both Browse buttons. They both bring up GDB command file dialog. One title should be changed to "GDB debugger".

buginformation.summary: Eclipse throws NullPointerException on JDK 1.4.0
buginformation.description:
When executed on a 1.4.0 Hotspot JRE, 3.0M7 throws a cryptic NullPointerException (somewhere in KeyBindings). The platform never launches. Took a while to realize it was the wrong version of JRE we're using.
This special case (JRE version) should be caught by the platform, or even earlier, by the eclipse.exe launcher?

buginformation.summary: Antidote. cannot set Id attribute
buginformation.description:
A problem with Antidote.
Impossible to set the attribute "id" (it doesn't appear in the combo-box) for elements which could have it (ex : path) ; even in the build ant- antidote_20040302171238.tar.gz

buginformation.summary: [EditorMgmt] Loss of editor pick drop-down
buginformation.description:
I200403100800
I love the new editor drop-down, even more when it gets a key binding. But sometimes I can't access it anymore. Clicking on the editor tab doesn't make it appear anymore.
The last time this occured was when I split the editor area to have two editors side by side, then when I stacked the editors back the drop-down didn't appear anymore.

buginformation.summary: CCombo edited value is not preserved (when mouse selects another cell within table)
buginformation.description:
The problem is present and reproducible. Following are details:
We have a table with several rows. CellEditors are CCombo type (editable). When user starts changing the value of the cell and decide to move to another cell (by mouse click) the latest/edited value of the previous cell is not set.
The same problem is not present if these cells are Combo type.
This look like CCombo bug.
... Bosko
thx, Bosko

buginformation.summary: Class and Object Interactions don't display any information on host and monitor level
buginformation.description: Class and Object Interactions don't display any information on host and monitor level although there are active processes underneath.

buginformation.summary: Home/End keys do nothing in UML2SD Object Interaction view
buginformation.description:
Steps to reproduce: ------------------- 1. Launch a java process and profile it. 2. Right click on an agent and select "Open with -> UML2SD Object Interactions" from the context menu. 3. In the resulting view, click on a call line that does not fit the screen. 4. Hit the Home/End keys.
What should happen is that it should cause the screen to scroll to visualize the end/beginning of the call. It didn't do that when I tried to do it... =(
This may be a simple matter of user error, but opening this bugzilla just in case it's not...

buginformation.summary: [Navigator] Provide ability for users to add filters to base UI Navigator view interface
buginformation.description:
Problem/Feature Request: In the base Navigator view (e.g. as in Resources perspective) there is no way for the casual user to add their own filters.
Workaround/Warning:
As an unofficial "workaround", you can edit {WebSphere Studio Install Dir}\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.ui_2.1.1\plugin.xml ... <extension point="org.eclipse.ui.resourceFilters"> <filter selected="false" pattern=".*"> </filter> <filter selected="false" pattern="EJS*"> </filter> </extension> ... to add a filter in the base workbench/eclipse Navigator View. In this case I added the "EJS*" filter. It works, but is not officially supported. You can use this at you own discretion. However any core workbench problems reported with any such change present are not be supported.
At the current time, the only sanctioned way to add a filter to the Navigator view, is to create separate plugin and contribute the filters instead of modifying an existing product plugin. The UI is a separate plug-in in core Eclipse which happens to own this base Navigator view. WebSphere Studio Workbench or Eclipse development does not support any modification to the base. The UI plug-in is part of that base.
Example: In WSAD v5.x there is a large set of filters in the base Navigator view. The various plug-ins added these through a plug-in api()...etc. The good news is that apart from this sanctioned mechanism to add filters to the base Navigator view, adding a filter to the plugi-in.xml file of the UI file will ony affect the Navigator view. This change does not carry over to say the Explorer Package view of the Java perspective or the Project Navigator of the J2EE Perspective. Similarly any change to filters in a custom Navigator, such as adding a filter in the J2EE Project Navigator, will not show up in the base Navigator view. There is a clean and logical separation of concerns in the design.
Clearly, writing a plug-in is not an option for many users or an activity they may wish to invest time in to just a filter(s). Our customers raised the need to be able to add filters to the base Navigator for general use across all perspectives. This basic add filter capability is present in base Navigators of other IDE technologies.
I have create this eclipse bugzilla defect/feature request to provide a add/remove user filters capabilty in the UI Navigator GUI (e.g. an add filter button at minimum,and maybe a remove button restricted to filters not associated with a plug-in).
Thanks, Bob D

buginformation.summary: Overview does not change density during Zoom In and Zoom Out in Class/Object Interactions
buginformation.description: Linux - GTK When I Zoom in and Zoom out in the class interaction view, and hit the (+) button. The overview does change its size and density.

buginformation.summary: [Coolbar] Binary Compat: IToolBarManager.update method doesn't work
preserve formating of xdoclet tags in java comments
Refactor: Invoke rename refactoring from editor
buginformation.description: Refactoring needs to be invoked from editor using the selection parser.

buginformation.summary: UI generation problems, JVM Terminating while using Hyades
buginformation.description:
Found using WSWB 3.0 M8 driver + Eclipse Hyades 3.0 20040309_1448 driver.
Steps to reproduce: ------------------- 1. Start Eclipse. 2. Open the Profiling and Logging perspective. 3. Select Run -> Profile... 4. Double click on External Java Application to create a new configuration. 5. On the right hand side, click on the Profiling tab. 6. In the section labelled "Select a profiling set:", select "Memory Analysis". 7. Click on the Close button to close this dialog. When you are prompted to sve changes, select NO. 8. Select Run -> Profile... 9. Select the configuration that was just created earlier. 10. On the right hand side, click on the Profiling tab.
When I do that, the two "tables" seems to look very different, like there were problems generating those two widgets. If you try to resize the dialog box, Eclipse will freeze, then crash, giving a JVM Terminated message.

buginformation.summary: IType#newSupertypeHierarchy(pm) returns incomplete hierarchy
buginformation.description:
IType#newSupertypeHierarchy(pm) returns an incomplete hierarchy.
To see the problem, start a Change Method Signature refactoring, and try to add an exception (e.g. IllegalArgumentException). The dialog complains that the Exception is not an exception, but it is. Same problem in "Add Java Exception Breakpoint" dialog.
You can set a breakpoint in ChangeExceptionsControl#checkException(IType) to see it happen: The hierarchy on the binary type IllegalArgumentException only includes one superclass, instead of the whole hierarchy.
Might be related to bug 53500 .

buginformation.summary: background colors in labels for warning/errors/csv status
buginformation.description:
Actually label decorations for warning/errors/cvs conflicts are only represented by a small icon or a ">" sign. Sometimes it's really difficult to see such small labels, expecially if you have more decorations.
Allowing users to select a backgroung/foreground color for labels will really improve user experience.
A similar feature is currently implemented in instantiations codepro, but only using custom views (they call them package explorer+, resources+). It sound strange to reimplement views only to add a (also if useful) background color... it would be really great to have a support for this feature available in the base UI framework, so that could be used in any view.
This is a screeshot from codepro colored view: http://www.instantiations.com/codepro/ws/docs/images/package_explorer_plus_view . gif
And the preference page where users can choose colors: http://www.instantiations.com/codepro/ws/docs/images/preferences_browsers.gif
This would be a nice addiction in the new [workbench]->[colors and fonts] preference page just added with the new look'n feel.

buginformation.summary: Possible mislabelled title in Profiling preferences page
buginformation.description:
Found in WSWB 3.0 M8 + Hyades 3.0 20040309_1448 driver.
Steps to reproduce: ------------------- 1. Start Eclipse. 2. Profile a java process for a while, then terminate it.
If you look at the Profiling Monitor view, you should see (by default) only three types of "things": Processes, Logging agents, and Profiling agents.
Now, if you go to the Preferences -> Profiling and Logging -> Appearance, you will see a section labelled "Show these resources in the Profiling Monitor view:". If you look in the contents of that section, you'll find that the Processes, Logging agents, and Profiling agents checkboxes are NOT checked, while Folders, Monitors, and Hosts ARE checked. If you uncheck everything, you'll notice that *everything* is shown in the Profiling Monitor view (contrary to what the label indicates).
I think the section's label should actually say: "Hide these resources in the Profiling Monitor view:".

buginformation.summary: [ContextMgmt] Enhance ContextManagerEvent
buginformation.description:
I propose the following API for ContextManagerEvent. These are the methods I'd like the event to have (no more and no less). getContextManager() submissionAdded(String contextId) submissionRemoved(String contextId) contextEnabled(String contextId) contextDisabled(String contextId) contextDefined(String contextId)
We in debugland want to know when submissions are added in order to promote views. It's important that we hear about submissions, not just enablement. A context will stay enabled for the life of a debug session, but we want to react when the user's selection switches between enabled contexts. Telling us when submissions are added is basically a way for us to know which context is the "most active." The story we want to implement in debug land is:
Responding to context changes: 1. When a debugging context is enabled, actions bound to that context appear (the workbench gives us this for free). 2. When a debugging context is submitted, views bound to that context appear (our code). 3. When a debugging context is disabled, actions bound to that context disappear (the workbench gives us this for free). 4. When a debugging context is disabled, views bound to that context and no other active context are closed (our code).
Activating contexts: 1. When an element in the Debug view is selected (and the element provides the right adapter), we submit a context request. 2. We keep a mapping of launches to the context requests they've submitted. A launch won't maintain more than one submission per context id. If it tries (say, by selecting multiple stack frames), a new request will be submitted and then the old one will be removed. 3. When a launch terminates, all context submissions from that launch are removed.

buginformation.summary: [Contexts] Renamed EnabledSubmission to ContextSubmission
buginformation.description:
The type EnabledSubmission would be better named ContextSubmission. Clients browsing for context-related APIs generally look for types named *context*. Since the name has no relation to contexts, it's difficult to remember. And lastly, the name is almost oxymoronic. While the API may say "add" and "remove" EnabledSubmissions, clients logically think of this as enabling and disabling the submissions. Just saying "then we disable our EnabledSubmission" makes my head hurt. :)
I think it's cleaner to call them ContextSubmissions, because that's what clients are really doing - submitting a context.

buginformation.summary: progress, background operations, and novice users
buginformation.description:
Build I20030304
There has been much discussion elsewhere about insufficiently visible progress indications for builds. I'd like to raise a more general issue about the kind of feedback that will help novice users of Eclipse. If it helps, think of my mom as the user (you can imagine that she's not too comfortable with computers<g>).
The problem is that when the user performs any command that will complete sometime later in the background, whether it be build, synchronize, or whatever, she needs to know this immediately. I mean "in your face" immediately. A smoldering cigarette in the lower right corner of the screen does signal this to the novice user, even when accompanied by a slightly larger hover. Something as unmistakable as a 2.1 modal progress dialog is what we're talking about. The reason why its so important for the novice is that they expect the commands they give to happen in the background (a more sophisticated notion). Novice users are more familiar with simple turn-taking UIs. The other nice thing about the old progress dialogs is that they automatically went away when the operation was done, and that told the user that it was again their turn.
Here's one way I could see addressing this problem: - Workbench preference "Progress dialogs for background operations" vs. "No Progress dialogs for background operations". Default value: Yes. - Background operations initiated by the user's direct command (as opposed to periodically scheduled operations like bg refreshes or indirectly triggers operations like table tree widget population) are covered by a progress dialog of the familiar size unless suppressed by that users preference. - The progress dialog is non-modal, and will close automatically when the operation is finished. The dialog reports progress on the user's direct command, and has a Cancel button. The fine print at the bottom of dialog could inform the user that they are free to wait or to do other things as they choose (i.e., it hints that it's non-modal). - If the clicks on the workbench window, the progress dialog disappears behind it, and the user can go ahead and explore. - When the operation completes, the progress dialog closes automatically whether or not it is visible. - If the operation fails, the user needs an in-you-face notification. - If the user issues another long-running command that runs in the background, an additional progress dialog should open for that operation, and disappear when it's done.
If you combine this with the other progress mechanisms added in 3.0, I think we end up with something that will satisfy the needs of novices and gearheads alike.

buginformation.summary: dynamically importet package problems when uninstalling bundle
buginformation.description:
From Martin Lippert on the newsgroup...
I tried to following:
- bundle A exports a package via Export-Package. - bundle B dynamically imports that package via DynamicImport-Package. - a method of bundle B is called that creates an Object from the mentioned package.
Everything works fine until I uninstall bundle A (via the console). As a result of uninstalling bundle A (and a refresh) nothing happens to bundle B...
From Jeff McAffer on the newsgroup...
Hmmm, this seems like a bug. As Pascal mentioned, dynamically importing from A does not affect B's ability to resolve but once B is actually running and loading classes from A, it is dependent on A. Uninstalling A (and refreshing) should cause B to stop and restart. It can restart even with A gone because it did not explicilty rely on A, it just dynamically imported stuff that happened to come from A.
If I have characterized this correctly, could you enter a bug report against Equinox/OSGi with details? Simple test case would also be cool.

buginformation.summary: [RCP] Need API for configuring fast view bar initial location
buginformation.description:
build I20040310
In bug 52588 , Sebastian Davids requests: There should be a way to set the initial docking state (BOTTOM/RIGHT/LEFT) of the fast view bar as well.

buginformation.summary: Watchpoint refactoring support for field rename
buginformation.description: A watchpoint should be updated (recreated) when the field it is watch is renamed.

buginformation.summary: Symptom DB editor's overall presentation could be improved
buginformation.description:
Here are 3 fairly simple suggestions for improving the overall presentation of the symptom DB editor:
1. Display a title at the top of the editor. If you look at other editors of this style (e.g. plugin.xml, build.properties, extension point schemas), there is always a title, except for the source tab.
2. Do we really need the "Overview" tab? It doesn't give the user an overview of the symptom database, but shows the file details from the properties. If you look at the PDE's plugin.xml editor's overview, it gives an overview of what's in the other tabs, in a condensed form.
3. When initially opening the editor, there is nothing selected and the right side of the editor is blank. Perhaps it would be better to initially select the symptom database (root item), to display the database's values, like name, description, etc. This way, the right side will never be blank.

buginformation.summary: no program-name available when attaching to an agent
buginformation.description:
Holger Machens: --------------- I'm implementing an own profiling agent for special purposes. If the agent is listed in the "Attach Java Process" wizard the process is always called unknown. We need a way to tell the RAC the right name of the process the agent is running on.
Paul Slauenwhite: ----------------- The 'unknown' label in the Attach Java Process" wizard is used if the process does not have a name property set on the org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.control.Process implementation.
The 'unknown' process name is always used when attaching to a Java process (e.g. local or remote). If the user is launching a Java process (e.g. local or remote), the entered process (e.g. class name) is used as the process name.

buginformation.summary: [runtime] prefs: service searching should accept paths
buginformation.description: #getInt,etc should accept a null qualifier and the keys may be full paths. (qualifier could be first segment)

buginformation.summary: [Workbench] When eclipse fails because of concurrent sessions, a path to the .lock file should be displayed
buginformation.description:
A dialog with the following message is displayed when Eclipse fails because the workspace is opened in another session:
"Another session is already running in the associated workspace. If this is not the case, please delete the ".lock" file in the workspace ".metadata" directory and try starting the platform again."
It would be easier for the user to correct the problem if the message referred to the complete path to the .lock file instead, e.g.:
"An instance of Eclipse seems to be already running in the selected workspace C:\Eclipse\workspace
If you believe this not to be the case, delete the file C:\Eclipse\workspace\.metadata\.lock and try again."

buginformation.summary: [Problems] Problems view is selected automatically and flashy
buginformation.description:
This is for integration view 200403100800. Using a Java perspective I select a project. The Problems shows up selected. I click on other views, the Problems view is still selected. Only when I select the Problems view, then another view is deselected.
I have a filter on the problems, to show only the problems on any resource of the selected project.

buginformation.summary: Plugin and Fragment build properties options, missing add button
buginformation.description:
(Eclipse Release 3.0, Milestone 7)
Test environment: AIX 5.3, CDE, using the JVM that came bundled with Eclipse, Mozilla (most recent version I could find for AIX).
This was discovered during verification of Release 3.0 Milestone 7 on AIX. The following was taken from the testing matrix given to verify Eclipse:
*** description: Tailor plug-in and fragment build properties to control what files included in the package
*** test case: 7.8.0.1.12
*** steps: Open the build.properties file of the respective 'Plugin' Projects to open the 'Build Properties' manifest editor.
*** desired outcome: Build script variables and replacement values manifest editor is shown
*** result: Fail
*** details: Doing the specified actions goes to the 'Build Configuration' page.
*** test case: 7.8.0.1.13
*** steps: Click "Add" button for both the Build script variable and Replacement values
*** desired outcome: Variables and replacement values are created
*** results: Fail
*** details: There is no 'Add' Button

observe: the UI claims that textui.TestRunner has 1 match, but if you open the editor you see 3 matches.

buginformation.summary: Select correlation created when open UML2SD view from Log View
buginformation.description: default

buginformation.summary: extract method: convert continue to return when extracting loop body [refactoring]
Updating through http proxy (almost) locks PC with 100% CPU usage
buginformation.description: I've correctly specified the http proxy for updates, which requires authentication (NTLM by default, although has also worked with basic for other applications, Java and non-Java) on a different domain than the client or proxy. Non-NTLM authentication requires the "AUTH-DOMAIN\username" format for the username. As soon as the updater requires some http communication, the java process hits 100% cpu usage, severely crippling other processes (i.e. they're "as slow as molasses in January"). This continues indefinitely unless Cancel is pressed.

buginformation.summary: IDEApplication.checkJavaRuntimeVersion() fails for JDK 1.4.1_01
buginformation.description: I'm running with JDK 1.4.1_01 and the new logic to check for adequate version numbers is failing, I assume because of the _01. Any attempt to launch results in a message saying I require at least Java 1.4.1.

buginformation.summary: IDEApplication.checkInstanceLocation is throwing up an error dialog
buginformation.description: There seems to be a problem with instanceLoc.lock() in this method in a runtime workbench (perhaps otherwise too?). The .lock() method is returning false and then the checkInstanceLocation method drops to the error dialog and then fails. The workbench cannot be started.

buginformation.summary: Package explorer does not update correctly
buginformation.description: I am using 3.0M7. To reproduce, try to restore a file from the attic. For me it will 100% not show up in the package explorer - unless I close and reopen the project anfterwards. Even a refresh on the project does not change anything.

buginformation.summary: Cannot drag views over editor area
buginformation.description:
Using I200403160800
Drag a view over the edge of the editor area. Previously it was possible to dock the view with the edge of the editor area. This is no longer possible.

buginformation.summary: BIDI: lack of ability to change orientation of widget in runtime [con't]
buginformation.description: Continued discussion of bug #29779 The number of attachments on bug #29779 exceeded the limit processable by the CGI scripts with Bugzilla. Some attachments have been moved here.

buginformation.summary: Launch Configuration dialogs only know about Run and Debug modes.
buginformation.description:
If you add an additional launch mode, say "program", in addition to the usual "run" and "debug" modes, various bits in the UI don't know about the mode. For instance, org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.LaunchConfigurationsDialog makes a button that says "Run" or "Debug", and there is no facility to extend this to add additional modes.
To make the main action button read "Program", a lot of code duplication and extension is required. It seems like this would easily be more data driven.

buginformation.summary: Right-Click in Eclipse under Solaris UltraSparc 5
buginformation.description: When I do a right click within Solaris, eclipse crashs. Eclipse will be closed and the error message / reason appears.

buginformation.summary: getting_started.txt file refers to RAStart.sh
buginformation.description: getting_started.txt file in the <unzip directory> refers to RAStart.sh. This shouldn't be there, since in the Hyades 3.0 driver there are no RAStart/RAStop shell scripts, and the RAC should be started using the RAServer executable.

buginformation.summary: FileDialog not handling multi select well
buginformation.description:
Platform: SuSE Linux 8.1 (GTK 2.0.6 and motif)
Description:
When bringing up a FileDialog and doing the following steps, I get an empty selection at the end.
1. Project properties -> Java build path 2. Select Libraries -> Add External Jars... 3. Select and three files with SHIFT. 4. Deselect middle file with CTRL. 5. Note that selection is now empty. Hit OK. Nothing is added to build path.
If you add the same jars using CTRL everything is fine. I have tried this on motif and have had no trouble.

buginformation.summary: Reminder: XML node -> schema association not optimal
buginformation.description:
Extension elements from the old model used to cache matching schema and schema elements. In order to avoid class cast exception, we are now looking these objects up all the time. This may be a bottle neck when there are many extensions in a file and many schemas in the workspace.
This is a reminder to revisit this and consider caching them as in the old model if we encounter performance problems.

buginformation.summary: Update wizard only works if eclipse directory in $HOME
buginformation.description:
I have been having problems with my eclipse install...namely the update wizard not working (could be more, but haven't found them yet). I've narrowed it down to a $PATH problem I believe. Namely I can download a binary.zip extract it into my home directory, and run it from within that directory and all is well. But if I move the same (freshly unzipped) binary into /opt/ it no longer works (I have taken care to delete all 'workspaces' and '.eclipse*' directories for each test).I have also ensured that /opt/eclipse is in my $PATH and that the user has rw permisions for the eclipse directory.
I. Steps to reproduce. 1. Unzip eclipse-binary into home directory. 2. Enter Directory and start eclipse. 3. Go to Help-->Software Updates-->Update Manager-->select an update/package/etc. 4. Click install 5. Go through wizard and related license agreements 6. Accept default install location, click finish....works 7. Repeat 1-5 replacing /* with $HOME, no install location available, cannot add install location, click finish.....error II. Relevent Errors and output: 1. "Install Location" is empty and cannot add new Install Location in the update wizard when installed in other than $HOME -)Click finish: java.lang.NullPointerException -) Sometimes the "Finish" button is greyed out...so your simply stuck III. buginformation.summary: parser/indexer ignores stand-alone header files
buginformation.description: If I create a stand-alone header file inside my project (e.g. a class declaration with all inline methods, so it does not require a .cpp for the body) the header is not indexed, and consequently the type information is missing from the "Open Type" dialog. It might be debatable whether non-#include'd external headers should be picked up, but I think header files inside a project should always be indexed, regardless of whether they are #include'd or not.

buginformation.summary: [Icons] Bring back non-color workbench toolbar icons
buginformation.description: I20040317 There used to be an option in Preferences > Workbench > Appearance > Show color icons in toolbars. This option has disappeared and the icons are always shown in color in the latest I-Build.

buginformation.summary: Table widget does not send events for check-box state change
buginformation.description: The 'org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Table' widget used to invoke the widgetSelected() method on registered selection listeners when the user changes state of a check-box. The table's content is comprised of the 'org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TableItem' objects. Eclipse 3.0 M7 works properly but it is broken in M8 (0304 build).

buginformation.summary: Preference to switch perspective on suspend is too eager
buginformation.description: The preference to switch perspectives "when a breakpoint is hit" actually prompts to do so every time the program suspends. It should only respond to suspension for breakpoints. Not step ends, evaluation completions, etc.
