buginformation.summary: No context change in editors when right mouse button clicked
buginformation.description:
When you click the right mouse button within an editor, the context menu for the current cursor position appears, no matter where the user clicked.
In my opinion, a context change should be performed first when the user clicks. That is, the context menu should appear for the position the user right-clicked on.
As far as I know, the current behaviour is not the usual one in an editor. For example, UltraEdit and MS Word change the context first. At least, it is not the behaviour I expect.

buginformation.summary: [Colors/Fonts] Pref Page Worbench/Colors and Fonts; double mnemonic a
buginformation.description: The mnemonic 'a' on Category is already taken by the Apply button.

buginformation.summary: [DND] pen users inadventently dragging and dropping parts
buginformation.description:
Build I20040316
I've notice I've been accidentally splitting editor windows and views a lot lately (couple of times a day). This never used to happen to me.
I use a pen (stylus) rather than an mouse. Us pen users are much more likely to issue "slurred" mouse presses rather stationary ones; i.e., the mouse up event location is usually different from where the corresponding mouse down event happened.
What's happening to me is this: I click on the "Problems" tab to bring it to the fore. But my slur while hitting the tab is interpreted as dragging the Problems view and placing it above the view stack. A similar thing happens to me with editors when I go for the little chevrons: I end up splitting the editor pane.
As I mentioned, this is a new mistake that I'm making with the UI. Hopefully something can be done to make the workbench UI less error-prone for pen users.

buginformation.summary: Adapt Search to new encoding support
buginformation.description: default

buginformation.summary: Merge does not see files/dirs deleted in stream where changes come from
buginformation.description:
I'm using build I200403171300.
I want to merge a specific stream (branch JDK_1_5) of a project starting from the version where the branch was created (Root_JDK_1_5) with changes made in HEAD stream.
After the merge is done, I can see all created and modified files displayed in synchronize view but not files (or dirs) which were deleted in HEAD...
Set severity to major as it's really painful to identify each time I merge (every 2 days) all files deleted in HEAD stream and delete them manually in my JDK_1_5 workspace after the merge...

buginformation.summary: Configurator should filter out faetures not applicable to current environment
buginformation.description: The update configurator creates the first platform.xml by picking up the most recent version of all the features present on the local site. However, features with OS/WS/etc settings not applicable to the current environment should be filtered out. Note that this not happen now because each eclipse drop is for a particular environment, but it is a possible scenario.

buginformation.summary: [Sync View] property propagation doesn't work well with hierarchical folders
buginformation.description:
With compressed folders adding/removing properties works well. But in the folder case it seems that removals don't traverse all the way up the tree.
Need a test for this.

public void doSomething(Object |

Assist and finish public void doSomething(Object object) { | }
Assist and continue public void doSomething(Object object,|

buginformation.summary: Classpath issue
buginformation.description:
hi, I was using Eclipse (Version: 3.0.0, Build id: 200403100800) till yesterday. When I downloaded (Version: 3.0.0, Build id: 200403170800). I am running a Windows XP machine with the JDK 1.5.0 beta. My project though uses the JDK 1.4.2_03 version to compile and the launch configs also uses the same 1.4.x JDK.
In the project classpath, I have the following jars in the classpath: jce1_2_2.jar, sunjce_provider.jar (in that order) followed by the org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JRE_CONTAINER line. With the older (200403100800) eclipse version, i am able to run fine, but with the later one, the launch is not able to get to the javax.crypto.Cipher class (from the jce1_2_2 jar) and so our authentication mechanism fails.
Could this be resolved easily?

buginformation.description:
UI does not display Logging Agents using the Hyades 3.0 Data Collection Engine.
For example, using the Hyades Apache Commons Logging Sample, trying to attach to the org.eclipse.hyades.logging.commons.sample.HyadesLoggingCommonsSample Logging Agent (e.g. Run >> Profile >> Attach >> org.eclipse.hyades.logging.commons.sample.HyadesLoggingCommonsSample) with logging enabled (see the example's readme), the org.eclipse.hyades.logging.commons.sample.HyadesLoggingCommonsSample Logging Agent did not appear in the UI's list of Agents.

buginformation.summary: [osgi] Align EclipseStarter and Launcher
buginformation.description:
Sure a minor issue, but I didn't want to end up fogetting this...
It looks like EclipseStarter should not be in the org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor. As far as I could see, it is completely independent on the framework adaptor in use. The current situation suggests the contrary.

buginformation.summary: Property not saved on Run-time Workbench's Tracing page
buginformation.description:
I20040318
1. open an existing Run-time workbench launch config 2. switch to "Tracing" tab 3. select and check org.eclipse.jdt.ui plug-in 4. change one of the properties to false 5. press Apply 6. press Close 7. repeat step 1 and 2 ==> changes are lost
I know I could change the file. If that's the intention then the page should be read-only.

buginformation.summary: non NLS'd status message during synchronization
buginformation.description:
create source project org.eclipse.jdt.ui choose Team:Share Project... from the context menu choose eclipse CVS server (:pserver: anonymous@dev.eclipse.org :/home/eclipse) use project name as module name finish answer yes to synchronize select HEAD
status/progress area says "Reconciling project {0} with remote folder {1} org.eclipse.jdt.uiorg.eclipse.jdt.ui: 27% done"

buginformation.summary: Plugin.xml editor, add a browse button for plugin class
buginformation.description: If I want to add a plugin class, I must manually type it in. It would be better if there were a browse button and class chooser dialog.

buginformation.summary: templates do not appear in content assist when expected
buginformation.description: Occasionally the fileset template does not appear in the content assist when expected. Sometimes it reappears after a short delay.

buginformation.summary: 600% progress?
buginformation.description:
I20040318 (the second one)
If I perform a CVS update across several progress, the % complete progress indication goes up to x00%, where x is the number of projects being synchronized. For example, if I select one file in each of five projects (say, the .project files), the progress goes up to 500%. If I only update a single project at a time, the numbers look fine.

buginformation.summary: Help document shown programmatically does not shows TOC
buginformation.description:
Scenario:
1) Start Eclipse with some activites disabled (e.g. PDE) 2) Create an action that shows a topic from PDE doc book using 'showHelpResource' 3) Observe: the document is shown, but the toc is not, and pressing on the button to sync up the toc does nothing
This happens in the new Welcome from the Overview page, where there is a link to show overview for PDE. Initially, PDE activity is disabled.
Although Welcome could enable PDE activity before showing the topic, this is not desirable. Users could enable a bunch of activies by clicking on various overviews in Welcome before setting their foot in the workbench.
We can do several things:
1) Acknowledge that the user wants to know more about the documents that belong to the currently disabled activity and temporarily suspend filtering for that particular activity
2) Not expand the TOC initially, but do it when the tool bar button is pressed
3) Show these topics and the book itself in gray or some other (different) color to emphasise that they are currently disabled
Either way, it would be nice if we handle this (at least partially) for M8.

buginformation.summary: ClassCastException in LaunchViewEventHandler
Share project is broken
buginformation.description:
Gentoo, KDE, I20040318 (& I20040317, I20040316)
If you try to share a project that already exists on the server (ie/ you've disconnected, chosen to delete CVS information, and then decide to share it again), it just "doesn't work".
To reproduce: 1. Try to reshare your project. Work through all of the prompts (in my case it was off of HEAD) 2. At the final screen ("Module '<name>' already exists remotely. Would you like to synchronize your local project with the existing remote module?") select "Ok". If you have your CVS console up, you'll see all of the standard updating messages run by. Then, after it's done (ie/ after it's printed "ok (took <time>)\n***" nothing happens. IE/ there is no cpu activity, no disk activity, and the "Ready to share project" window just sits there (busy cursor if your go over it).
Nothing in log.

buginformation.summary: Runtime Workbench launcher should expose boostrap entries
buginformation.description:
Up until now, the runtime workbench launcher never had the need to expose the bootstrap entries to the user. This is because the only entry necessary is the location of the Main class, and PDE takes charge of looking for this class in the workspace/target platform and locating the right one.
When launching a runtime workbench with a profiler such as Yourkit, a JAR needs to be added to the bootstrap classpath entries. Therefore, we need to expose a text field in the launcher so that the user can add these entries, and we would just append them to the PDE-computed value.

buginformation.summary: Unsupported protocol SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_3.7.1p1
buginformation.description: When I try to use my cvs-account over ssh, I get an I/O-exception stating the abovementioned error - wich makes the cvs-part of your otherwise excellent program unusable for me.

buginformation.summary: IntroduceFactoryRefactoring: contains e.printStackTrace() code
buginformation.description:
I20040318
This has to be removed for 3.0.

buginformation.summary: [Progress] showBusyCursorWhile doesn't reset cursor
buginformation.description:
There are two issues with the implementation of this method that could be fixed.
First, the way the it's currently implemented the busy cursor will only return to be un-busy after a predetermined 5 seconds. Even if the runnable finishes quickly the cursor has this weird delay. I suggest adding a hook so that the busy loop terminates when the runnable completes.
Also, if an exception occurs in #scheduleProgressMonitorJob() the busy flag is not reset and the loop in busycursorWhile won't complete.

buginformation.summary: Bundle name is not returned as translated string
buginformation.description: Bundle.getHeaders().get(BUNDLE_NAME) returns the bundle name as it appears in the plugin.xml. If the name was %pluginName (i.e. the pluginName is a key in plugin.properties), the result is %pluginName, but I was expecting to see the actual value out of plugin.properties. My workaround is to call Platform.getResourceString(bundle, bundle.getHeaders ().get(BUNDLE_NAME)) to get the translated string.

buginformation.summary: I18N: Outline view doesn't display method name correctly
Allow quick-correct Rename to fix Error tokens
buginformation.description:
When cutting & pasting or manually refactoring code, symbol name mismatches will often result in the same token being repeatedly marked as in error.
Automated 'bulk' renaming for such tokens would be highly desirable, but Ctrl-1 Quick Rename is not offered/ functional in such situations. Request: Quick Rename is my most favored tool and I would like to have it usable at all times. Perhaps even on its own key.
Minor comment: perhaps it's because I haven't saved/ compiled the file, but the quick fix offers only class methods and variable-creation fixes; the obvious parameter and local variable which would be the most obvious fixes are not offered. Too many alternatives for one keystroke where the only useful only (quick rename) is not available.
Quick Rename is pretty good. I like it (and want it) for use as a more powerful general 'local symbol reassigner' rather than just an occasional error-fix. eg to reassign method functionality from 'paramX', to method-calculated 'localX', to 'this.x', to 'infoObject.x', etc. There's solid use for this and we need something quicker than global refactorings.
Quick
While Quick Rename would be effective if the tokens were correctly resolvable, and would be the idealto reassign such references
occur though a correctly-typed and usable symbol exists

buginformation.summary: Delay on synch view Refresh button
buginformation.description:
1. Launch Eclipse. 2. Open the Synch view and click the Refresh button. 3. Go do something else while the refresh runs (on Linux, switch to another desktop workspace for maximum effect). 4. When finished, come back to Eclipse. 5. Instead of finding a completed refresh, find a dialog asking for the refresh scope.
I keep getting burned by this. The dialog to specify the refresh scope apparently opens after a delay. If pressing a button is going to open a dialog before proceeding, the dialog should open immediately.

buginformation.summary: [Sharing Wizard] Must improve handling of failed communications
buginformation.description:
Currently, if failures occur while populating a page, the next page is shown even though it's contents are not available. We need to override WizardDialog to prevent the next page from being shown.
Also, MVM saw some weirdness involving infinite prompts with invalid repo specs. This should be tested thouroughly.

buginformation.summary: Breakpoint does not have associated marker

buginformation.summary: getCharset should return parent's default charset when file does not exist
Generated Makefiles, directories should be marked as "derived" at creation
buginformation.description:
From CDT 2.0.0.200403040925.
0. Install the ClearCase plugin. CVS may have similar effects. 1. Create or put a Managed Make project under version control. You will be prompted to add the Project files. 2. Add a class. You will be prompted to add the CPP/H files. 3. Build it. You will be prompted to add the Release or Debug directories with all of the generated Makefile fragments and subdirectories within.
EXPECTED: All of the Release or Debug directories should typically not be added to ClearCase or CVS.
Excerpted from the Eclipse Help pages:
Any resource marked as derived will be automatically ignored for version management by Team CVS. Some builders, such as the Java builder, mark all of its build output (e.g. .class files) as derived.
This solution also works for ClearCase. It is also a cleaner solution I think to the problem of randomly-named configurations/ directories. (The other two inferior suggestions are .cvsignore and Prefs > Team > Ignored Resources)

buginformation.summary: [RCP] [ViewMgmt] want to have the possibility to dynamically change the tab name of the view for multiple view instances
buginformation.description:
on Eclipse RCP V3.0M7, it is possible to open dynamically multiple instances of a view : showView ( String view Id, String secondary Id, int mode)
the text shown in the tab of the view is tne name of the view defined in plugin.xml ( <view name=".." ). When you open several instances of a view, all of the tabs show this text.
The problem is that it is not possible to modify programmatically this text.
It is possible to see it but not to change it : IViewpart.getViewSite().getRegisteredName() gives the name of the view
Is it possible to have the setRegisteredName (String name) function ??

buginformation.summary: extra any elements created when new lines and spaces are used in the XML string
buginformation.description:
I have used the following XML fragment in a CBE XML string and I got one extra any element created in the CBE event, which contains a blank string:
XML fragment: (with 5 any elements) <any namespace="##other" processContents="skip" /> <any1 abc="def" /><any2>This is an any element</any2> <GetLastTrade><symbol>DEF</symbol></GetLastTrade><any3><xyz> a="b c" </xyz></any3>
this is the any attribute of the created CBE: (with 6 any elements)
any= EDataTypeEList (id=65) data= String[10] (id=100) [0]= "<any namespace="##other" processContents="skip" />" [1]= "<any1 abc="def" />" [2]= "<any2>This is an any element</any2>" [3]= "<GetLastTrade><symbol>DEF</symbol></GetLastTrade>" [4]= "<any3><xyz> a="b c" </xyz></any3>" =====> [5]= "" [6]= null [7]= null [8]= null [9]= null dataClass= Class (java.lang.String) (id=31) featureID= 11 modCount= 6 owner= CommonBaseEventImpl (id=61) =====> size= 6
Note: a new any element is created if the new lines and spaces appear in any place, before the any tags, after or even between them.

buginformation.summary: unable to launch plug-in unit tests
buginformation.description:
Build I200403230100
When I go to launch a plug-in JUnit test with an existing launch config, I get an error: "Errors running jobs ERROR: Launch : Resource /org.eclipse.core.resources does not exist."
I tried creating a new launch config, but get the same error.
One of my projects contains a reference to org.eclipse.core.resources, but I have no such project in my workspace (and haven't for a while). This used to be working for me (with 20030318).

buginformation.summary: [Progress] Double-clicking on statusline progress icon has no effect
buginformation.description:
build I20040323
If I double-click on the animated progress icon in the status line, it does not open the progress view. Clicking on the label does. The whole progress indicator should be responsive to double-click.

buginformation.summary: Improve performance of the time based correlator
buginformation.description: Improve execution time of the time based correlator algorithm.

buginformation.summary: [Font/Colour] Inactive tab color not applied to buttons
buginformation.description:
Build 20040323 Linux-GTK
The buttons on view toolbars retain the "correct" (native) color, while the toolbar around them take on the color of the "inactive tab". This looks really ooglay.
"Inactive tab" setting should *only* affect the tabs and not the toolbar (see Luc's bug 55322 ), but if the color's going to be applied to the toolbar it needs to be applied to the buttons too.

buginformation.summary: allow ordering in "Run As >" context menu
buginformation.description:
I find it confusing to the user that the launch shortcuts shown on the "Run >" context menu do not match those that appear in the "Run As" on the toolbar button. One is selection based, where the other is perspective based, which means you get different lists in each perspective.
I'd like to see the two lists always match, and preferrably using what is currently in the "Run >" context menu. Since the menu is dynamic, it is "correct" much more often and is based on the selection. The two options can share the selection context, so it should not require additional computation to (e.g.) show the Run As after using the context menu.

buginformation.summary: [ViewMgmt] can not programmatically move a view in a perspective
buginformation.description:
on Eclipse RCP, you must create a perspective with views and positions of theses views. But there is no API to move programmatically a view in the perspective at another place.
in the perspective , we have : IFolderLayout bottomRight = layout.createFolder("brID",IPageLayout.LEFT, 0.5f, layout.getEditorArea()); bottomRight.addView("RCPview4.OC1View");

buginformation.summary: Export preferences does not export code generation templates
buginformation.description:
When customising the type of code generation templates (e.g. new Java files, new Type etc.) the 'Export Preferences' button does not export any of them. Even selecting 'Code Generation' and cicking on export does not seem to add them in.
This may be a duplicate of 27926 or it may be that there are some other text-based preferences that are also not exported.
Tested against Eclipse 3.0M7 on Mac OS X.3 and also visible under Windows (2.1/3.0).

buginformation.summary: Synchronize view preferences appears to have labels in bold
buginformation.description:
When synchronizing, I went to the 'Preferences' pane (by clicking on the drop-down list, and selecting Preferences). Most of the labels appeared to be coming out as bold, rather than a more normal colour.
Testing against 3.0M7 on Mac OS X.3.3

buginformation.summary: [WorkingSets] deleted Working Sets not removed from Build working set menu
buginformation.description:
20040323
1. Project -> Build Working Set -> Select Working Set... 2. Create a new working set named "Test" with anything in it. 3. Project -> Build Working Set -> Select Working Set... 4. Select "Test" and "remove"
now, "Test" is gone, but it is still available in the Build Working Set submenu.
NOTE: When I do this again, with "Test2", it works correctly. This only fails the first time.

buginformation.summary: DCR - User specified column widths/number in Palette
buginformation.description:
As for the COLUMNS layout of PaletteViewer, user can customize the column number, say, 1, as the PaletteViewer always has only one column, and the children in it can either gets wider with the viewer or just remain the orginial size.
Thanks.

buginformation.summary: ctrl-o doesn't filter correctly
buginformation.description:
build i0323:2000, winxp, j9sc20031212
When I am using ctrl-o to open the outline pop-up, I am getting weird filtering behaviour when I am typing in partial method names.
I have field, imports, and packages filtered out via the ctrl-o filter options. I have the list sorted.
Will attach screen shot.

buginformation.summary: Loading a user library from file does not warn when overwriting an existing library [build path]
buginformation.description:
Works in I2004032400010 + plug-in export for I200403240800
Add library 'mylib'. Save it. Change it. Load library from file. ==> should warn that 'mylib' gets changed.

buginformation.summary: [EditorMgmt] WorkbenchPage#lastActiveEditor keeps reference on editor after closing all editors
buginformation.description:
I200403240800
After opening/using ~6 editors and then closing all, I found WorkbenchPage#lastActiveEditor referencing an editor.

buginformation.summary: [CoolBar] Off by one error in ToolBarContributionItem
buginformation.description:
build I20040323-0800
If ToolBarContributionItem.setMinimumItemCount is used, and the toolbar has only one item, you get an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException. It should index the item at 0, not 1.

buginformation.summary: Introduction page wizard not properly installing SWT examples
buginformation.description:
I20040324
- start Eclipse with a fresh workspace - On the introduction page, download the SWT samples - Select Stand-alone SWT launcher The wizard imports the org.eclipse.swt.examples and org.eclipse.swt.examples.launcher projects.
Problem: these projects are marked as depending on the org.eclipse.swt project which is missing. The projects don't compile and can't be used.

buginformation.summary: [Intro] Border around context help in intro view is missing edges
buginformation.description: With Intro view not maximized, click on the "Search" view and "Tasks" view. Intro shows context help for these with a black line around the context help. In canse of the "Search" the context help is missing bottom edge. In case of "Tasks", the context help vertical edges extend beyond the bottom edge.

buginformation.summary: [navigation] Quick outline: remembered size should be relative to the Editor
buginformation.description:
I20040324
I like to have the quick outline horizontally centered in the editor. If I now maximize the editor then the quick outline isn't centered anymore. Would be nice if this would be supported (may be by a special check box).

buginformation.summary: [Intro] Exception executing Java development tutorial
buginformation.description:
I20040324
1) Started a new workspace 2) Started the "Hello World" Java development tutorial 3) Successfully completed first step (switch to Java perspective) 4) On the "Create a Java project" step, clicked "Click to perform"
-> Error occurs. Log:
Error Mar 24, 2004 13:31:10.780 The specified action could not be run because the plugin specified could not be located.

buginformation.summary: [DND] Editor splitting, box moving.
buginformation.description:
I'm using a pair of datahands ( http://datahand.com ) with an integrated mouse and, while it is generally fantastic, the mouse does not offer sufficient precision to allow for repeatable box repositioning. ie: it is not always possible to d&d an editor tab to the right border, as the arrow may not show up, or may only represent the other side of the border. I have the same problems with window resizing, but that can be overcome by choosing size->[left|right|top|bottom] from the box menu. A similar solution in the box menu for repositioning would be very useful, ie: reposition->[left|right|top|bottom].
Andy

buginformation.summary: [Sync View] Shows modal progress in wizards
buginformation.description:
M8 contribution It looks really weird to have the wizards perform work, sometimes, long running, and not have the progress bar used in the wizard. Since the wizard ops are by definition modal we should run operations that way.
We may have to add some magic to provide a runnable context to object contributions so that they can run in the wizard. Although tricky it would provide for a better user experience.

buginformation.summary: [Sharing Wizard] Resize on sync page
buginformation.description:
M8 candidate I always find myself resizing the sharing wizard when the last page is shown. Basically it's unusable with the default size. There are two options: 1. provide better default wizard size, or 2. resize wizard when sync view page is shown
I seem to recall that jdt refactoring does wizard resizing when showing the preview of the changes.

buginformation.summary: [Workbench] Startup extension point should handle multiple <startup> elements
buginformation.description:
build I20040324
From bug 55901 :
The patch does not seem to handle the case where there are multiple <startup> elements in the same extension.
It should handle all the following cases:
<extension point="org.eclipse.ui.startup" /> - invoke IStartup.earlyStartup() on plugin class - no <startup> element necessary
<extension point="org.eclipse.ui.startup"> <startup/> </extension> - invoke IStartup.earlyStartup() on plugin class - <startup> element doesn't hurt
<extension point="org.eclipse.ui.startup"> <startup class="SomeClass"/> </extension> - invoke IStartup.earlyStartup() on SomeClass - <startup> element is required to specify explicit class
<extension point="org.eclipse.ui.startup"> <startup class="SomeClass"/> <startup class="SomeOtherClass"/> </extension> - invoke IStartup.earlyStartup() on both SomeClass and SomeOtherClass - <startup> element is required to specify explicit class

buginformation.summary: Log goes in config area then gets blown away by PDE
buginformation.description:
build I20040324-0800
Scenario: I want to run my RCP app as a runtime-workbench, where my workspace and/or install contain other plugins that I don't want picked up for free. Example: the RCP browser example
- load org.eclipse.ui.examples.rcp.browser - create a runtime workbench launch config for it - on the plugins page, carefully choose the plugins required: - org.eclipse.core.runtime - org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility - org.eclipse.osgi.* - org.eclipse.swt and its platform fragment - org.eclipse.jface - org.eclipse.ui - org.eclipse.ui.workbench - org.eclipse.ui.examples.rcp.browser - accidentally omit one of the above (in my case, it was the browser plugin (OK, so I'm sleep-deprived)) - run - the process comes up then terminates with no help - no workspace directory exists yet - PDE has blown away the config area, so there's no log to consult
This makes it really hard to debug this stuff, which is tricky enough to begin with. And I have a clue where to look. Novice RCP developers will not.
Is there anything that can be done, either in the runtime or PDE, to simplify this for M8?

buginformation.summary: [Global Sync] Global sync and workspace population
buginformation.description:
It would be nice if we could tie global sync to workspace population, at least for CVS. When I started up an empty workspace, the global sync button was in the toolbar. Selecting CVS gave me a page which stated there were no CVS projects in my workspace. It would be nice if the user was given the opportunity to create repository locations and checkout projects at this point.
I don't know if we want to have the checkout part of the global sync wizard in general but it would be really helpful if it was part of the no-project case.

buginformation.summary: Infocenter opens on busy port
buginformation.description:
I have apache running on port 80. Starting help infocenter on this port produces no error. Infocenter is running. Content cannot be displayed as this port is served by apache. A consequence is also that infocenter cannot be closed programatically. Issuing command to shutdown does nothing and reports a time out. Infocetner can only be killed brutally.
The error about port being taken is produced but it is being logged in the catalina.*.log. and otherwise ignored. Infocenter should report it on the command line and exit.

buginformation.summary: Consistency in space at top of launch configuration tabs
buginformation.description:
Some of the tabs have space at the top, some do not.
I would propose we be consistent and have no space at the top of the tabs.
This helps with the requirements of the tabs fitting on the screen when using high contrast.
